items.title: Head of Customer Experience
items.content:
Mirror. Signal. Career manoeuvre. Check.

 

Splend was created to give people from all walks of life the freedom to earn an income through driving. We’re looking for ambitious people, ready to join our journey and make a difference in people’s lives. 

 

We take great pride in our teams, who are as diverse as our members. We’re an industry-leading company looking for ambitious leaders who want to define the future – not just for on-demand driving, but for all of our members and each other.

 

The Role

 

We are looking for an exceptionally talented Head of Customer Experience who will work alongside our VP Operations and our global team as we continue on the exciting and challenging journey to a future where every on-demand driver can be successful.

 

You’ll be responsible for building the CX function by exploring what we have done to date, consolidating existing activities and building on this to create a category-leading customer experience.  This role should appeal if you are passionate about:

 


  • Building long-term competitive advantage through innovation and a superior customer experience

  • Developing knowledge and understanding of our customers to acquire and retain them, solve their problems, and improve lifetime value

  • Promoting the customer perspective and making sure it is reflected in our product, delivery and value proposition

  • Rigorously measuring the factors that drive the quality of customer experience

  • Building tools and metrics that contribute to data-driven decision-making

  • Promoting a customer-oriented culture





Responsibilities




    • Ultimate owner for everything customer-related

    • Create and manage a compelling customer experience vision

    • Balance trade-off between customer experience and cost-to-serve

    • Develop a CX strategy and drive it across the company

    • Provide input in key customer-related decisions in product development, marketing and branding

    • Create strategies for customer success and customer experience

    • Design, build and implement structures and processes for customer success, which will support company-wide customer acquisition, retention and customer value enhancement practices

    • Implement targeted campaigns to increase customer loyalty, retention, and satisfaction

    • Organise and implement customer feedback processes to establish deep customer knowledge (for the benefit of CX and also Product)Own customer service software / tools & resolution processes that will support the customer experience strategy

    • Help create a strong, customer-centric culture

    • Provide input into employee-engagement related initiatives

    • Define customer experience KPIs and cascade them across the org

    • Track and reach customer experience targets

    • Design, orchestrate, and improve customer experiences across interactions

    • Prioritise customer experience initiatives and episodes to be improved

    • Ensure consistent customer delivery

    • Ensure alignment of back-end systems to support customer strategy







Requirements




    • Great academic track record at leading schools

    • Minimum five years’ experience in operational roles in startups or scaleups, ideally operating across more than one geographic location

    • Experience building analytical, data-driven, processes

    • Ability to operate with autonomy

    • Someone who is comfortable operating at high speed (maybe breaking things occasionally, but always fixing them and learning from the experience)

    • Strong commercial, customer-centric and deeply resourceful thinking

    • Analytical, logical, obsessed with detail and process

    • Ability to interact and work in a creative, cross-functional, global team

    • Must be excited by the scale and complexity of the challenge, driven by ambitious goals and willing to do anything to make them happen

    • Desirable, but not mandatory; previous roles in a Customer Experience team at a later stage business, or managing the team at a smaller business






Culture and Rewards

 

Most places split these sections into two, but we only need two sentences to describe the culture at Splend.

 

We work hard for our members, and we celebrate our achievements. Nothing great happens in isolation, and so we simultaneously push and support one another to identify uncharted realms of greatness.

 

So how about it? You want in? Click the 'Apply' button!

 

Splend does not, under any circumstances, make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of any prohibited ground, including but not limited to race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, provincial, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy.

 

Splend is committed to a healthy, safe and inviting work environment where harassment of any kind will not be tolerated.

 

If you haven't heard back from us within 30 days, please assume you have been unsuccessful on this occasion.

items.title: Program Manager
items.content:
Program Manager at ARDX

Remote

Location: Remote

Department Name

Description

ARDX is seeking highly motivated, organized, forward looking and adaptable Security Program Manager to lead a team of security assessment professionals to implement and evolve CMS’ security controls assessment program. This is a dynamic environment requires agility to evolve, document and stabilize the assessment methods, processes and capabilities that will leverage your considerable expertise in compliance frameworks and policy support. Leading a key element of the customers overall security program requires a firm understanding of the CMS environment, and the ability to communicate and coordinate with a diversity of systems owners and stakeholders and help to evolve the compliance program. If you are looking for a position with flexibility in your primary work location, supporting a leading-edge customer, then this could be the job for you. This position supports the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.

Duties:

  • Lead the assessment lifecycle, from initial planning, scheduling, communications with systems owners and related stakeholders through to final reporting.
  • Manage all deliverables and support quality assurance processes.
  • Partners with our clients and systems owners across the organization to communicate and implement new security standards, policies and practices and to make continual improvements and increase the effectiveness of security programs.
  • Participates in the planning, development and implementation of staff training.
  • Works with the client and internal organizations to establish reliable data associated with critical goals or other key performance indicators that help the client reach their business objectives.
  • Coordinates resources and ensures adequately security and technology coverage.
  • Analyzes effectiveness, productivity and profitability and makes recommendations and/or changes as appropriate.
  • Coaching and mentoring and formally evaluating the performance of direct reports.
  • Handles employee complaints, grievances and investigations.
  • Develops and maintain plans for the effective deployment of security staff and programs throughout the program through combinations of staffing, technology, training, education and awareness.
  • Develops and updates operational security program documentation. This includes but is not limited to policies, procedures and training documents.
  • Ensures timeliness and quality of all deliverables.

Required Qualifications:

  • 15+ years of experience with information assurance or Cybersecurity
  • Expertise in federal regulations and security compliance requirements for civilian federal agencies (FISMA, NIST 800 series, Office of Management and Budget A-130, FedRAMP, etc.)
  • Conducting security control assessments using NIST SP 800-53, including preparation of complete authorization packages
  • ISSP, CISA or CISM certification
  • Experience in an organization with CMMI Level 4 or 5 appraisal is an advantage
  • Experience with supporting CMS and system security initiatives

EOE AA/M/F/Vet/Disability

Apply for job

items.title: Director, Sales Enablement
items.content:
Director, Sales Enablement at Craneware

Remote

Business Function Sales

Category

Location Country US

Office Location Home based

Additional Locations

Job Details

Purpose

The position reports directly to the Executive Vice President of Sales and will work in conjunction to lead and drive sales operations, manage the day to day activities of the Sales Enablement/Operation team and deliver cross functional activities to increase efficiencies and effectiveness of the team and others who are involved with the sales processes.

Office Location: Home Based

Key Accountabilities

  • Manage a successful sales support and inside sales team and ensure that the team consistently meets or exceeds performance metrics.
  • Work with EVP Sales to create and maintain a world-class sales culture, focused on delivering results by providing ongoing coaching and development of sales employees.
  • Work in conjunction with the CMO and Marketing to drive the development, creation and utilization of content for sales collateral and product marketing solutions.
  • Work with CIO and Business Intelligence to review and assess data to enable better utilization of time and resources while driving technology and alternative sales engagement platforms.
  • Work with Sales Leadership to motivate and drive performance of the Sales Team and assist with the analysis of performance.
  • Ensure that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behaviour aligns with the Craneware values.
  • Work closely with EVP Sales to operationalize the plans through discussions with the Sales Team.
  • Analyze performance metrics data and leverage them to effectively coach and develop the Sales Support and Inside Sales team members.
  • Develop and implement new processes and procedures for effective and efficient sales operations.
  • Work closely with Sales Managers and the Pricing Coordinator to address contract issues or concerns and to ensure the timeliness of contract review.
  • Identify opportunities and weaknesses within territories and make proposals to create value and increase operational efficiency. Support the EVP Sales in optimizing the field sales structure.
  • Work effectively and collaboratively with departments (such as Marketing, Professional Services, and Product Development, Business Intelligence) to implement effective sales plans that promote sales to new and existing customers.
  • Work closely with Marketing to create, implement, and track successful marketing campaigns that maximize Craneware’s visibility with hospitals, executives and professional associations.
  • Deliver sales forecasts, sales activity reports and presentations in a timely manner.
  • Manage and report on the resource request process (demo’s, SME’s) in the CRM to ensure efficient use of the company’s resources –both fiscal and personnel
  • Mange the RFP process to ensure timely delivery and accurate responses to potential customers.

Knowledge, Skills, Qualifications, Experience and Education

Knowledge

  • Sales acumen and ability to translate financial data into sound business recommendations and ability to analyze data
  • General knowledge of revenue cycle technology (Healthcare/Revenue Capture/Revenue Integrity)
  • Broad and deep knowledge of Craneware’s core products
  • Broad and deep knowledge of industry trends and competition
  • Demonstrate knowledge of key processes, business initiatives and internal resources
  • Excellent oral, written and presentation skills
  • Good leadership and communication skills with the ability to deliver across own function and the broader business, has a focus on stakeholder management both internally and externally to Craneware.
  • Experience of managing Sales Support (Inside Sales, Telemarketing) teams with demonstrated new sales track record & quota attainment
  • Demonstrated effectiveness in new business development and lead qualification

Skills

  • Microsoft Office and CRM software – ability at expert level
  • Highly accountable and results oriented
  • Time management, prioritization, and organizational skills.

Experience

  • 5-7+ years’ sales experience including sales operations and lead generation
  • Demonstrates sales track record, new sales track record & quota attainment.
  • Demonstrable success in new business development and lead qualification.

Education

  • Educated to Bachelor Degree
Apply for job

items.title: Associate Legal Counsel (Remote)
items.content:
Part time Lawyer required for successful startup.


As Legal Counsel at Audacity you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business.


As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.


Must have experience in depth experience with neither US or UK law.


Note that this a co-founder position.


About Us: Audacity create platforms and systems for distributed teams. We believe human relationships are paramount in any distributed organisation and have made this central not only in how we operate as an organisation but also in the tools which we develop. -- Audacity Team

items.title: Salesforce Project Manager- 100% Remote- $130k

Confidentiality is of course guaranteed. For information on the Salesforce.com market and some of the opportunities and Salesforce.com jobs that are available I can be contacted at /. items.title: Project Manager with IT Healthcare/Hospital industry experence- Remote
items.content:
Aetea has been asked by their valued client, a leading healthcare services company, to assist with their need for a Project Manager, with healthcare/hospital industry experience, in the IT space. The client and the team you ll be working in are great and offer positive challenges in a dynamic environment.

This candidate will be working on clinical integration projects. The projects will be centered around collection and validation of data, that goes to the implementation and data warehouse teams.

Having integration project experience and/or HL7 knowledge are huge plusses.

Responsibilities include:

  • Lead multiple integration projects and ensure coordination among clients, IT, and back office operations.
  • Monitors, reports, and collaborates with other teams to ensure timely completion of required steps
  • Serve as a single point of contact for multiple integration projects
  • Lead and manage internal stakeholders and client communications during integrations
  • create, manage and monitor project plans to ensure adherence to timelines, assigned tasks, etc.
  • Communicate status of projects regularly, and build contingency and mitigation plans
  • Effectively anticipate, identify, and resolve roadblocks
  • Define metrics and establish effective project controls
  • Independently facilitate and lead project status meetings
  • Evaluate methods of undertaking and completing projects for efficiency gains or process improvement
  • 5-10% travel

Required Skills:

  • 3-5+ years of healthcare or radiology/hospital/physician practice experience preferred
  • 8+ years of project management experience required
  • Product Integration experience preferred
  • HL7 knowledge preferred.
  • Experience managing timelines and successfully delivering work on time.
  • Must be familiar with the SDLC and managing software specific projects
  • Be able to manage requirements and work with Stakeholders and IT Leadership
  • Be efficient in organizing requirements into a common list to work through and establish priorities
  • Comfortable taking notes in meetings.

This is a great opportunity to get in with a stable and growing organization that values technology and the people that drive it. There is a lot more we can share with you about the role, so please contact me (or apply) at or through the apply function listed.

Duration: 6-12 months +

Location: Remote

****REFERRAL FEES PAID up to 500!!!!

For more than 30 years, Aetea Information Technology has been the go-to partner for both premier clients and IT professionals alike. As a full spectrum IT Human Capital organization, we have experience in all industries, supporting clients ranging from emerging start-ups to Fortune 50. Our consultants value Aetea for their benefits, length of assignments, sequential employment opportunities, and compensation models; not to mention the attentiveness and world-class support you will receive from the internal Aetea team.

- provided by Dice

items.content:
Head of People and Culture at LoveToKnow Media

Remote
  • United States
  • Full-Time
  • Human Resources

Join a fast-growing tech company with a remote and globally-distributed workforce of 70+ employees and contractors! LoveToKnowMedia is seeking an HR leader with a passion for making LoveToKnowMedia the employer of choice. The successful candidate will have 7+ years of Human Resource Management experience, especially with a start-up and remote background. This position is based remotely in the US. Please apply at https://lovetoknow-media-corp….

About this role:

  • HR generalist who will impact the attraction, engagement, and retention of top talent.
  • Reports to the Chief Operating Officer and partners with the Spain Country Manager.
  • Full-time and based remotely in the US; travel to Barcelona 3X per year!

Why you want this job:

  • First traditional HR hire; build the foundation of professional HR from the ground up.
  • Ability to shape, nurture and champion our global culture and company values.
  • Work from home…but have your passport handy!

What you will do:

  • Build best-in-class people programs in recruiting, onboarding/exit, performance management, learning & development, compensation, benefits, and recognition.
  • Craft, apply, and continually improve HR procedures, policies, and guidelines.
  • Foster a growth-oriented and motivating environment while keeping employees and management accountable to company policies, procedures and guidelines.
  • Build strong social connections, feedback mechanisms, and communication lines between employees, management, and the offices.
  • Handle all employee relations functions, including complaint investigation & resolution, risk mitigation, and response measures.
  • Manage a small team of internal recruiters, implement recruiting best practices, and scale their processes.
  • Serve as the first-line resource for all legal employment matters and compliance at the federal, state, and local levels. Consult with specialists as appropriate.
  • Build a diverse and inclusive workplace.

What you need to be successful:

  • 7+ years of Human Resources / People Leadership with accomplished track record.
  • Experience in a fast-growing tech start-up, and remote workforce.
  • Knowledge of HR best practices, multi-state employment laws and regulations in the US and willing to learn about international HR, particularly in Canada, India and Spain.
  • Ability to connect HR to measurable business outcomes such as hiring velocity, retention, and employee satisfaction.
  • Smart, analytical, and creative problem solver.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, communication, and emotional intelligence.
  • Social, well-liked, and high-energy.
  • Passion for healthy and respectful discourse as well as inclusion and diversity.
  • Unquestioned integrity, character, and professionalism.
  • Resourceful, self-reliant, and agile.
  • Work across several time zones (you’re an early riser)
  • Bachelor‘s degree in HR or related field; Master‘s degree a plus.

About LoveToKnowMedia:

  • Our family of lifestyle, educational & outdoor recreation brands provide best-in-class content every month to 30 million unique users and across 100 million page views. The 15-year old company embraces telecommuting, in which LoveToKnowMedia’s contributors across the world keep in touch, collaborate and work as a team to get the job done. CEO Howard Love has founded or co-founded over 15 companies, and has invested in over 50 early-stage start-ups including OpenTable (IPO), Trulia (IPO), and HotelTonight. Howard Love is a frequent speaker, and recently published his debut bestselling book ‘The Start-Up J Curve.’ Learn more about LoveToKnow at www.lovetoknowmedia.com.
Apply for job

items.title: Program Project Manager, Quality Operations
items.content:
Program Project Manager, Quality Operations at Landmark Health

Remote

Job Locations: US-Remote

Category: Operations

Type: Regular Full-Time

Job ID: 2019-3555

Overview

The Manager, Quality Operations will be a critical member of the Revenue Management team, supporting the Quality Operations of the company. This role will support the markets on a national level to include training/education, data integration/reporting, and other administrative duties as needed.

Responsibilities

  • Market Support including communicating with market team members, reviewing market performance and working with market leadership to improve as needed, and implementing/supporting quality initiatives.
  • Developing quality educational materials and conducting trainings with team members.
  • Work with markets to identify point of care testing needs including integration into local workflows, developing educational materials, and identification of best practices.
  • Work with markets, IT and HCE data teams to ensure accurate quality reporting, identification of data problems, and provide SME guidance when developing new and enhancing older quality measure logic.
  • Provide feedback for EMR enhancements including developing and improving quality modules for care gap closure.

Qualifications

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience required
  • Experience working on Quality initiatives, tracking reports, and education preferred.
  • 5+ years of experience working in a fast-paced business environment with a strong analytical bent (preferably consulting or an operational role within a healthcare context)
  • Experience working in a rapidly growing company or division with geographically dispersed business units is a plus
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams Proven track record demonstrating leadership skills, critical thinking, proactive operational excellence, and problem-solving
Apply for job

items.title: Senior Director, Payer Contracting
items.content:
Senior Director, Payer Contracting at Privia Health

Remote

DEPARTMENT: Payer Operations

LOCATION: Remote

EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time

Overview of the Role:

The Senior Director, Payer Contracting is responsible for all aspects of payer contracting for Privia Health for designated payers and/or Privia Markets. This includes but is not limited to, development of contract strategy, negotiation, analysis and administration of all fee-for-service and risk/incentive-based payer contracts. The position also collaborates with senior leadership in Business Development, Healthcare Economics and Value Based Care to identify and analyze contracting strategy and expansion opportunities (e.g., entrance into new markets through the development of new payer relationships).

Primary Job Duties:

  • This position will have significant revenue responsibilities and will require a high level of understanding of healthcare financing and delivery as well as the ability to think strategically and offer innovative solutions to complex challenges.
  • Participate directly and oversees activities of strategy development, contract negotiations, contract language, risk assessment, contract amendments, financial analysis, payer performance monitoring, contract operationalization, payer relations and issue resolution.
  • Execute strategies and tactics developed jointly with Privia leadership in designated markets and reports on payer performance. Identifies and implements leading practices and processes to increase revenue and achieve objectives.
  • Present, collaborate and reach consensus with physician governance committees on strategy, tactics and results.
  • Create presentations and deliver updates to senior leadership in a professional manner.
  • Build and maintain positive relationships with designated Privia markets, corporate resources and managed care payers.
  • Monitor state and federal legislation related to payment initiatives and policy changes that could impact negotiations.
  • Assess and review risks and opportunities across the enterprise related to payment reform, value-based purchasing, etc.
  • Work closely with VP, Payer Contracting to establish a standard practice with guidelines, processes (including legal review), and workflows. Utilize the standard guidelines and processes for negotiation of third party payer contractual agreements, reimbursement rates, etc.
  • In conjunction with SVP of Business Development and others, evaluate and analyze new market expansion opportunities including collaboration, design and key driver assumptions for supporting financial models.
  • As needed, assess and assist in development of key components of CIN to create value for Privia, physicians, payers, and consumers.
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree required; Master’s Degree preferred
  • 10+ years of healthcare experience, a significant portion of which working with managed care and other payers
  • Comprehensive knowledge of healthcare finance as well as managed care and insurer contracting including commercial and Medicare Advantage payer relations
  • Significant experience in managed care contract terminology and reimbursement negotiations
  • Outstanding conceptual, analytical and problem solving skills comfortable operating within actuarial/analytical organization
  • Strong managerial acumen in setting direction and managing execution to achieve goals and a strong desire to manage, develop and mentor other teammates or colleagues
  • Knowledge of best practices in revenue cycle environment
  • Results oriented with strong analytical skills and excellent Microsoft excel skills
  • Effective negotiator or consensus builder, as is necessary
  • Must comply with HIPAA rules and regulations

Interpersonal Skills & Attributes:

  • A high level of integrity, trust and ethics
  • A willingness to listen, succinctly debate and evaluate issues with an open mind to different opinions and approaches to problem solving
  • Strong presentation and communication skills, with the ability to communicate to a wide range of audiences from senior executives to front-line employees
  • Demonstrated ability to assess current processes and implement best practices
  • Ability to engage directly with senior level executives
  • Strong influencing skills; track record of successful client relationship development and ability to quickly build credibility and gain the confidence of individuals at all levels
  • Strong sense of accountability; passion for owning projects and driving them to completion
  • Team player with the ability to sell change effectively and influence others
  • Ability to effectively drive multiple projects
  • Ambitious and proactive with strong team leadership skills and drive to “get stuff done”

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

Privia Health is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Privia will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. Privia’s goal is for our people to reflect the communities that we serve and to increase representation of women, people of color, veterans and individuals with disabilities in our organization.

Apply for job

items.content:
Accounts Development Manager





MySense celebrated our third birthday this October and as a present to ourselves we want to hire the greatest Accounts Manager in the world. We are creating a global movement here, not just a great business. We have an outstanding product that solves a major problem for a huge number of people across the world in an attractive and convenient way. The delight in people’s faces when they see and touch our product, or picture it in their home helping a loved one isn’t just technology for technology’s sake, it’s a real solution. We also have an outstanding team, every single one of them is with us from the start and committed to the future. And we have outstanding customers and partners, working together with us to build something that actually changes people’s lives.


 


Salary £60K - £75K





About the role


This is a new role, created at MySense (UK) Ltd to drive new growth, successfully deliver current and potential opportunities across the UK, and annual sales revenues exceeding £20m.


MySense has ambitious plans in the UK and internationally: to move beyond current markets (UK and Canada) to at least one other, and to create opportunities to sell down additional verticals in the UK and new markets over the next five years.


Our customers in the UK are Public Sector, Accommodation Providers, Care and Support Providers and Property Developers. This role will further advance our strategy and channel partnerships down all market verticals. The role will also play a key part in shaping and delivering an exciting B2B2C retail offer.


This is a role that needs exceptional account management, both strategically and operationally. In some cases, this will involve challenging client-side dialogue and issue resolution. This role is not one for someone seeking an ivory tower; MySense team members lead from the front and by example in order to go above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction without compromising our product.


In the short term, this role will operationalise account delivery strategies, including the utility of the product and whether the majority of the devices work as designed, proving we add value to the users/families to make sure we retain customers and have those customers enthusiastically recommend the product.


An empathy with partner businesses and their business models, to help us and them sell our product, and to establish what our business model should look like to add value is critical to this role. This will include (but is not limited to) creating and administering a reseller program, training and building in-house capacity out in the field and building additional pipelines, rather than traditional BD / sales.


The Accounts Manager will report to the Chief Commercial Officer of MySense Group, and be based in Westminster Tower, London.





Responsibilities:



  • Build strategies and execute them through tactical implementation of coherent and commercially strong plans that continually grow the customer base and increase revenue

  • Build new executive-level relationships, generating leads, driving the sales pipeline and introducing potential new growth opportunities

  • Contribute to the MySense customer experience and the brand touch-points, nationally and internationally

  • Contribute to building the internal culture of the organisation required as we scale-up: not creepy corporate or lava lamp cliche but our own identity and behaviours consistent with the MySense way

  • Build the internal capacity to successfully fulfil large scale contracts: so this aspect requires exceptional programme delivery experience, account leadership (not just management; but services and development, and often strategic leadership to/from client side)

  • Build and test a sustainable distribution model for high volume roll out across UK markets

  • Build (i.e. spec and recruit to) our UK sales and marketing function

  • Contribute to the plan for retail at Group level and present a fully worked-up model for the UK within 12 months





Role Requirements:



  • 3+ years of domain experience and a proven track record of exceeding objectives

  • The ability to work with a focus on deadlines and business goals

  • Possess a valid driver’s license and suitable vehicle - must be willing to travel

  • Endless curiosity and active listening with a passion for learning and solutions

  • A master at maintaining positive client relationships, even through difficult dialogue

  • The ability to ensure programmes of delivery meet the needs of buyer and seller

  • Ability to create successful long term partnerships across verticals and industries

  • Charismatic team leader, internal champion and values based manager of people






About the successful candidate


The Accounts Manager will own the end to end delivery of the commercial strategy for the UK.


The successful candidate will possess domain knowledge across most if not all current market verticals, with particular sensitivity for both the strategic operational environments of our channel partners and their clients.


Calm under pressure and with exemplary client facing skills, the successful candidate will represent MySense with professionalism and integrity, openness and honesty. It goes without saying that delivering projects to tight deadlines with customer focus and product discipline will form a key accountability.





Culture and Personality:



  • Willing to work hard but also have fun

  • Good sense of humour

  • Entrepreneurial spirit

  • Innovative and open-minded

  • Tenacious problem-solver

  • Proactive self-starter

  • Able to work as part of a wider team

  • An appetite for learning

  • A passion for technology of all types

  • An interest in health and wellbeing

  • Enjoys a social office atmosphere

  • An appetite to achieve great things and to help many vulnerable people remain independent in their own homes





Benefits:



  • 30 days holiday + your birthday + Public Holidays

  • Fruit, Coffee, Tea and breakfast all are in office

  • Remote working possible

  • Private Health Insurance

  • Life Insurance

  • Pension scheme

  • Office dog (hypoallergenic)

  • Relaxed startup environment - your input matters

  • Company laptop





About MySense


MySense is a wellbeing analytics platform built on compassion, by people who understand what it’s like to care for a loved one. But we’re also a team of dedicated (self-proclaimed) nerds, tech is what we know and love. So, we have combined these two drives and created a product we can be proud of.


The idea is that peace of mind about a loved one’s wellbeing should be at people’s fingertips no matter who or where they are. To do this, we created a wearable device and 11 sensors that can be placed around someone’s home. Each sensor picks up information about a key activity. This means looking at drinking and eating habits, toilet usage, sleep patterns and heart rate (approximately 5,000 data points). These sensors collect data that our AI then analyses for any patterns of decline in wellbeing. When we start to notice that something isn’t looking ideal, we send caregivers notifications so they can address problems before they escalate.


 


Check us out:


https://www.mysense.ai


https://www.linkedin.com/company/mysense


 


We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Clinical Project Manager at Advanced Group

Remote

Clinical Research Regular Full-Time Advanced Clinical

Overview:

Advanced Clinical is a global clinical development organization that provides CRO, FSP, Quality & Validation, and Strategic Resourcing services for biopharmaceutical and medical device organizations. Our mission is to deliver a better clinical experience for our clients. With global experience in over 50 countries, we are committed to improving all lives touched by clinical research. We understand the complex nature of the clinical research industry and approach each opportunity with compassion. Together, we answer the hopes of patients and healthcare professionals with industry-leading services in global life-sciences. As part of the Advanced Group family of companies, Advanced Clinical employees provide the support, structure, and professional background and experience for better clinical trials and research. They are the foundation of our energetic and collaborative environment, where constant learning and service to others take top priority. We seek dynamic, hard-working team members who are inspired to work amongst diverse backgrounds and perspectives. From our altruistic mission to outstanding career development opportunities, there’s no better place to grow your career than Advanced Clinical.

This position can be worked remote from anywhere in the United States

A Project Manager (PM) is responsible for overseeing and conducting clinical research studies and projects. The Project Manager will oversee all assigned clinical research staff to ensure that efficient and effective management of clinical study activities is being maintained. The CM may be responsible for multiple projects and must be able to work independently and in a team environment to effectively lead and drive the project deliverables. The Project Manager will serve as a primary resource and point of communication for the client and project team.

Responsibilities:

  • Support Proposals & Business Development as necessary to secure new business, including but not limited to, providing review and input to Requests for Proposals (RFPs) and presenting at bid defense meetings as requested
  • Overall coordination and management of clinical trials from startup to closeout, within the contractual timelines.
  • Project specific financial management, including but not limited to, contract adherence, budget management and regular budget reviews with the client
  • Provide and/or endure study-specific training for the clinical research staff.
  • Generate a comprehensive and detailed study-specific Project Plan (PP) and ensure underlying functional plans are included
  • Establish and manage processes to track and analyze critical project information & metrics, including but not limited to, timeline management, project projections and forecasts, and trend and gap analyses
  • Serve as the primary liaison between the AC study or clinical team and the client.
  • Escalate significant issues to the Director, Clinical Operations or other appropriate AC Operational Leadership.
  • Follow applicable Standard Operation Procedures (SOPs).
  • Ensure compliance with applicable GCPs through training, processes, and early issue identification and correction.
  • Collaborates with other functional areas to identify and evaluate fundamental issues on the project, interpret data, make good business decisions, and ensure the implementation of timely solutions.
  • Develops and implements risk management strategies and contingency plans for clinical deliverables.
  • Maintains a flexible approach to address issues innovatively and proactively.
  • Participates in team, client, and cross functional meetings.
  • Provides co-monitoring and mentoring for less experienced CRAs, as needed.
  • Travel to sites, as needed to support completion and oversight of AC responsibilities.
  • Oversees CRA performance, and supports workload

Qualifications:

The ideal candidate should have Bachelor’s Degree or RN with 5 years industry experience or a Master’s degree with 3 years industry experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.. The
ideal candidate has excellent organizational and time management skills and can successfully direct projects and deliverables. Must have proven leadership, written and verbal communication skills, and computer competence with Microsoft Word, Excel and Powerpoint. Advanced knowledge of and ability to apply and all applicable regulations and guidelines including GCP. Project management certification is a plus.

What’s in it for you? Advanced Group offers competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits packages, and a flexible work environment designed to help our team members and their families stay healthy, meet their financial goals, and generally thrive in and beyond work. Visit the links below to discover all that Advanced Group has to offer:

Our Culture: https://careers.advancedgroup.com/embrace-our-cultureOpens a New Window.

Career Development Opportunities: https://careers.advancedgroup.com/realize-your-potentialOpens a New Window.

Community Programs: https://careers.advancedgroup.com/unleash-your-passionOpens a New Window.

For a complete list of all of our job openings, please visit Advanced Group’s career site hereOpens a New Window..

It is Advanced Group’s practice not to discriminate against any employee or applicant because of sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation or sexual preference, pregnancy or maternity, genetic information, marital status, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

This practice applies to all terms and conditions of employment including, but not limited to, hiring, training, compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, layoff, Company-sponsored education, social and recreational programs, and treatment on the job. If you have a disability or handicap and would like us to accommodate you in any reasonable way, please inform your recruiter so that we can discuss the appropriate alternatives available.

Apply for job

items.title: Do It! Marketing: Director of Marketing
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Director of Marketing

Marketing Director/Growth Marketer Position

Who we are: 
I’m David Newman, and I’m the founder of Do It! Marketing and creator of The Speaker Profit Formula, our flagship mentoring and coaching program. My team and I help people from around the world market their smarts as a paid professional speaker AND all the accompanying revenue streams such as coaching, consulting, training, facilitation, online courses, licensing, sponsorships, and more.

We’re hiring a world-class marketer and leader to help us expand to our next level of marketplace success using both organic and paid traffic, content marketing, video, email, live streaming, direct mail, live events, and online communities. 

How we work:
Do It! Marketing is a fully remote team of self-starters, we are committed and passionate about changing and impacting the lives of our clients. 

If you’re looking for a role within a team that feels like family that will allow you to do amazing work at an exciting period of growth, look no further. As part of a remote team and to support our clients, we’re looking for someone that can live by our values.

The job: 
The purpose of the Director of Growth Marketing is to develop and own the outcomes from all our online and offline marketing strategies and initiatives. The primary outcomes you’ll be measured on are: lead quantity, lead quality, and ultimately, helping us hit our highly aggressive sales growth goals.  

You’ll pay particular attention to top-of-funnel lead generation and optimization of pipeline conversion rates. You will use your broad skillset to present new ideas and opportunities to help grow Do It! Marketing through new and existing channels and retargeting efforts. 

Who you are:
You’re comfortable with both the creative and analytical aspects of growth marketing and enjoy bringing a vision to life while being a stats geek so that you can detect the patterns behind the numbers to help us make actionable decisions in real time. 

You’re passionate about helping us find solutions to complex problems. 

You understand that today’s digital marketing is not just about the click, share or like, but you keep strategic business growth in mind with everything you do. 

You’re an experienced marketer, always honing your craft, with the desire and ability to expand, develop and master new marketing skill-sets and tools. 

Experience: 

NEED to have:
  • Expert in paid social; you have a track record in using social ads & effective targeting to drive leads and ultimately revenue for a seven figure company
  • Expert in Search Engine Marketing, particularly Google and YouTube
  • Copywriting & story-telling; you can write high-converting ads
  • Effective at buyer persona research and you truly “get” buyer psychology
  • Funnel management and conversion optimization through to the sale
  • Familiar and comfortable with split testing techniques
  • Growth mindset and “extreme ownership” of sales results
  • Can plan and execute a strategy. You’re prepared to jump in and get the job done, you don't need a team to produce immediate results
  • Remote work experience

NICE to have:
  • Webinar marketing expertise
  • Content strategist; comfortable creating and repurposing content to drive web traffic and boost SEO
  • Marketing automation expertise
  • Experience with video marketing, podcast marketing & direct mail
  • Community management and growth (Facebook groups, blogs, organic social)

At Do It! Marketing, we understand that super talented people don’t always fit the mold. 

We’re looking for A-Players ONLY. 

We encourage you to apply if you identify as such but you’re not 100% certain you “qualify” for the whole list above. 

If you’re a rock star marketer, you’ll know it - and so will we :o) 

To Apply:

Please record a short video (90 seconds max), answering the following questions:
  • From our list of requirements, what are the three top areas where you excel?
  • From our list of requirements, what is the one area you would consider your weakest?
  • What’s the one thing that jumps out at you about our company?

Send the video link to charlie@doitmarketing.com with the subject line: Fantastic Marketing Director Info Inside...

Videos must be received by 31 October 2019.  We promise to respond to all video applicants.
 
Thanks, and we look forward to hearing from you!

items.title: Contract Manager I
items.content:
Contract Manager I at LabConnect

Remote

Contract Manager I

Job ID

27354702

Location

REMOTE

Other Location

Description

Summary
The Contracts Manager I will be responsible for providing contract management oversight to a biopharmaceutical client tasked with providing support in all aspects of purchasing goods and services (e.g. obtaining vendor quotes, statements of work preparation, purchase order submission, invoice resolution and ensuring compliance with client policy and procedures.

Responsibilities

  • Manage procurement to payment process with biopharmaceutical client.
  • Manage requests for service, confirm budget availability, manage vendor cost tables, validate invoice, and prepare reports as needed.
  • Submit requests for CDAs and provide follow up with legal department and to requesting parties.
  • Provide support in all aspects of purchasing goods and service (e.g. obtaining vendor quotes, statement of work preparation, purchase order submission, and invoice resolution)
  • Ensure compliance with client policies and procedures.

Required Knowledge and Skills

  • Experience in purchasing or contract administration and understanding all aspects of the contracting process.
  • Ability to establish strong working relationships with a wide range of people. Candidate will be a team player – but also have the ability to use personal initiative and make your own decisions as well.
  • Well-organized and capable of meeting deadlines.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Cross-functional and cross-site team management experience.
  • Critical Thinking – Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
  • Working knowledge of Good Laboratory Practices (GLP), Good Clinical Practices (GCP)
  • Common and specialized computer software application proficiency and adaptability.

Education/Experience

Bachelor’s degree in related field with a minimum of 2 years of industry-relevant purchasing or contract management experience. Very high attention to detail and excellent multi-tasking skills is required for success in this position.
Language Ability
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.

Math Ability
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.

Reasoning Ability
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

Computer Skills
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

Supervisory Responsibilities
This position does not have any supervisory responsibilities.

Work Environment
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Physical Demands
The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and ability to adjust focus. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms.

This job description should not be construed to imply that these requirements are the exclusive standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions and perform other related duties as may be required by their supervisor. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Technical Program Manager at Thrive Global

Remote
  • Engineering
  • Thrive Global San Francisco, 470 Bryant Street, San Francisco, California 94107, USA

Location – San Francisco, NY, or Remote

Thrive Global is changing the way people live through our behavior change platform and apps used to impact individual and organizational well-being and productivity. The marriage of data and analytics, our best-in-class content and science-backed behavior change IP will help people go from knowing what to do to actually doing it, enabling millions of consumers to begin the Thrive behavior change journey. As the Senior Technical Program Manager, reporting to the CTO, you’ll move fluidly from the big picture to small details so that the team can deliver complex and strategic cross-functional projects, often with tight deadlines.

Who We Are Looking For

  • You are a bridge and a connector for the company.
  • You are intuitive, focused, driven, organized, insightful and productive.
  • You break through communication issues and effectively develop relationships with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
  • You are comfortable managing numerous high-level technical projects simultaneously.
  • You build trust across the organization.
  • You are not afraid to be direct, but you strive to act with empathy and integrity.

How You’ll Contribute

  • Program manage complex and large scale cross-team, cross-functional technology projects.
  • Interface with the Chief Technology Officer, Chief Operating Officer, product managers, designers, engineering leaders, engineers, and 3rd party partners to estimate work efforts, define milestones and manage resources.
  • Track progress, resolve dependencies, evaluate risks and communicate status to upper management and project stakeholders. Engage and energize the project teams to achieve aggressive goals.
  • Partner with product and engineering leadership to proactively remove obstacles to drive momentum and progress. Identify communication gaps, manage issue escalations and provide support to teams balancing competing priorities. Drive results proactively.
  • Act as Scrum Master for at least one product delivery team bringing your Agile background and experience to help the team effectively and efficiently drive product development work through the pipeline.
  • Recommend and help implement continuous improvements to the engineering organization and the program management process. Share program/project process frameworks, tools, and best practices that can be adopted throughout the organization.
  • Improve product development and delivery. Mentor project management skills within our product and engineering leadership team.

Must Haves

  • Minimum of 4 years experience as a Technical Program Manager or engineering manager in a software, SaaS, or systems development environment.
  • Solid technical aptitude and an ability to understand technical designs, challenges and risks. Engineers enjoy working closely with you.
  • Experience successfully managing 3rd party partners.
  • Experienced in project management and managing at least 3 projects at once. Familiar with both Agile and Waterfall methodologies and able to apply them where best suited.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and exceptional emotional intelligence. Ability to influence and motivate people across a broad variety of job functions through your relationships.
  • Strong organizational skills to juggle many tasks without losing sight of the highest priority items.
  • Ability to understand complex concepts and make reasoned decisions objectively.

Desired Skills

  • Worked at a high paced, fast growing, enterprise tech startup.
  • Technical program management experience at an established company with a strong TPM team.

Our Mission

Thrive Global’s mission is to end the stress and burnout epidemic by offering companies and individuals sustainable, science-based solutions to enhance well-being, performance, and purpose, and create a healthier relationship with technology. Recent science has shown that the pervasive belief that burnout is the price we must pay for success is a delusion. We know, instead, that when we prioritize our well-being, our decision-making, creativity, and productivity improve dramatically. Thrive Global is committed to accelerating the culture shift that allows people to reclaim their lives and move from merely surviving to thriving.

What We Offer

  • A mission-driven company that’s truly making a difference in the lives of people around the world
  • Ability to develop within the company and shape our growth strategy
  • Human-centric culture with a range of wellness perks and benefits
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Medical, vision and dental coverage + 401k program with company match
  • Generous paid time-off programs
Apply for job

items.content:
Senior Manager – Director, Sales Incentives and Analytics at Elastic.co

Remote

Location: Distributed, AMER

Elastic is a search company with a simple goal: to solve the world’s data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the creators of the Elastic Stack, we help thousands of organizations including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, Verizon, and many more use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what’s possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We have a distributed team of Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting), and our diverse open source community spans over 100 countries. Learn more at elastic.co

To support our continued growth, we are seeking a Sales Incentives and Analytics leader for our Sales Insights and Analytics team. The Director of Sales Analytics will lead a team responsible for all aspects of field performance tracking and analysis, provide thoughtful recommendations on how to best address themes that stem from our tracking of monthly field critical metrics, develop content and prepare senior executives for Board meetings and earnings calls, and provide strategic counsel on how to best invest and scale all Field / Go-To-Market functions.

This individual will thrive in navigating ambiguity, adapt quickly to a changing environment, take a global view, are data-focused and have a passion for optimizing process and structure. You balance critical, long-term thinking about how we scale the business with hands-on delivery to ensure what needs to happen today gets done. You enjoy leading a team and developing your people. This individual also loves rolling up your sleeves and being an individual contributor. Passionate about the results we deliver, we utilize all team members to execute efficiently and effectively. We’re looking for people with strong analytical and process skills, comfortable engaging with C-suite execs, effective at collaborating with multiple teams and growing positive relationships with business partners. Does this sound like you?

What you will be doing:

  • Be responsible for the tracking and reporting of all company level Sales critical metrics and deliver these to Finance on a monthly basis shortly after the close of each month.
  • Deliver a monthly performance review assessment to GTM leadership executives outlining MTD, QTD, and FYTD performance across a variety of measures by region and segment.
  • Present a quarterly business review to each of our AVP’s, SVP of WW Sales, CRO, and Executive Leadership Team; Prepare and deliver all field performance assessment narratives for the Sr Field Operations leaders, ELT, and Board of Directors.
  • Support Sales Strategy with territory carving and GTM resource planning to optimize our coverage model across all markets.
  • Drive strategic initiatives including resource and capacity planning, segmentation, pipeline management, country-specific go-to-market plans, and coverage model for all functions within Field Operations (i.e. Reps, SDRs, SEs, Channel Partners, Customer Success, Services, etc).
  • Implement early warning systems to help actively lead the growth of the business (i.e. customer churn, pipeline, conversions, pricing, etc.).
  • Work cross-functionally with Sr Leadership teams to help identify headwinds and tailwinds and lead both short-term and long-term strategic initiatives.
  • Guide, develop, and mentor a team.

What you bring along:

  • BS/BA required, MBA a plus, but not required.
  • 10+ years of experience in Sales Operations, Business Operations, Strategy, Finance FP&A, Management Consulting, or similar field in SaaS organizations with strong exposure to go-to-market strategy.
  • Experience with crafting sales comp plans a big plus.
  • Experience forecasting bookings, rep attainment, and generally building complex and dynamic models for scenario planning.
  • Demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, develop solutions, and craft recommendations and results into easily digestible messages, communications, and executive presentations.
  • Very strong executive presence and engagement skills.
  • Highly collaborative style with strong influencing skills and the ability to adjust on the fly to new demands with a sense of urgency.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment.
  • Experience with the Salesforce.com platform
  • Power-user proficiency with the MS Office suite (especially MS Excel and MS Powerpoint).

Additional Information – We Take Care of Our People

At Elastic, we strive to have parity of benefits across regions. While regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of people is the right thing to do.

  • Healthcare for you and your family in many locations.
  • Flexible location and schedule for many roles.
  • Generous number of vacation days each year.
  • Double your charitable giving we match up to 1% of your salary.
  • Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love.

#LI-AK1

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Elasticsearch, Inc. ( Elastic ) which is located at 800 W. El Camino Real, Suite 350 Mountain View, CA 94040 USA, and can be contacted by emailing jobs@elastic.co. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Elastic’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by Elastic, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment. Your personal data will be shared with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Elastic to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Elastic’s behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site. Because the European Union Commission has determined that United States data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer will be subject to appropriate additional safeguards under the standard contractual clauses. You can obtain a copy of the standard contractual clauses by contacting us at privacy@elastic.co. Elastic’s data protection officer is Daniela Duda, who can be contacted at daniela.duda@elastic.co. We plan to keep your data until our open role is filled. We cannot estimate the exact time period, but we will consider this period ended when a candidate accepts our job offer for the position for which we are considering you. When that period is over, we may keep your data for an additional period no longer than 3 years in case additional opportunities present themselves in which yours skills might be better suited. For additional details, please see our Elastic Privacy Statement https://www.elastic.co/legal/privacy-statement.

Apply for job

items.title: Finance Manager
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Finance Manager at Human Made

Remote
DESCRIPTION

Human Made is looking for a Finance Manager to join its global team. This is a remote position, but you should be located +/- 4 hours UTC. 

Human Made creates websites, applications, and digital experiences for globally recognised brands all over the world. You will be joining a company of around 70 people, distributed across 16 countries. We are a diverse group of humans who love to work remotely and who are always seeking ways that we can improve.

About you

You should be a fully qualified accounting technician (AAT) or or part-qualified (CIMA/ACCA/ or equivalent). You should be someone who thrives in a dynamic environment and who is able to work across multiple contexts. You should be able to use a wide range of financial accounting tools, but also be familiar with online tools such as Google Docs, Sheets, and Xero. Experience of remote work and/or working at a digital agency is a distinct advantage.

You should have 5 years of experience of working in a UK corporate accounting environment. While we also operate in the US and Australia you are not expected to be familiar with US and Australian accountancy legislation and practice but will be expected to learn on the job.

As a remote worker, you should be a self-starter, able to motivate yourself and prioritise your tasks. We operate with a high level of trust in all employees, and focus on your outputs rather than the how, when, and where you do your work. Communication is an essential part of this role so you should be an excellent communicator, particularly in text-based communication and video conferencing. You should be comfortable communicating with people across cultures and at different levels of the company.

The role

As a Finance Manager at Human Made you will be responsible for the day-to-day financial management, administration, and processes in the company.

You will be responsible for regular financial processes and reporting in the company, including daily bank reconciliations and reconciliation of the company balance sheets, preparing and posting monthly accruals, prepayments and other accounting entries, and monitoring the day to day financial operations within the company. You will work with the Business Operations Manager to calculate WiP, reconciling the actual invoicing between our tools. You should use your experience to contribute to the improvement and streamlining of these processes.

You will be responsible for VAT and HMRC processes in the UK and their equivalents in the US and Australia. You will prepare monthly reports for our entities in the UK, Australia, and the USA, as well as the consolidated reports. In the case of annual external audits for statutory reporting, you will be the first point of contact for the auditors.

You will be responsible for payroll across the company, including the UK, US, and Australia, and paying our contractors. In addition to payroll, you will be responsible for processing and paying expenses claims, and monitoring expenses requests as they come in to make sure that they are approved by the correct people or processes.

You will contribute to the financial planning of the company, including the quarterly business planning process and assisting with Financial Planning and Analysis when required. You should continually identify any risks to finance, proposing effective solutions when necessary.

You will be a member of the Operations Team, reporting directly to the Finance Director and working closely with the Business Operations Manager.

Responsibilities
  • Be responsible for payroll, VAT and HMRC processes and their US and Aus equivalents
  • Monitor the day-to-day financial operations within the company, such as payroll, AP processing, expenses and other transactions
  • Maintain daily bank reconciliations
  • Prepare and post monthly accruals, prepayments and similar accounting entries
  • Work with the Business Ops Manager to calculate WiP on a monthly basis, reconciling the actual invoicing in the finance system with our agency management tools
  • Prepare monthly reports for Human Made Ltd, Human Made Inc, and Human Made Pty Ltd and the three combined
  • Own the reconciliation of the company balance sheets
  • Manage the audit process acting as the first point of contact for external auditors
  • Deal with working capital management and production of cash flow forecasts
  • Continually identify risks to finance, propose solutions where necessary and effectively manage stakeholder expectations throughout
  • Assist with FP&A (Financial Planning and Analysis) when required
  • Be a key contributor to the quarterly Business Planning process
REQUIREMENTS

Essential

  • 5 years work experience in a UK corporate accounting environment
  • Fully qualified accounting technician (AAT) or at least part-qualified (CIMA/ACCA or similar)
  • Experience of working in a similar sized fast growing business
  • +/- 4 hrs UTC (to ensure good overlap with the UK)

Desired

  • Experience in US/Australian accountancy knowledge
  • Experience of Digital Agency and/or Digital Subscription businesses
  • Experience of simple Group Consolidations
  • Experience of Xero and Expensify
  • Remote work experienc
BENEFITS
  • £35,000 – £45,000 GBP or local equivalent
  • Flexible working
  • 52 weeks parental leave
  • 35 days paid holiday
  • Sickness and carers leave
  • Annual company retreat (Previous retreats have been in Sri Lanka, Italy, Slovakia,
  • Spain, Norway)
  • Conference and training budget
  • Monthly remote working allowance
  • Work wherever you want
  • New computer and mobile phone
  • Office equipment when you need it

Location: +/- 4 hrs UTC

Apply for job
