CodeWeavers | St Paul, MN, USA | Full Time | REMOTE or ONSITE | General Wine and Open Source Developer | C-language systems programming

https://www.codeweavers.com/about/jobs

CodeWeavers is hiring skilled C programmers to work on the open source Wine project. A year ago, CodeWeavers partnered with Valve Software to integrate Wine into the Steam for Linux client as a part of the Steam Play (Proton) initiative. This allows Linux gamers to play Windows games on Linux more easily. We need new, full-time developers to improve Wine's ability to run games.

We are hiring remote workers, US or international, as well as local workers. We will consider relocation, if desired, on a case-by-case basis. Please see link above for information, benefits, requirements, and how to apply.

items.title: SimpleTiger: Content Production Manager for SaaS Companies
items.content:
Content Production Manager for SaaS Companies

Content Production Manager

Company Overview

SimpleTiger LLC is a digital marketing agency with the mission to provide simple, effective marketing to clients we love so they can get the customers they need. We do SEO (search engine optimization) for SaaS (software as a service) companies and we specialize in helping our clients build strong content that converts and drives engagement, we build links to that content so it ranks better in search and we help our clients determine their keyword strategy and optimize their site from a technical perspective so they can get the most out of SEO. We’re currently a team of 6 full-time employees with a larger list of contractors we work with to produce content for our clients. You can read more about SimpleTiger and our team on our website.



Job Overview

We are looking for candidates who possess the ability to think both creatively and analytically. Content Production Manager duties include producing editorial calendars based off of provided keyword research, producing content outlines, editing and proofreading and managing a content team, among other tasks.



Content Production Managers should be comfortable finding creative ways of building an online presence, as well as using analytics in the formulation of content production. Here, content is defined as blog posts, landing page content and resources such as pillar pages (long-form assets), video transcripts, infographic content, etc.



Content Production Manager Responsibilities
  • Creating editorial calendars. 
  • Editing and proofreading content.
  • Managing a content team consisting of writers, graphic designers, videographers, etc.
  • Brainstorming with team members to develop new ideas.
  • Building a following on social media.
  • Providing editorial, creative and technical support to team members.
  • Tracking web analytics to ascertain content engagement levels.
  • Managing content across all platforms, including email and social media.
Content Production Manager Requirements
  • Bachelor's Degree in Communications, Journalism, English or related field.
  • 3-4 years agency experience or in a similar role.
  • Adept at keyword placement and SEO best practices.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Highly computer literate and advanced knowledge of HTML.
  • Proficiency with popular content management systems.
  • Experience with social media management.
  • Creativity and the ability to develop original content.
  • Ability to develop content that provokes engagement.
  • Strong leadership qualities.

Perks


SimpleTiger is a small, growing company with a long history of providing simple, effective marketing results for our clients. A job at SimpleTiger includes several benefits such as:
  • We’re an entirely remote team meaning we don’t have a central office you need to report to and you can work from home or anywhere in the world you may be at the time.
  • We’re a Results Only Work Environment meaning we’re only concerned with the results our team is able to generate as it pertains to our goals and the goals of our clients. So long as your work is getting done we don’t care where, when, how, or what you do to achieve the results we need to achieve as long as they align with our core values
  • A flexible work schedule meaning you can work whenever is best for you. So long as you’re available for scheduled calls (internal and external) then we don’t care what time you do your work. Some of us work later in the day, some earlier, some at night and since some of us are traveling around the world the schedule can be sporadic.
We provide 3 major motivators to all of our team members and we call this our MAP:
  • Mastery - We provide education through internal consulting, conversations and investments into educational material so you can constantly be growing in your career. If you don’t know how to do something crucial to your role, let us know and we’ll figure out how to educate you together.
  • Autonomy - We give complete autonomy to our team in terms of figuring out how to achieve an end result and what to do to get there. We provide recommendations and ideas to start with but you’ll be allowed to stretch your wings and really do your best in owning your purpose to achieve success.
  • Purpose - Your purpose is the single most important thing you can do at SimpleTiger. We try to keep it simple and clear so you’re never confused about what you need to do.
You can read more about SimpleTiger here.

items.title: Head of Demand Generation
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Head of Demand Generation at MonkeyLearn

Remote

United States, remote – Full time

MonkeyLearn is an easy-to-use machine learning solution that empowers companies to create new value from their data.

Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing are cutting-edge technologies that have the potential to disrupt the way we work and boost our daily productivity. At MonkeyLearn we’re on a mission to make this technology accessible for everybody.

We work together with customers from top tech companies in Silicon Valley, Los Angeles, and New York. We are backed by top tier investors including Uncork Capital, Bling Capital and angel investors including Des Traynor, Eoghan McCabe (Intercom), Henry Ward (Carta), Howie Liu (Airtable), Alex Solomon (PagerDuty), and Anthony Goldbloom (Kaggle/Google).

We’re looking for a strategic, data-driven, customer centric and ambitious leader who will own the sales pipeline generation and new business revenue growth.

Reporting directly to the CEO, you will be responsible for establishing a scalable lead generation and growth strategy. This is a great opportunity to make a big impact at a fast-growing and results-driven startup in a new software category.

We are looking for a self-starter, entrepreneurial and experienced marketer who is comfortable with both the analytical and creative aspects of leading a holistic demand generation strategy. Both working as an individual contributor and able to manage a team.

As part of a remote team we need people that can live by our values, and that we can trust to perform with limited supervision. You’ll be joining a small team and will have an immediate impact on our product and customers.

Job duties and responsibilities

  • Maximum responsible for generating sales pipeline.
  • Attract leads (MQLs) with multiple channels:
  • Content & SEO
    • Work with our existing content & SEO team to get this channel to the next level.
  • Product marketing
    • Create product marketing content on how to use MonkeyLearn for different use cases and integrations with third party applications.
    • Develop co-marketing partnerships with third party applications.
    • Generate leads from referred traffic from partner applications, forums and social.
  • Paid
    • Experiment with multiple paid channels.
  • SDR
    • Experiment with outbound campaigns.
  • Engage leads (Active MQLs)
    • Design, run and measure the right experiments to optimize conversion rates in our website, content and product.
    • User onboarding (email and in-app).
    • Pre and post signup user nurturing.
  • Convert qualified leads (SQLs)
    • Generate demo appointments for the sales team (AEs).
    • Increase signup to demo rate and demo attendance.
  • Marketing and sales ops
    • In charge of all the backbone that enables marketing and sales operations.
    • In charge of data pipeline, dashboards, reporting and marketing stack.

Required qualifications

  • Communication and user experience skills
    • Excellent communication skills both written and spoken.
    • Being able to communicate by synthesizing complex topics in a simple and crisp way.
    • Be able to paint the picture on how to push beautiful end-to-end experiences for users.
  • Analytical skills
    • Excellent analytical skills for metrics and conversion rates.
    • Understanding on how to measure both inputs and outputs of marketing efforts.
    • Experience with marketing automation tools, analytics tools, dashboards and SQL.
  • Management skills
    • Experience achieving goals by managing a team.
    • Experience outsourcing tasks (video creation, content, ads, data gathering, etc).
  • Experience
    • 3+ years experience in relevant demand generation positions in the software industry
    • Proven track record of hitting or exceeding goals
    • Experience working with marketing automation and sales enablement tools
  • Profile
    • You are highly organized & autonomous
    • You are comfortable and energized operating in a fast moving organization
    • You are entrepreneurial and self-motivated
    • You are intellectually curious and ambitious

Nice to have

  • Programming skills.
  • Familiarity with machine learning algorithms, statistics, NLP.

Tools we use

  • Marketing
    • Marketing automation: Hubspot, Buffer, Google Optimize, Intercom, Chameleon, Delighted
    • Analytics & Data: Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, Segment, Clearbit, Mixpanel, Mode Analytics, SQL.
    • Content & SEO: Moz, Google Search Console, WordPress
  • Project management
    • Asana, Notion, Google Calendar and Google Docs
  • Communication
    • Gmail, Slack and Zoom
  • Productivity
    • Zapier

Working at MonkeyLearn

  • Join a growing startup in an innovative industry backed by top tier investors in Silicon Valley
  • Work in real world machine learning and natural language processing projects
  • Work with top companies from all over the world, particularly from Silicon Valley, Los Angeles, and New York
  • Friendly and thriving team
  • Flexible time
  • Remote team distributed between United States, Europe and South America
Apply for job

items.title: Director of Product Management
items.content:
Director of Product Management at Airbase

Remote | High-paying | International

Director of Product Management (Remote)

$90k – $125k • 0.1% – 0.2%

Location: Remote

Job type: Full-time

Visa sponsorship: Not available

Experience: 10+ years

Skills: Product Management

About Us

Airbase is the first all-in-one spend management platform that provides companies unparalleled control and visibility into every dollar spent. Finance teams deserve a solution that eliminates the tedious work involved in managing spend and allows them to focus on being strategic partners to the rest of the business. We do that by replacing the multiple systems typically used to manage spend with a single platform that handles every workflow including expense approvals and payments (physical cards, virtual cards, ACH, check), while also automating away the bulk of spend-related accounting. Learn more about why innovative companies like Gusto, Segment, Doximity, Getaround, Netlify, and more trust Airbase at airbase.com

About the Job
You’ll be working closely with the Founder/CEO and the rest of the Airbase product team to define and build the Airbase product. This is an opportunity to have a big impact and define how the product management function evolves as we grow. We’re looking for someone who thrives in the very early stages of a company and is self driven.

Responsibilities

Identify Problems & Priorities

  • Apply skills from user science, analytics and business acumen to identify customer and user problems.
  • Apply the lens of strategy, user goals and Airbase purpose to prioritize problems to solve.

Communicate

  • Evangelize and communicate the product plan.
  • Apply low fidelity design to present vision for solutions to problems.

Collaborate

  • Collaborate with engineers and designers to arrive at the detailed solutions to problems.
  • Collaborate with Sales and Customer Success to understand and eliminate obstacles to adoption and usage.
  • Work with Marketing to bring new features to life on various communication touch points.

Execute

  • Own the roadmap for one or more parts of the product.
  • Work with engineering and design to plan launch scope.
  • Together with engineering and design, break-down scope into launch iterations.

Team and Practice Health

  • Ensure team health, career development and coaching and mentoring tailored to individual goals.
  • Ensure product practices are followed, apply good judgement when needed to violate them.
  • Help Airbase evolve product practices for increasing scale, efficiency and customer value.

Own Strategy for a Product Area

  • Develop and share your rock solid understanding of customers and the business.
  • Use data to define and articulate goals that will be in line with overall product goals.
  • Align team plans, PMs and Sr. PMs ownership-breakdowns that address product goals.

Requirements

  • Excellent communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills.
  • You should have worked at a startup or started your own company that shipped a product and generated meaningful revenue.
  • An engineering / technical background that will allow you to reason about product trade-offs and make good choices without significant input from engineers.
  • You should have been a practicing engineer for at least 2 years before becoming a product manager.
  • At least 7-8 years of experience in a Product Management role.
  • You should have a track record of shipping high quality products and features and owning the process end-to-end.
  • Experience building modern web applications.
  • Familiarity with modern UX/UI patterns.
  • Attention to detail great products are all about the details.
  • Passionate about joining a small team and building a company.
  • Experience managing a team of product managers.
  • Experience owning a large-scoped area of product.
  • Experience of closely working with cross-functional teams outside the product team, such as Customer Success, Marketing, Sales.

Nice to haves

  • Experience shipping mobile apps.
  • Side projects that help us get a sense for your interests

We offer competitive cash compensation and very attractive equity (this AngelList post has wide ranges, but it really depends on your experience and skill). We’re a remote team and are happy to work with candidates from anywhere in the world.

Apply for job

items.content:
Head of Engineering - £90k-120k / equity available


An exciting task is waiting for you:


Shape the future of the technology and people working behind distributed personal data accounts! As our first Head of Engineering, your mission will be to build a high-profile, high-impact technology products and an attractive engineering culture together with our CTO. In close collaboration with the technical and product teams, you will define and architect our technical stack, write and review testable high quality code, shape our cross-functional development projects, ensure alignment across all tech-related projects and help shape our offering.


Your role in detail:



  • Leading and aligning our engineering projects

  • Scaling up the teams and operations through hiring and people development and supporting timely delivery of technical solutions to address business needs

  • Providing your teams with the best possible environment and selecting the optimum technical solutions for building and optimizing the technology stack

  • Advocating and advancing modern, agile software development practices and helping develop and evangelise great engineering and organisational practices

  • Evaluating outsourcing opportunities and strategy

  • Growing a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values

  • Managing goals and expectations and creating a comprehensive and relevant OKR structure


 


What we definitely need:



  • A University degree in Computer Science or a related field (exceptions possible)

  • 5+ years’ experience in software engineering

  • 2+ years’ experience in leading, managing and coaching cross-functional teams

  • A solid experience working in an agile development environment

  • Proven experience in designing and implementing services on the cloud

  • Polyglot and full-stack understanding of technology

  • Passion for a clean and appropriately tested code

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking

  • Comfortable with uncertainty or ambiguity

  • Willingness and experience with both strategic and more detailed tasks


Extra bonus points for:



  • Hybrid cloud architecture experience

  • Previous experience with Scala or other functional programming languages

  • Familiarity with enterprise systems in a large corporation setting


 


What Dataswift stands for:


Dataswift provides personal data account solutions in the form of app-issued, user-owned infrastructure.


We believe the whole world’s been building apps and websites wrong. We’ve been storing user data and corporate data on the same servers, when we should have been storing user data on the user side. Company-owned user data is expensive and it’s pretty bad. It’s non-dynamic, non-representative, single-source information that costs every website and app in the world 23% of their engineering budget.


The Dataswift API-driven technology platform lets companies give user information back to their users, storing on user-owned infrastructure  instead of on their corporate servers. They don’t have to change anything else about their app or technology in order to do this. Dataswift is working with dozens of companies around the world,  including some of the largest pharmaceuticals and smallest, fastest-growing FinTechs.


 


Dataswift Culture & Values


Your impact: With your expertise and commitment you will actively shape our growth and the team itself! With our mission lock, the company is set to generate global social impact through changing the internet. 


Teamwork: We pride ourselves on working around each other’s constraints. Need flexible hours due to childcare? We do that already. Need to work remotely part of the week due to personal commitments? We do that already. 


Stable environment: We have just raised seed funding which will take us to the end of 2020 and we have guaranteed commitment from our investors on Series A funding if we successfully reach our goals in the next 16 months. 


Growth: We have a 20% rule which means that we believe in learning through failure and growing by reaching for the stars so we expect to fail 20% of our goals. 


 


The team’s favourite benefits:



  1. Remote working options 

  2. Unlimited holiday

  3. Budget for personal development and training

  4. Countryside office if you prefer the peace and quiet of Cambridge countryside

  5. Regular team away days and bonding time


We believe in the diversity of our team and we don’t judge based on gender, sexual orientation, socio-economic background, history, culture, geography, nationality or any other possible discriminatory category. If you feel you don’t match every single specification, reach out to us at your.future.with@dataswift.io to discuss your options further.


Reach out to us on AngelList to hear more!


Recruiters: We do not accept candidates through agencies. Please do not reach out to us as we are not interested in recruitment services at this moment in time.

items.title: Sales Development Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=15, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
DESCRIPTION


Who are Opensignal?

Opensignal, a mobile analytics company, is the global standard for measuring real-world mobile network experience. Using billions of measurements collected 24/7 from tens of millions of smartphones, we analyze real-world mobile network experience at the largest scale and frequency in the wireless industry. We believe measuring how the network performs directly through users’ eyes is key to building better wireless networks. Our insights are used across the industry by mobile operators, telecoms regulators, equipment manufacturers and analysts. We have done business across six continents and have driven press headlines in 80 countries, in an industry impacting the lives of billions around the world.


Founded in 2010, Opensignal is a high-growth global company harnessing the power of mobile technologies and big data analytics to redefine how the mobile industry measures network performance. We’re part of theGlobal Telecoms ‘Power 100’, TechCity Future Fifty, and backed by an impressive portfolio of investors.


Having doubled our employee base to 60 at the beginning of 2019, we plan to grow beyond 80 by the end of 2019, to help drive our vision further. We're headquartered in London, UK, where you’ll find most of our employees, who we like to call 'Opensignalers', but the teams you'll work with are global. A truly international team, our ‘Opensignalers’ work acrossfour continents, and represent over 25 nationalities.


Find out more by visiting our website.


Purpose of the role


We have seen our revenues grow significantly over the last few years. To help fuel the growth, we have recently developed several innovative, unique offerings to our marketplace.


As a result, we are hiring our first Inside Sales team. This new team will work alongside the existing global sales team, helping them drive revenues, increase their effectiveness in the marketplace and enhance our global position as the independent global standard on mobile network experience.


A vital part of the new Inside Sales function will be to maintain and execute sales campaigns to the top ‘C’ level executives at Mobile Operators across Europe, Asia Pacific and North and South America. As the role will have a genuine global focus, you’ll be working across multiple time zones.


It is a great time to join as you’ll be at the beginning of our Inside Sales initiative, you’ll get exposure throughout the company and be at the forefront of driving and increasing our revenues and presence in the marketplace.


 


As Sales Development Manager, you will be responsible for:



  • Outbound lead generation and selling of Opensignal proposition to named target Mobile Operators and Regulators

  • Research and verify contact details for target ‘C’ level executives in target accounts and manage contacts in Opensignal CRM system

  • Establish and administer executive communication with Mobile Operators and Regulators within target markets

  • Promote Opensignal public reports and analysis to targeted Mobile Network Operators

  • Follow up with targeted executives to promote Opensignal’s value propositions

  • Manage inbound leads appropriately following standard process and in a timely manner

  • Qualify leads and nature of interest in Opensignal – pass to field sales or remotely execute direct sale of the Opensignal entry-level solutions

  • Adhere to Opensignal operating principles, methodology and brand standards

  • Working with product management/sales leadership to maintain Opensignal low-level entry product collateral to support outbound marketing/sales

  • Use Opensignal CRM system to track opportunities and distribute leads (close.io)

  • Work closely with field sales leaders, sales management, marketing and product marketing to support company sales objectives and to optimise team effectiveness.

  • Evolve and execute the process and practice for effective sales development, in support of revenue growth for Opensignal

  • Report on activity and results weekly and quarterly to senior management


This role will require time spent in our Global HQ in London, but many responsibilities can be conducted remotely. Flexible working hours will be required due to the time zones involved.




REQUIREMENTS


What we need from you



  • An enthusiastic, self-starter who can hit the ground running

  • Ambition to develop knowledge, skills and experience in sales and marketing operations of a B2B business supplying high value technology solutions to large enterprises

  • Previous experience in an outbound sales development or inside sales role, creating value propositions

  • Experience collaborating with senior field sales personnel across the globe

  • Knowledge of the global Mobile Communications industry would be a distinct advantage

  • A graduate (or equivalent) with strong interest in international commercial business

  • Expertise, confidence and capability to converse with senior ‘C’ level executives

  • Highly organised and efficient with strong attention to detail

  • Team player with strong determination to succeed, excellent interpersonal skills and with instant credibility at senior level

  • Highly articulate with excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills.

  • Fluent in English language. Written command of Spanish language an advantage.

  • Solution marketing expertise would be advantageous

  • Highly personable and a team player

  • Conversant in CRM and process tools


 


Additional personal attributes:



  • Entrepreneurial spirit and commercially astute

  • Highly committed with highest level of integrity

  • Creative but focused on delivery

  • Open and direct communication

  • Enquiring and diligent




BENEFITS


What will you get in return?


 



  • Competitive salary and stock options to share our growth

  • Matched-contribution based pension scheme, company-wide bonus, private healthcare (including wellbeing subscriptions and discounted gym membership), cycle to work scheme and MacBook of your choice

  • Constant exposure to learning opportunities in your role and the ability to make an impact from day one

  • Personal development budgetfor conferences, courses, materials and training and regular 'OpenSessions' (internal learning talks)

  • Our 'Opensignalers' - an ambitious, focused and friendly team backed by some of Europe's top investors

  • Ability to work flexibly as well as regular all-company events (from team lunches, to monthly HQ socials and bi-annualaway days)

  • HQ in Angel, central London, filled with fresh fruit, coffee and an abundance of snacks and drinks, set in an area buzzingwith coffee shops, eateries, a local market and bars.

items.content:
Head of Sales
London, United Kingdom


We are looking for a seasoned Head of Sales who will be responsible for developing Car Throttle’s commercial offering and managing its sales funnel in the UK market. This is a senior role which requires a candidate with a proven track record of closing media and production campaigns at scale in the automotive / motorsport industry.


The perfect candidate will play a key role in shaping Car Throttle’s offering as a social agency with creativity and production quality at its heart. In addition to being responsible for building commercial partnerships and maximising month-over-month revenue growth, the Head of Sales will also work closely with all teams (finance, video, social) and business stakeholders.


Responsibilities:



  • Spearhead the development of Car Throttle’s UK client portfolio

  • Manage branded content and production-led sales funnels

  • Service existing relationships and acquire new business by taking Car Throttle to market and pitching our offering to prospective clients

  • Develop and maintain in-depth knowledge of the automotive industry, market environment, competitors and trends

  • Instil this knowledge in the wider team and across the company


Nice to have:



  • Working knowledge of production campaigns

  • P&L responsibility at previous media company or agency

  • Black book of contacts within automotive and motorsport industries

  • Experience working on social media first campaigns


Salary: Competitive
Contract: Permanent
Location:London


Benefits:



  • New employee equipment budget including MacBook, screens and devices

  • 21 days paid holiday per year. Office closed over festive period; work from home or take as holiday

  • Fun work environment

  • Monthly work socials; from music quiz night to zorb football

  • Free coffee and a company pension scheme

  • Creating content watched by millions of people everyday

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=9, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Relish was founded in July 2018 by Lesley Eccles, who previously founded FanDuel, (one of Scotland’s largest consumer companies which she grew to over 500 employees and a user base of over 6m customers). Relish closed a seed round of funding at the end of 2018 from Trinity Ventures (a long established Silicon Valley VC firm).


 


Relish is tranforming the relationship advice space with the first-ever truly personalized relationship training app that makes it easy to build a happy, healthy, more connected relationship.


 


Relish is currently only available in the US. Having achieved App of the Day in the US App Store in August 2019, before it even officially launched, this is your chance to get in at the ground floor with a category defining product that is changing the way people live.


 





















We’re looking for a deeply talented product manager who can:




  • Own and further develop the Relish product strategy, build a roadmap to get there, and prioritise the work to deliver it based on key business goals




  • Work creatively to evaluate and analyse areas of the product using data and user insights to solve problems




  • Oversee product development from concept, prototype, specification, design, development, testing, launch, and iteration




  • Maintain a harmonious and productive rhythm between engineering, design, and non-technical stakeholders through good communication and stakeholder management




Reporting directly to the CEO, your day-to-day responsibilities will include:




  • Work closely with the Lead Engineer and CEO to develop and refine high level product strategy




  • Assess value, prioritise stories and areas of work to ensure focus is on those with maximum value and aligned to product strategy.




  • Lead planning, facilitate team conversations, help break work into iterative releases, create and own product release plans and set expectations for delivery.




  • Prioritise and groom the product feature backlog, and also keep track of stakeholder requests, bugs and iterations.




  • Capture and refine product requirements, including analytic events and design requirements




  • Ensure that the team always has an adequate amount of prepared tasks ready to work on.




You will have these skills:




  • Strong project management and organisational skills;




  • Ability to focus on the big picture in terms of what will move the metrics;




  • Attention to detail with excellent follow through skills;




  • Able to deal with multiple priorities or tasks at once;




  • A practical attitude and be adept at problem solving;




  • Strong communicative skills, both written and verbal, and ability to push back;




  • Strong analytical skills to understand how customers are using the product;




  • Knowledge of mobile app development and release processes.




  • Knowledge of Amplitude is a bonus




Who are you likely to be?


You’re an experienced product manager: You have at least 5 years of experience in a similar role, for a consumer technology product. You know how to develop and test ideas, and how to analyse the results to understand the impact of changes


You’re strategic: You’re data-driven and highly analytical. You prioritise strategic choices, over just releasing features. And you know when and when not to go with your gut


You’re creative: You have vision and the skills to communicate your vision and inspire the team, you approach problems with creative thinking.


You can hit the ground running, with experience of working in a startup: You’re willing to do a bit of everything and get your hands dirty (by dirty, we mean anything from providing customer support, QA, to writing in app copy, so not *that* dirty)


You’re agile and able to deal with change: You have experience with agile delivery and development practices but are not devoted to any particular one. You can deal with changes in priority like water off a duck’s back.


You value simplicity: You understand that less is often more. You find the fastest path to deliver maximum value to user.


You are at home with data: You can define success metrics, analyse and monitor features and suggest improvements based on results


You are user-centric: You care about user experiences and are the voice of the customer for the product. You value user feedback, understand user testing best practices, and user-insights inform your decisions.


You have a sense of humour: In case we had to remind you, you’re a team player. You like the people you work with, you might even go for lunch once in a while. :)


 


Why would you want to work with us:


Besides working with a group of cool people, you’ll also get:




  • Professional and personal development – we have a budget for training, conferences, online tutorials etc. We want to make sure we’re creating a learning culture from the outset for everyone




  • Flexible work hours – we don’t focus on being in the office 9-5, you know when you work best




  • Working alongside an incredibly strong, high-performing team




  • Working on a product which not only has massive user growth potential, but also the potential for making a huge positive impact on society




  • Full holiday allowance (25 days + bank holidays)




  • Highly competitive salary




  • Pension (5% contribution from the company)




  • Equity in the company




  • The best equipment and software to go about executing your day-to-day work




  • Relocation package (if required)

items.title: Website Support Project Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Website Support Project Manager at Kanopi Studios

Remote | International

REMOTE · San Francisco, California, United States · Project Management

DESCRIPTION

As a Website Support Project Manager, you’ll work alongside a team of talented experts to deliver high-quality digital materials for a diverse range of clients. You’ll be responsible for leading the charge and guiding clients through their entire project lifecycle; from kickoff to launch, the Support Project Manager is responsible for managing timelines and budgets, as well as collaborating with UX/UI Designers and Developers.

You will take responsibility for the day-to-day execution of client project solutions for academic institutions, nonprofits, and large and small businesses. You will report to the Director of Supportt and will be empowered to collaborate with peers and senior management to enhance processes, provide thoughtful and purposeful feedback on deliverables, collaborate on strategic decisions made by the Kanopi team throughout client engagements, and overall ensure the work produced is of quality, on target and polished.

Please note: you must have worked at at-least two Digital/Website Agencies as a Project Manager/Producer to apply for this job. Drupal/WordPress experience preferred. Due to the volume on inquiries, we are unable to respond to unqualified candidates.

REQUIREMENTS

PROJECT/PRACTICE MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Create and execute project plans, revising as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements
  • Apply waterfall, agile, or a hybrid of both methodologies to deliver high-quality deliverables
  • Generate actionable and detailed tasks for both internal and client teams, and diligently following up to ensure the project and budget are not compromised
  • Review all deliverables prepared by team, ensuring they meet project and business goals before presenting to clients
  • Manage the day-to-day operational aspects of a project including, but not limited to:
    • Identifying, flagging and minimizing or eliminating any potential for risk to the project and Kanopi
    • Establishing and maintaining timelines in accordance with project framework
    • Tracking hours usage and forecasting needed resources for future work
    • Managing expectations and eliminating assumptions with internal resources, as well as client team members
    • Ensuring project deliverables are complete, of quality, current, and stored appropriately
  • Work with clients and Kanopi resources to gather project requirements, determine estimates and draft SOWs
  • Collaborate with technical leads to identify resources and assign individual responsibilities
  • Make strategic internal decisions to ensure the delivery of polished, well-executed, and detailed deliverables
  • Remove ambiguity and blockers, and motivate the project team to make smart decisions regarding the execution of their deliverables
  • Assist with proposal efforts including project scoping, level of effort assessments and project plan development
  • Identify areas of scope creep, building plans for Change Orders as necessary
  • Identify business development and “add-on” sales opportunities, such as support contracts or additional phases of new scope
  • Work to build positive and trusting relationships with client teams

PROJECT ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Ensure timeline and budget accountabilities are appropriately transparent; shifts to either are documented and the appropriate course of action is taken
  • Build and execute detailed project plans, indicating client and internal responsibilities and accountability
  • Understand the internal team’s needs throughout the project life cycle, acting as an advocate for their efforts and coordinating support
  • Ensure internal reviews and revisions of deliverables are properly managed for team success
  • Utilize resources efficiently, queuing work in accordance with project timeline and resource availability
  • Distill and communicate internal team needs to the client in an organized way
  • Review scope of work and strategize (with team collaboration as appropriate) how to best use the budget to execute a successful project
  • Provide sound and anticipatory project organization, articulation, and assumptions as needed for sales proposals
  • Ensure proper checkpoints are in place for budget validation throughout the project life cycle (i.e. ensuring developers are reviewing UX and designs effectively)
  • Take responsibility for logging accurate time against projects in a timely manner
  • Track and report team hours and project expenses internally and in a client-friendly format as appropriate
  • Communicate estimated vs. actual hours to Management Team
  • Monitor and manage project budget
  • Understand basic revenue models, P/L, and cost-to-completion projections, and make decisions accordingly
  • Proactively identify, advocate, and act on areas for internal and process improvement

COMMUNICATION SKILLS:

  • Grow long-lasting partner relationships with clients
  • Create clearly-written communication documents and disseminate recaps, meeting notes, and agendas for client calls to ensure there is a paper trail of needs, blockers, risks, decisions, changes in scope, and approvals
  • Provide a strong voice of reason and leadership during difficult or complex project negotiations
  • Participate in team and client meetings effectively and efficiently
  • Keep project teams well informed of project changes, and changes within the organization that affect daily operations
  • Effectively communicate relevant project information to management
  • Deliver engaging, informative, well-organized presentations
  • Resolve and/or escalate project concerns in a timely fashion
  • Understand how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully and effectively
  • Be the key subject matter expert of your project’s scope – ensure the team is neither communicating nor building in out-of-scope options unintentionally as if they were in-scope
  • Be able to clearly articulate technical challenges or limitations when communicating with client team, in a way that is easily understood by those with limited expertise

WEBSITE DEVELOPMENT UNDERSTANDING:

  • Possess an understanding of web development and user experience design
  • Maintain awareness of new and emerging technologies and industry best practices to potentially be applied on client engagements
  • Understand the abilities and limitations of industry standard technologies at a high level

We know lists of technical requirements can be overwhelming. We’re looking for candidates who care about doing good work for clients and leading strong teams. If this position sounds good to you, but you’re unsure if your skills are in complete alignment, we encourage you to apply.

At Kanopi, we believe a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and voices make for a better workplace. We strongly and enthusiastically encourage people of color, individuals who identify within and beyond the LGBTQ+ spectrum, women, and people with disabilities to apply.

BENEFITS:

Fully Remote: Work where and when you do your best. It’s about feeling connected to others, having a flexible schedule and staying healthy.

Top Talent: Since we are not limited by walls, our ability to hire the best is limitless. Collaborate, learn and surround yourself with a strongly skilled and diverse team.

Travel: Love to see the world? So do we. Just find a place with good wifi, get connected and make great work happen!

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=4, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Vowza HQ is looking for a Head of Product to design and own our iOS offering.


In February, our launch will coincide with our first Wedding Fair showcase.


April will then see Vowza showcased at the UK's largest Wedding Fair, The National Wedding Show.


The successful candidate will have previous experience in UI/UX for native iOS applications. Product Owner experience preferred, but not required. Experience in the wedding industry would be a significant bonus.


As Vowza is pre-launch and pre-revenue, we are looking for someone who understands the startup world, and can commit time to this project in return for a fixed amount of equity in the Company.


This is a great opportunity for someone to enter a Company at an early stage where there is only room to grow.


As an early employee, you would play a vital role in the Company's success going forward, and with the equity given to you, that success may be very rewarding in the future.


 


A little bit of background on Vowza...


 


Vowza is a smartphone application that exists to add value to the happy couple and the guests at their wedding throughout the day, and lifetime of their engagement. 


It does so by putting useful information and tools in the hands of the guests, allowing them to feel a part of the big day in new and exciting ways.


The happy couple can keep their guests in the loop by releasing details of their special day in advance, and also keep them in suspense by releasing certain modules on the big day itself (think food menu and seating plan).


On the day guests can find the venue, find their seats, learn about the wedding party, upload photos and even book their taxi back to the hotel directly from the Vowza app!

items.title: Director of UX Design (Remote!) - Enterprise Saas - Security
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
UX Design, User Experience, User Research, Enterprise, SaaS, UI/UX, Mobile, Usability, Human-Computer Interaction, Web

This is an opportunity to bring your strategic experience to the table, and have a seat at that table with the strategic leadership of the company!

You will play a role in pushing forward the UX practice, and keeping UX Design at the forefront of the of the organization as a priority.

We are looking for a leader to come in and push the UX practice and drive the importance of design as we grow the company.

If you are a UX Design Leader and are interested in helping to build a distributed UX Design team building Enterprise SaaS Security products, please read on!

What You Will Be Doing

Most importantly, you'll have a seat at the leadership table and be trusted to drive strategy for our long-term UX Design plans. This is not just a management position, but certainly a strategic position critical for helping the company grow.

You will be the Head of UX Design for our growing company. You'll be bringing your expertise to execute hands-on while also bringing your experience in building a team and helping to establish the UX practice and grow the organization.

You'll get User Research up and running to ensure that the products we continue building on are based on the user's needs and accomplish our business objectives.

You'll conduct design reviews and gather feedback from users and ensure that we are iterating on application features to improve usability and drive key metrics.

You will define and implement web and mobile best practices for our UX Design group

And more!

What You Need for this Position

More Than 5 Years of experience and knowledge of:

- UX Design

- User Experience

- User Research

- Enterprise

- SaaS

- Security products

- UI/UX

- Enterprise Mobile and web application

- Usability

- Human-Computer InteractionSo, if you are a UX Design Leader with Enterprise SaaS Security product experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Security Clearance will be needed - therefore, only US citizens can be considered.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

items.title: Remote-Senior Director of Revenue Cycle Products
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
SDLC, B2B SaaS Software, B2B data integrations, Client Facing, System Configuration, Technical Consulting Experience, ETL File Process, Web Services, API, web & mobile product development

If you are a seeking a REMOTE Senior Director of Revenue Cycle Products with experience, please read on! Due to our continued growth, we have an amazing opportunity for an experienced Senior Director of Revenue Cycle Productst! All our team works REMOTE; in this role you'll be serving as an active contributor though integration and data conversion of multiple SaaS products for the healthcare market.

The all-encompassing, focused goal of the Senior Director of Revenue Cycle Products is to ensure an unmitigated, massive success of our companies Revenue Cycle Management product and services offering. However, this position may / will also have a view toward broader Product management of similar products as they come online, including building and management of the requisite supporting organizations at our company .

ABOUT THE POSITION

The Senior Director of Revenue Cycle Products will sit at the tip of the spear of these opportunities for our company.

The mission of the Senior Director of Revenue Cycle Products is to ...

...successfully build, manage, and grow our company's Revenue Cycle product portfolio and supporting features, to grow our company's share of personal care agencies serving the Medicaid and Medicare payer markets, and to establish and grow revenue lines related to Revenue Cycle management and 3rd party administrator services.

The role of the Senior Director of Revenue Cycle Products is to be responsible for defining product strategy and go-to-market plans for our company solutions. Deep domain expertise in product management methodologies and Agile development should be combined with the ability to quickly refine plans to meet a rapidly evolving market. We are seeking someone who can operate an executive level, formalizing the product management function/processes, etc. but who is also sufficiently hands-on to work successfully with limited resources/team.

What You Will Be Doing

Provides leadership to and is accountable for the performance and results of products
Manage all bodies of work to be delivered on time and within budget
Develops, translates and executes strategies of functional and operational objectives at the segment level
Demonstrated understanding of report generation and workflow management systems
Develop overall product strategy, manage all aspects of the company's product development including budgeting, forecasting, and ROI and KPI tracking and oversee the product team.
Monitor product performance and identify subset products that no longer meet market needs.
Apply Lean and Scrum principles to guide strategy and process frameworks.
Partner with Sales and Development to ensure product alignment with prospective clients' needs.
Conduct extensive research including interacting with current and prospective customers on a regular basis to inform product development and iterations.
Identify market opportunities, build and prioritize business cases, and see all product initiatives through to completion.
initiatives to completion

What You Need for this Position

7+ years of enterprise Revenue Cycle Management software product management experience; at least 3 years in a managerial/ leadership role.
Experience managing SaaS products in an Agile/Scrum environment is required.
Experience with systems development life cycles (SDLCs.)
Experience in marketing research and product development.
A combination of large and early-stage company experience is preferred.
Proven track record of attracting, recruiting, retaining, and mentoring excellent talent.
Understands the challenges, demands and priorities of a small company. Has operated successfully in environments during periods of significant growth. Has a roll-up-the-sleeves work ethic, and an unshakeable passion for high-quality, profitable product growth within a fast-paced environment. High energy, able and willing to work long hours with minimal support, and is ready for the demands of a high energy company environment.
BA/BS degree, MBA preferred.

REQUIRED PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS

Superb C-suite diplomatic and relationship management skills
Ability to move seamlessly from strategic, innovative, big picture to the finest details to ensure operational success
Growth mindset Ability to operate with lean resources and be hands on and do what it takes to exceed expectations for your teammates, our customers, and our partners
Systems thinking, with operational and process focus and unrelenting attention-to-detail
Highly analytical and metrics-focused
Great management and team leadership ability. Able to create a real following with the team, executive staff, partners and customers
A decisive leader who will be a driving force with customers in creating ubiquitous perceptions of our product leadership
High energy and passionate to help reinforce perceptions of our product, service and thought leadership
Acts for the good of the whole. Does not operate with a personal agenda.
Innately intelligent. Can "read between the lines" with customers and colleagues
A strong desire and willingness to be capital efficient

What's In It for You

REWARD PACKAGE

Compensation will consist of the following elements:

1.The personal reward and stimulation that comes with:
a.Building one of the most exciting and promising healthcare and technology companies in the United States, and one that is doing well by doing good
b.Building a company at the intersection of vertical market SaaS; marketplaces with cross-side network effects; and the highest levels of strategic importance in healthcare
c.The ability to build, create, and innovate with elements of an early stage company combined with the platform and stability of an established, highly profitable industry leader

2.Direct compensation will include:
Strong and competitive base salary and performance-based bonus plan
Solid benefits program
Stock options with material upside

- Ability to work REMOTE

items.title: Help Scout: Head of Product Marketing
items.content:
Head of Product Marketing

Help Scout is a product-led company with 10,000+ paying customers who regularly rave about our platform. Our first product marketing leader will come on board and help us earn the next 10,000 customers—and more. 

We have some established processes and roles that support product marketing throughout the organization, and we're looking for an experienced product marketer to take us to the next level. You'll be responsible for core components of our go-to-market strategy, including audience segmentation and research; product positioning and messaging; feature launches; competitive intelligence; and sales enablement. 

This is a cross-functional role: you'll collaborate closely with our product, engineering, design, support, leadership, and (of course) marketing teams, and play a key role in the testing and evolution of our product positioning.  

Watch this 2-minute video from Justine (the hiring manager) to hear more about what you can expect.

As our Product Marketing leader, you will:


  • Develop a deep understanding of our products, buyers, and markets. You’ll be a trusted partner to our product team, collaborating regularly on feature launch strategies, customer insights, market research, and industry trends. 
  • Own marketing strategy for feature launches. You’ll define the process for working effectively with our product, engineering, support, sales, and marketing teams to ensure the everyone is on the same page with how we’re communicating our new feature launches. That includes defining the target audience; developing messaging around the value of the new feature; pulling together the launch plan; coordinating all marketing activities; and communicating the results throughout the organization. 
  • Drive our approach to audience segmentation. You’ll be responsible for articulating our buyer personas, and developing materials and frameworks to help scale the understanding of those personas across the organization. This will include directing quantitative and qualitative analysis around motivations; perceptions; and business value of different market segments.  
  • Enable our customer-facing teams. That includes overseeing competitive intelligence and training; making sure key use cases and core benefits are communicated clearly in all product-specific messaging; and producing internal and external product materials including case studies; sales collateral; and internal training sessions.
  • Build and lead a high-performance team. Motivate, mentor, and grow the PMM team, ensuring they are set up for success.

About you


  • You’ve hired, developed, and directly managed high-performing B2B SaaS marketing teams at various levels of experience, and those people have wonderful things to say about you. Bonus points for experience with SMB markets or in companies with a hybrid self-service/sales assisted business model. 
  • You are an outstanding communicator, both verbally and in writing. You’re comfortable managing across disciplines at all levels of the organization.
  • You have designed, implemented and executed on scalable processes, naturally documenting your proposals and plans along the way.
  • You have a keen ability to rally people around an idea, drive toward alignment and buy-in, and lead them through to execution.
  • You’re a creative thinker that can connect feature functionality to real-world value, has a passion for storytelling, and a data-driven mindset.
  • You are an excellent active listener with great humility and empathy. You naturally build excellent relationships with your team, and peers. You often debate the other side of issues and try on other people’s perspectives.
  • You relish team and project challenges and enjoy figuring out how to make things better. In stressful situations, you are the calm, steady voice of reason.
  • When needed, you lean in to having difficult conversations with people to resolve a situation and do what is right. You understand the value of direct, transparent, respectful feedback.
  • You believe remote teams are the future of work, or are at least excited about the idea. You have experience working with remote teams or can adjust your work/management style to be remote-friendly.
  • You can work almost anywhere in the world as long as you have 3+ hours of overlap time with US Pacific (GMT-8) working hours or are willing to time shift to accommodate the preferred timezone.

Who you’ll work with:


  • Justine Jordan, CMO—You’ll report to Justine, working together to craft our go-to-market strategy, define the vision for the function, and collaborate across the business to help us reach our goals. 
  • Ben Henderson — Director of Product, along with our product leads
  • Nick Francis, co-founder and CEO – Nick is extremely passionate about product and provides a strong vision for Help Scout. You’ll work closely with him on understanding the market, messaging, and positioning.
  • Product Specialists in the Support Team - Product specialists represent the voice of the customer, track and report on customer insights, and take the lead on creating documentation.
  • The Sales Team—The Help Scout sales team inverts the way sales is typically done. They’re passionate about their craft, which entails putting the customer ahead of the sale.
  • …plus teammates in Design, Marketing, Finance, and more!

items.content:
Scrum Master

Company: Whisbi
Location:
Salary: 40.000 - 50.000 €
Requires Work Permit
Level: Intermediate
Language: English Language: Spanish
Product/Project Management
Skills:
  • Agile Methodologies
  • Confluence
  • JIRA
  • Product Management
  • Scrum

    • Intro

    Whisbi's enterprise conversational sales platform connects online customers with chatbots and omnichannel agents. The company has unparalleled experience working with global enterprises in telecommunications, automotive, travel, insurance and banking. As the chosen partner for some of the world's biggest brands, such as Verizon and Hyundai in the USA, Whisbi plays a crucial role in omni-lead strategies that boost online sales through customer experience. Whisbi's industry-specific insights, workflow customization and AI-powered services have helped its customers to increase their online sales conversion rate tenfold and double their cross-selling.

    To cut to the chase, this is what we do:

    At Whisbi you will find:

    • Diversity: over 15 nationalities, more than 20 languages spoken, empowering tech female talent, colourful backgrounds
    • Passion & Entrepreneurship: owning our work, assuming new responsibilities, generating initiatives, meaningful work, never getting bored
    • Family: inspiration from our colleagues, collaboration across departments, trust & respect for others, fun & laughter
    • Agile & Dynamic mindset: driven toward a common goal, constantly iterating, fast pace, love of technology, ambitious goals

    As a Scrum Master you will:

    • Coach and lead the team in practising Agile principles, identify team training opportunities and engage necessary resources to facilitate
    • Facilitate all of the Scrum ceremonies (backlog grooming, planning meetings, daily stand-ups, retrospectives, demos)
    • Identify, remove and/or escalate risks, roadblocks, and cross-team dependencies that are unresolvable by the team and interfere with the team's ability to deliver commitments
    • Accountable for promoting continuous improvement by coaching the team to use metrics to identify and measure progress
    • Continuously learns new approaches to facilitation, agile best practices and how to improve team dynamics
    • Help the Team to focus on the delivery of high-quality stories on a predictable, sustainable cadence, aligned with the company expectations.
    • Track and communicate engineering metrics -not only about agile (such as team velocity, sprint progress/burn down chart, estimation accuracy, revisions .. ) to the team, management and any impacted stakeholders
    • Bring high energy, motivation, and focus on the team

    Main requirements

    • University degree in computer science, digital media, software engineering, Marketing, Design or similar
    • At least 2+ years of experience in a similar role
    • Advanced Scrum Master or other Agile certification 
    • Deep understanding of Agile product development processes and principles
    • Ability to implement Scrum theory, rules and practices in a real business environment
    • Experience with Atlassian products, including Jira and Confluence
    • Methodological thinking, able to structure and organize tasks

    Perks

    • Flexible compensation plan with tax-free benefits
    • Career progression opportunities
    • Year-long online training platform
    • Flexible & remote work options
    • Gym sponsorship
    • Sunny rooftop terrace in the center of Barcelona
    • 23 days holiday - you choose when to enjoy them
    • Yoga classes in our terrace
    • Fun environment & team: pool table, company events, celebrations, etc.
    • English & Spanish lessons
    • Fresh organic fruit daily
    • Fully equipped kitchen
    • Nespresso coffee, or tea if you prefer :)

items.content:
Legal Executive Assistant at Equivity

Remote | Part-time
  • Admin
  • Remote job

Job description

Equivity is looking for a part-time virtual legal executive assistant who has 3+ years of experience working as an administrative assistant or legal secretary in a law firm and is comfortable remotely managing the administrative needs of a law office. If you enjoy supporting attorneys, pride yourself on your organizational abilities, pay meticulous attention to detail, have excellent communications skills, and thrive in a work-from-home environment, we want to hear from you!

Equivity works closely with our clients to provide them with virtual assistants who are experienced in their field and have successfully worked in a remote or virtual environment. Our law firm clients range from solo practitioners to multi-partner firms, and run across all specialty areas of law including litigation, family law, bankruptcy, real estate, and much more. It is our goal to provide our law firm clients with experienced executive assistants who are familiar with the ins and outs of the day-to-day in a law office environment.

More about our company:

Equivity provides virtual assistance to clients across the United States, with specialties in administrative, marketing, and paralegal support services. Our virtual assistants work with a high degree of autonomy and are responsible for developing relationships with our clients. Because we provide extremely attentive service to our clients, you must be available to respond to client communications during business hours within one hour by email, phone, and text, and be available to work on projects during the business day. All of this work is done remotely, meaning that you can work from home.

The selected candidate would be hired as a part-time employee of Equivity, not an independent contractor. We are looking for somebody who has at least 20 hours per week of availability, and the starting pay is $17.00 per hour. We are a growing business and are looking for a virtual legal assistant who is excited to partner with us and is interested in a long-term role with our company.

Qualities we are looking for:

  • Organization
  • Dedication
  • Initiative
  • Reliability
  • Attention to detail
  • Resourcefulness
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Responsiveness
  • Technologically savvy
  • Ability to work independently with limited oversight

Requirements

Position requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 3+ years of experience as a legal administrative assistant or legal secretary
  • Proficiency in using a practice management system, preferably Clio or My Case
  • Expert with Microsoft Office, including Word, Outlook, Excel and Power Point
  • Ability to format and edit legal briefs, including creating Tables of Contents, Tables of Authorities, and formatting briefs to comply with local rules
  • Proficient with Google suite of programs
  • Proficient with formatting documents in Adobe
  • Availability to make and respond to calls in a professional setting between 9 AM and 6 PM Eastern or Pacific Time
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Your own laptop and smart phone with broadband access to Internet
Apply for job

items.title: Director of Product Marketing
items.content:
Director of Product Marketing at 80Twenty

Remote

FULL TIME | 80TWENTY | UNITED STATES

Job Opening ID: 3807

City: Seattle

State/Province: Washington

Zip/Postal Code: 98612

Industry: Beauty/Fashion

Job Description

Our client, one of the most dominant consumer-facing names online in the aesthetics industry, is looking for a Director of Product Marketing to specifically focus on their B2B services. This company’s office is located in Seattle, WA, but they are open to 100% remote anywhere in the U.S. for the right candidate! This person will be a player-coach, responsible for shaping their messaging, positioning, content voicing, and GTM strategy, in addition to personally creating various content pieces and sales collateral in conjunction with the sales team. Ideal candidates will be scrappy, B2B-focused Product Marketing veterans with experience leading teams in addition to a strong desire to personally execute initiatives.

This is an excellent opportunity with a dominant name in their space which just received a very large infusion of VC funding, and offers excellent compensation plus benefits!

Responsibilities:

  • Oversee the go-to-market plans for new products and solutions, including value proposition, positioning, messaging, customer development, channel strategy and overall go-to-market (pre-launch); and sales enablement and demand generation (post-launch) to ensure product market fit and to drive revenue.
  • Be the subject matter expert on how the client’s provider customers approach marketing themselves to acquire patients. Developing actionable marketing campaigns based on quantitative and qualitative insights
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Sales and Marketing to: 1) Ensure they all understand customer insights/needs to build the right solution for doctors, 2) Outline content & sales marketing needs and building materials and programs that support those needs
  • Oversee the transition and delivery experience of an improved ROI-based product solution to clients
  • Evangelize the customer perspective internally; providing data driven insights and anecdotal feedback that helps bring customer-centricity to the whole company

Requirements

  • 10+ years marketing experience delivering highly successful engagement, loyalty and retention strategies
  • Software/tech/B2B experience is a must; two-sided online marketplace experience is a huge plus (think Ebay, Amazon, etc)
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills and proven leadership driving collaboration and results through cross-functional teams and peers
  • Ability to develop, execute, and communicate a long-term strategic vision, while also balancing immediate priorities and opportunities in a dynamic, rapidly changing, team-based environment with multiple internal decision makers and stakeholders
  • Strong preference for an analytics background and ability to turn key data points into strategic insights that inform business/comms directions and key outcomes
  • Experience working with B2B sales team
  • Strong project management skills, and the ability to manage multiple deadlines and objectives
  • Bachelor’s degree
Apply for job
