items.title: MonkeyLearn: Head of Demand Generation
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Head of Demand Generation

MonkeyLearn is an easy-to-use machine learning solution that empowers companies to create new value from their data. 

Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing are cutting-edge technologies that have the potential to disrupt the way we work and boost our daily productivity. At MonkeyLearn we're on a mission to make this technology accessible for everybody. 

We work together with customers from top tech companies in Silicon Valley, Los Angeles, and New York. We are backed by top tier investors including Uncork Capital, Bling Capital and angel investors including Des Traynor, Eoghan McCabe (Intercom), Henry Ward (Carta), Howie Liu (Airtable), Alex Solomon (PagerDuty), and Anthony Goldbloom (Kaggle/Google). 

We’re looking for a strategic, data-driven, customer centric and ambitious leader who will own the sales pipeline generation and new business revenue growth. 

Reporting directly to the CEO, you will be responsible for establishing a scalable lead generation and growth strategy. This is a great opportunity to make a big impact at a fast-growing and results-driven startup in a new software category. 

We are looking for a self-starter, entrepreneurial and experienced marketer who is comfortable with both the analytical and creative aspects of leading a holistic demand generation strategy. Both working as an individual contributor and able to manage a team. 

As part of a remote team we need people that can live by our values, and that we can trust to perform with limited supervision. You'll be joining a small team and will have an immediate impact on our product and customers. 

Job duties and responsibilities 

  • Maximum responsible for generating sales pipeline.
  • Attract leads (MQLs) with multiple channels: 
    • Content & SEO
      • Work with our existing content & SEO team to get this channel to the next level.
    • Product marketing 
      • Create product marketing content on how to use MonkeyLearn for different use cases and integrations with third party applications. 
      • Develop co-marketing partnerships with third party applications. 
      • Generate leads from referred traffic from partner applications, forums and social. 
    • Paid
      • Experiment with multiple paid channels.
    • SDR
      • Experiment with outbound campaigns.
  • Engage leads (Active MQLs) 
    • Design, run and measure the right experiments to optimize conversion rates in our website, content and product.
    • User onboarding (email and in-app).
    • Pre and post signup user nurturing.
  • Convert qualified leads (SQLs) 
    • Generate demo appointments for the sales team (AEs).
    • Increase signup to demo rate and demo attendance.
  • Marketing and sales ops 
    • In charge of all the backbone that enables marketing and sales operations. 
    • In charge of data pipeline, dashboards, reporting and marketing stack. 

Required qualifications 

  • Communication and user experience skills 
    • Excellent communication skills both written and spoken. 
    • Being able to communicate by synthesizing complex topics in a simple and crisp way. 
    • Be able to paint the picture on how to push beautiful end-to-end experiences for users. 
  • Analytical skills 
    • Excellent analytical skills for metrics and conversion rates. 
    • Understanding on how to measure both inputs and outputs of marketing efforts. 
    • Experience with marketing automation tools, analytics tools, dashboards and SQL. 
  • Management skills 
    • Experience achieving goals by managing a team. 
    • Experience outsourcing tasks (video creation, content, ads, data gathering, etc). 
  • Experience 
    • 3+ years experience in relevant demand generation positions in the software industry 
    • Proven track record of hitting or exceeding goals 
    • Experience working with marketing automation and sales enablement tools 
  • Profile 
    • You are highly organized & autonomous 
    • You are comfortable and energized operating in a fast moving organization 
    • You are entrepreneurial and self-motivated 
    • You are intellectually curious and ambitious 

Nice to have 

  • Programming skills.
  • Familiarity with machine learning algorithms, statistics, NLP.

Tools we use 

  • Marketing 
    • Marketing automation: Hubspot, Buffer, Google Optimize, Intercom, Chameleon, Delighted 
    • Analytics & Data: Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, Segment, Clearbit, Mixpanel, Mode Analytics, SQL. 
    • Content & SEO: Moz, Google Search Console, Wordpress 
  • Project management
    • Asana, Notion, Google Calendar and Google Docs
  • Communication
    • Gmail, Slack and Zoom
  • Productivity
    • Zapier

Working at MonkeyLearn 

  • Join a growing startup in an innovative industry backed by top tier investors in Silicon Valley
  • Work in real world machine learning and natural language processing projects
  • Work with top companies from all over the world, particularly from Silicon Valley, Los Angeles, and New York
  • Friendly and thriving team
  • ⏰ Flexible time
  • Remote team distributed between United States, Europe and South America
See all of our positions here.

items.title: Microsoft: Program Manager II
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Program Manager II

Microsoft is leading the security industry with enterprise and cloud-based security products. Our team is at the forefront of this, with a focus on Azure Security Center (ASC), Azure Sentinel and Azure Network Security (Firewall, DDOS, WAF).  We sit between our developers and our customers; and it's our job to create deep engineering relationships with the field, our customers, and our partners. As a Deployment Success PM, you'll play an important role in shaping our products. 
 
This Role will focus on Network Security (Firewall, DDOS, WAF).
 
Our Mission: To drive usage and adoption of our security products and services through deep engineering relationships with the field, our customers and our partners. 
 
Our team sits in a space of new teams and technologies, so we are constantly learning and growing every day. We want people who are passionate and want to learn deeply, every day.
 
FAQs: 
Is this position located remotely or is it based in Redmond? 
  • We are a hybrid team spread globally. Team members are in Redmond, Israel, Europe, and all throughout the US. Because of this, we are very open to hiring remote individuals. 

Responsibilities

What you'll do to help us achieve our mission: 
  • Dig deep into the technologies as a Subject Matter Expert 
  • Learn & evangelize the story behind our security solutions for both internal and external audiences. This includes participating in events like Ready, Ignite, and Tech Summits.
  • Help our customers understand how to validate successful deployments and to interpret detections and alerts 
  • Recognize our customers’ needs, and how these needs drive or don't drive deployments/usage, and what blockers exist 
  • Work closely with engineering, sales, and support teams to handle customer inquiries and incidents raised through customer interaction channels by addressing questions directly or routing to the appropriate resource and tracking to resolution 
  • Find blockers, bugs, and feature opportunities and partner with our engineering teams to resolve issues and drive fixes into future products 
  • Tell the customer story internally to drive the evolution of our products 
  • You will contribute writing samples such as Azure Logic Apps playbooks, PowerShell scripts, ARM templates for Azure Policy to enable customers to operationalize product usage in their environments 
  • Matintain an up to date your demo/lab environment for effective demonstration, problem solving, and learning 
 
Ideally, you demonstrate experience, passion, and proficiency in these areas: 
  • Azure Fundamentals, Security, Networking, and Firewall 
  • Good collaboration and communication skills for effective internal and external relationships 
  • Proven critical thinking and problem-solving skills 
  • Excellent organizational skills with ability to consolidate and integrate a wide range of inputs 
  • Experience working with customers and field sales teams with a strong customer satisfaction track record in customer facing role 
  • Technical curiosity and aptitude to quickly master service capabilities, technical issues, business trends, and customer needs 

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:
  • 2+ years of networking technical experience (PM or equivalent experience)
  • 2+ years of direct customer engagement experience
Preferred Qualifications:
  • You enjoy working on a team and collaborating both in person and remotely.
  • You possess a desire to roll up your sleeves and make things happen.
  • You are confident, self-motivated, and enthusiastic.
  • You are willing to travel, as needed.
  • Bachelor's degree preferred
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:   
- Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
 
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
 
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Benefits and Perks

  • Industry leading healthcare
  • Savings and investments
  • Giving programs
  • Educational resources
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Opportunities to network and connect
  • Discounts on products and services
  • Generous time away

items.title: Client Project Manager
items.content:
Client Project Manager at Keyphraseology

Remote | International

We’re seeking a sharp, detail-oriented, Client Project Manager to design and fill a new role and function in Keyphraseology. We’re looking for a knowledgeable leader to streamline our systems and processes for client projects with an excellent intuition for client rapport. Ultimately, the Client Project Manager’s duties are to ensure that all projects are completed on time, within budget and meet high-quality standards.

Responsibilities

    • Client Meeting Assistance
    • Prepares and circulates meeting agendas, follow-up notes, and action items.
    • Coordinates and schedules meetings when a large group is involved.
    • Builds trust and rapport with clients as an additional point person.
    • Project Management
    • Assigns, tracks, monitors internal action items and deliverables.
    • Tracks, reports on, and follows-up on action items assigned to clients.
    • Maintains a detailed log of implementation activity for each client and handles any issues that arise.
    • Make sure that clients’ needs are met as projects evolve.
    • Budget Tracking
    • Ensures that client budgets are properly utilized each month
    • Monitors team time tracking to ensure deliverables and budget hours are properly utilized for each client.
    • Operations Systems Ownership
    • Google Drive (document migrations, client access, security, organization, access)
    • Time tracking system (currently varied, messy)
    • Project Management system (currently Trello)
    • Administration
    • Supports consultants where necessary

Requirements

  • Proven PM skills and work experience, with a broad knowledge of SaaS project management tools and their capabilities.
  • Excellent time management skills as you will collaborate with clients and internal teams (in multiple time zones) to deliver results on deadlines.
  • Excellent verbal and communication skills via phone, email, and video conferencing in English
  • Detail-oriented
  • Confidence, leadership
  • Strong client-facing and teamwork skills
  • Business knowledge
  • Manage multiple projects/priorities/team members
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Documents (including Google sheets)
  • This position is 100% remote. Your work hours can be scheduled around a North American or European timezone. Occasionally, and with notice, you’ll be asked to accommodate a client call at an unusual hour.

Bonus Points

  • Experience in SEO or digital marketing
  • Google Analytics GAIQ certification
  • Agency experience
  • Previous experience working in a remote role
  • Proficiency in additional languages is greatly valued

items.title: Senior Risk Policy Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Risk Policy Analyst at JPMorgan Chase

Remote

REMOTE/ANYWHERE

OPERATIONS – RISK

FULL-TIME

WePay is rapidly growing and is actively seeking a Senior Risk Policy Analyst to be a part of its risk team. If you are passionate about building risk policy for a growing online payment team, making thoughtful business decisions and mentoring individuals to grow, this may be the right role for you.

WePay risk is growing its risk policy team to match a growing portfolio of small and medium businesses. The Senior Risk Policy Analyst will help create new risk policies and modify existing policies for the growing merchant portfolio. This role will work directly with senior risk management to come up with credit and fraud risk policies, and contribute directly to WePay’s financial and regulatory goals. In addition, this role will help shape WePay’s risk procedures and products to align with risk policy.

In this position, you will constantly be faced with challenging and interesting policy decisions that will impact and influence the bottom line of the company. That means no two days are the same. The individual who joins this team will have a chance to work in the areas of risk product, policy, detection, and analytics, as well as influence credit risk and fraud review teams. You will have an opportunity to expand your skills and be able to determine your future career path.

Please note that this position can be remote, or it can be seated in our office in Providence, Rhode Island.

What You Will Do

    • Create and modify risk and underwriting policies based on portfolio risk and market needs
    • Make decisions on the direction of risk management based on and supported by data
    • Prepare appropriate documentation and update internal software programs pertaining to policy decision changes
    • Work with analytics and reporting teams to come up with new credit risk policy for WePay’s high exposure merchant portfolio
    • Collaborate closely with product, engineering, and data science teams to ensure risk policy decisions are included in product and process changes
    • Discuss and communicate policy decisions to management as necessary
    • Collaborate with risk operations teams to ensure policy changes are operational downstream
    • Assist product teams in creating risk-mitigating controls as appropriate
    • Other duties as needed

What We Are Looking For

    • MUST have 3+ years of experience building and overseeing risk policy at a payments company or in financial services
    • Demonstrable experience in making and executing sound risk policy decisions, especially using both data and good judgment
    • Analytical skills (SQL, Excel) and database experience a huge plus
    • Experience working with product and engineering teams a plus
    • Experience in working with rule engines a plus
    • Attention to detail and accuracy
    • Good analytical and problem-solving skills
    • Strong email communication skills

About WePay

WePay’s mission is to make commerce seamless. Our products help software companies integrate payments into their applications – thereby empowering small businesses and individuals to get paid easily and quickly using their go-to apps and software. Our customers include BigCommerce, GoFundme, Meetup and Freshbooks, just to name a few. By joining forces with JPMorgan Chase, a global financial services firm with over $2.5 trillion in assets that serves millions of customers worldwide, WePay is now able to connect our customers seamlessly into a range of banking services beyond payments. WePay is a unique place to work and offers the best of both worlds. WePay has a FinTech startup culture that emphasizes transparency, collaboration and career growth, with the ability to work on small, nimble teams. However, now combined with the power of JPMorgan Chase, employees are also able to create change at scale and have an opportunity to truly disrupt and shape FinTech.

You can find more information at wepay.com

To all recruitment agencies: WePay does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, WePay employees, or any other company location. WePay is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Apply for job

items.title: Program Manager (SaaS Marketplace)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
About us:


Crozdesk.com runs software marketplaces and comparison sites helping businesses globally decide on which software solutions to use. From CRM to Accounting and Marketing Automation to Supply Chain Management - we cover 250+ categories of business software and compare almost everything for our users! Our vendor solutions portal helps thousands of software companies connect with their ideal customers.


We have a dynamic team that's distributed globally with our head office (4 - 5 people) based in Shoreditch, London - which is where you will be located.


If you like a collaborative and productive environment in which responsibilities are shared and where you'll come in contact with all aspects of the business, you'll fit right in.


 


The role:


We are looking for an entrepreneurial self-starter, with a hands-on attitude and a knack for details. You will work on a new program that we are currently piloting that helps software buyers find the information they need through dynamically generated recommendation reports and seamless vendor introductions. You will work with partners, software vendors, users and technical colleagues to refine, test, tweak and scale this digital matchmaking machine. You will run campaigns to promote the program, build new partnerships and develop your own ideas to scale the new program through our marketplaces and wider partner network.


The role sits at the intersection between marketing, sales, product management, customer success and program strategy. Since you will be the point person on this, the program’s success is your success. You will get the chance to earn a bonus and get stock options in line with the program performance. If you are a versatile individual who’s up for a challenge, this role is right for you.


 


Requirements:



  • 1.5+ years of marketing, operations or sales experience in B2B tech and/or startups

  • A Bachelor's degree or above with a demonstrable interest in business, technology, statistics or analytics

  • A keen understanding of the SaaS / software market and marketplaces in general

  • Experience working with CRMs, planning and implementing sales and marketing strategies and dealing with B2B clients

  • Experience working with large datasets (Excel, Google Sheets, etc)

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • The ability to foster and grow client relationships

  • An entrepreneurial mindset and good technical acumen


 


We offer competitive salaries, a direct and uncapped bonus structure based on the program performance, attractive stock options and pension benefits - all of which will scale with the impact you have on our business. Your base salary will depend on your level of experience and overall skillset.


 


Base: £25K – £35K    Bonus: based on program performance


Stock Options: based experience and probation performance


 


Join us at Crozdesk and become part of our fast-paced, close-knit team in a flexible role with plenty of responsibilities and room for growth!

Director of Product Management at Nozomi Networks

Remote

Product – United States – Full Time

items.title: Operations Director
items.content:
Operations Director at Shogun

Remote | High-paying | International

$100k – $140k • 0.0% – 0.25%

We are: Shogun, a powerful page builder platform for eCommerce stores, and we’re on a mission to empower anyone to easily create high converting eCommerce pages, through a delightful product experience.

We were in the Winter 2018 batch of Y-Combinator, we’re backed by Initialized Capital, and we have over 10,000 active paying clients.

We are looking for: An Operations Manager who will help leadership scale our international organization. This includes having a role in human resources, legal, finance, and business administration.

Responsibilities

  • Developing, implementing, and reviewing organizational processes and policies.
  • Recruiting and screening for non-technical roles, including growth, design, and support.
  • Creating and managing our team member on-boarding process
  • Working with leadership and management to create and maintain a program for career roadmaps and performance reviews.
  • Working with leadership to formalize and administer compensation bands and benefit plans.
  • Planning our annual company wide offsite.
  • Working with Cofounders on legal projects focused on compliance.
  • Running payroll and contractor payments.
  • Drafting contractor agreements and offer letters.
  • Working with founders and accountants on budgeting and financial projections
  • Working with our accounting firm on reconciliation.
  • Working with the cofounders to determine values and mission, and plan for short and long-term goals.

Requirements

  • 5+ years experience business management experience, preferably Operations experience.
  • Ability to build consensus and relationships among leadership, managers, and employees.
  • Exceptional attention to detail paired with excellent note taking abilities.
  • Analytical and data-driven mindset
  • Excellent communication skills.

We use

  • Clubhouse
  • Slack
  • Notion

We offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Competitive equity
  • Benefits (Health and PTO)
  • A highly skilled and dedicated team that is fun to work with.
  • Remote work – We are a fully distributed team that works from anywhere with good internet.

Please Note:
Our team is fully distributed and global (check out our team page). We have no office. You should be comfortable with remote work.
Sometimes we hire on a full time contractor basis to begin with. Team members enjoy the same opportunities for great compensation, full time positions, equity, and consideration, regardless of location.

Apply for job

items.content:
Head of Growth

Microverse (YC S19) is looking for a Head of Growth to build and lead our growth and marketing team, identify and execute on new acquisition and strategic opportunities to grow the business, and report directly to the CEO.

Potential Duties & Responsibilities

- Identify, develop, and prioritize student acquisition initiatives.
- Conduct weekly acquisition experiments to improve KPIs
- Develop new approaches to measure the effectiveness of all growth initiatives.
- Deeply understand Microverse’s applicant journey and student personas.
- Collaborate with Admissions, Student Success, and Career Services departments to align on our overall business strategy.
- Manage the production and distribution of marketing content, landing pages, and testimonial videos.
- Manage relationships with our agencies and partners.
- Lead the hiring of future growth and marketing team members.

Education, Skills, and Experience

- 5+ years of experience in high-growth startups, ideally in marketing or growth roles for a company with a large top of the funnel and a relatively longer consideration process.
- 2+ years of experience working at the intersection of marketing and product
- Experience building a growth or marketing team from the ground up
- The ability to quickly switch between high-level growth strategy and “scrappy” execution
- Excellent written communication skills
- Strong time management skills


You ideally...

- Have prior startup and remote work experience for a global company
- Have been described as resourceful, proactive, and entrepreneurial
- Have high empathy for working with individuals from different countries and cultures
- Are eager to experiment and learn
- Are based in Europe/Americas/Africa (for maximum timezone overlap with the rest of the team)
- Consider yourself to be a global citizen and passionate about making opportunity more equally distributed around the world
- Are familiar with working with tools such as Typeform, Airtable, Zapier, Customer.io, and GitHub

What we offer

- Opportunity to join a rapidly growing company and shape our direction and organization.
- The opportunity to join the whole team at company retreats somewhere around the world once every nine months or so.
- Work alongside a fully distributed team that lives all around the world and is from 7 different countries that believe in our core values:

1. We are global citizens
2. We are passionate about our mission
3. We invest in people
4. We are eager learners
5. We are transparent
6. We take ownership of our work
7. We live a harmonious life

How to apply

Send us a short paragraph (through AngelList) telling us why you think you are a great fit for this position. Include the word "coffee" at the beginning so we know you read the entire job description :)

* The position is a full-time remote position.

Microverse is an equal opportunity employer and acts in this capacity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability.

items.title: Microsoft Dynamics AX/D365 F&O Project Manager - Remote
items.content:
Job Description

As Microsoft Dynamics AX/D365 F&O Project Manager, manage project life-cycle implementations to a high level of quality and customer satisfaction, through the use of Columbus methodology, ensuring the delivery of an end product capable of achieving the agreed and defined business requirements and entered agreements in a profitable manner.

Open to location: This position can work remote and reside anywhere in the U.S.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Provide Project Management Leadership to go-live, upgrade or major enhancement projects (where a CIT project management budget has been included as part of the as-sold project scope)
  • For all assigned projects, ensure Project Management planning and status review processes are completed with regularity each week or at a minimum every other week and PM deliverables are keep current
  • Provide PM leadership to keep projects on-budget and on-time
  • Ensure Project Team follows CIT Methodology and is producing deliverables to standards and on schedule
  • Participate in Weekly Resource Planning with other PMs and RDs to get resources assigned to project tasks in a manner which efficiently uses available professional services staff
  • Act as customer advocate
  • Review and understand the contractual terms and scope of assigned projects (via Sales Handover Meeting with Sales and RD)
  • Conduct both an Internal Project Kickoff meeting and a Client Project Kickoff meeting
  • Review Key Deliverables to assure scope and budget remain aligned
  • Hold Weekly status meetings and create progress / issues report
  • Maintain the Project Plan (Excel Workbook or MS Project)
  • Ensure Tasks, Time and Expense entry is being completed in CIT-TMS (Axapta) system. Review invoices prior to being sent to client.
  • Act as the day to day primary point of contact with Client Project Manager regarding project status and issue resolution

Credentials & Experience

  • 2 years project management experience in a Dynamics AX environment, including the management of budget, risks, resources, scope, issues, changes and quality
  • Thorough knowledge of all major project management activities, including risk assessments
  • Ability to align project deliverables and customer expectations
  • Coaching and/or mentoring experience
  • Presentation skills

Knowledge & Skill Requirements

  • Ability to understand, communicate, and interpret client business processes and requirements
  • Ability to thrive in a virtual, collaborative organization and atmosphere
  • Organizational skills with the ability to balance multiple demands
  • Proven ability to write effective system and process documentation - including business and system requirements, process diagrams, and detailed data requirements
  • Effective time management skills
  • Knowledge of ERP systems as they relate to effective and efficient business processes
  • Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of an organization

SDL2017

items.title: Project Manager, Lambda School Studios
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Project Manager, Lambda School Studios

PM
Anywhere in US
Company: Lambda School
Full Time

Overview

Lambda School is a combination of a school and an investment fund. Lambda School’s mission is to find untapped or underutilized talent, and to train that talent for the most in-demand jobs in the world. Lambda School is pioneering a new model of higher education in which the school invests in the students, instead of the other way around.

Lambda has just successfully completed its Series B fund raising round with premier tier venture investors. We are operating in 40+ states across the US today and eyeing international expansion opportunities.

Lambda School Studios sources contract opportunities for Lambda School alumni to help bridge the gap between their experience as a student and landing their first full-time job in the industry. Studios provides Product, Project, and Engineering Management to ensure that clients receive the highest quality products.

Lambda School Studios is scaling quickly. The role of Project Manager is fast paced and multi-faceted. The program’s goal is two-fold: deliver quality products to clients while giving graduates relevant industry experience. To be successful, you’ll need to be comfortable “wearing many hats” and managing complexity.

In addition to assisting leadership in managing tasks at the program level, you’ll be responsible for managing multiple client relationships, projects, and development teams. Both of these responsibilities include a broad array of tasks, like directing Section and Team Leads (student employees), documenting processes to ensure consistency across projects and teams, gathering and reporting data, and more. Due to the impact this position has on development teams and client products, candidates must have some experience with product management and software development.

You’ll work alongside Leadership and Program Managers at both the strategic and tactical level. Examples of potential strategic tasks:

-Work closely with leadership to pinpoint strategic goals and initiatives.

-Decide the right way to approach scaling while still maintaining an engaging program and delivering quality products.

-Determine key metrics to which the program should align.

-Create processes to better mentor and help developers improve.

-Examples of potential tactical tasks:

-Sync daily with Section and Team Leads.

-Interface regularly with clients to understand product goals, deliverables, and timelines.

-Work with a team to ensure on-time product delivery.

-Lead a workshop to help teams better understand how to contribute in an agile work environment.

Finally, this role requires that you be comfortable suggesting and implementing new ideas that improve the quality and integrity of the program. There are always new opportunities for improvement and ways to elevate our standards. Your work will directly impact the user (graduate) experience, satisfaction, quality of completed software products, and go a long way to improving graduates’ livelihoods (getting a career in the industry)!

What You’ll Do

·       Manage and oversee teams to create impressive and successful software products

·       Attend check-in meetings with teams to give feedback and guidance regularly

·       Monitor individual developer progress and success throughout the Studios experience

·       Develop new processes with leadership to improve developer and client experience

·       Document strategies and programs for leadership and fellow team members

·       Train and supervise student Section Leads and Team Leads

·       Instill relevant career readiness knowledge, skills, and attitudes into developers

·       Accountable for product completion and quality

What You’ll Need

·       Minimum 3+ years of experience in a project management role in a software development environment, ideally with remote teams or teams with a large percentage of entry-level engineers

·       Passionate about helping others succeed

·       Excellent written and verbal communication skills; comfortable and effective speaking in groups of teams

·       Ability to work with a diverse group of individuals

·       Self-starting with the ability to effectively work autonomously with little oversight

·       Intelligent, dedicated, flexible with a willingness to experiment

Big Plus, if you…

·       Have Product Management experience

·       Have worked in an engineering organization with 100+ engineers

·       Have engineering and/or product experience

·       Are familiar with Zoom, Slack, and Airtable

·       Have previous experience at a growth stage internet/software company

Lambda School is an equal opportunity employer, and acts in this capacity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability.

Apply for job

items.content:
Director of Product

Marketing
Anywhere
Company: Percona
Full Time

Overview

Percona is a leader in providing best-of-breed enterprise-class support, consulting, managed services, training and software for MySQL®, MariaDB®, MongoDB®, PostgreSQL® and other open source databases in on-premises and cloud environments. Our services and software accommodate rapid growth and application development, help companies develop and deploy agile solutions and improve your ability to keep up with customer needs.

Percona open source database expertise helps businesses avoid downtime and outages, meet customer experience expectations, foster operational and developer collaboration and manage enterprise risks through sound database architecture frameworks.

Discover what it means to work with some of the smartest people in the industry, and help solve some of the most challenging customer problems. We offer flexible hours, competitive salaries, the ability to work remote and the amazing experience of working with a multinational team of experts.

Description

Are you a product guru interested in open source, designing customer focused applications, growth hacking, and telling a great story? Percona may have the perfect role for you!

Percona is looking for someone to head up our product management and product marketing teams. This person will be critical in helping us assess the market, figure out what our strategy should be, and executing on it. Like all great visionaries, we have lots of ideas, some good and some not so good. The ideal person for this role will be critical in helping us not only understand what can work and what can’t but also assessing the market viability. As this person works with other internal groups and talks with customers they will gain insight and understanding as to where gaps and opportunities in the market exist. The best person for this role will be able to see an opportunity, research and collect data to verify what they have seen, refine that data with customer feedback, and build a cohesive strategy to capitalize on that opportunity. They will be able to take all of the above and tell a story that excites internal stakeholders and external user base.

What will you be doing?
  • Manage our product team consisting of product management and product marketing.
  • Reviewing our strategy, collecting data, and verifying we are on the right course.
  • Analyzing customer feedback, internal feedback, and external vendors to make recommendations on new product features and messaging.
  • Keep up with the market, assessing threats and opportunities.
  • Help figure out the right story, messaging, and value proposition for our products and work with internal stakeholders to get that story and messaging out to the masses.
  • Be responsible for driving adoption of our software and services.
  • Work with the engineering teams to ensure they understand high level strategy and understand the customer needs/requirements of our applications.
  • Work with the Marketing Operations and Creative & Content team to make sure we have articulated the value.
  • Manage the overall goto market and launch plans for our products.
  • Educate internal stakeholders on how customers want to buy, and what problems customers face and our how our products eliminate them.

    • Requirements
    • Previous success in a product leadership position building SaaS applications, Database or Infrastructure tools, open source software, and/or Cloud products.
    • 10+ years experience with progressive product leadership.
    • Ability to manage and lead the team, but also act as a player coach.
    • Track record of influencing, aligning, and working with executive leadership.
    • Ability to quickly assess data and opportunities and set priorities.
    • Enabling us to move quickly to take advantage of opportunities.
    • Excellent communication, storytelling, and presentation skills with the ability to evangelize and engage others with your product vision.
    • Proven track record of driving adoption and growth through the product design process.
    • Demonstrable commitment to be data driven analysis & decision making Intellectually curious, a life long learner.

      • Location:  Remote, work from home position from anywhere worldwide.

      Remote work from home openings require consistent and strong internet access.

      HQ is in Durham, NC USA.  Staff members should be available if there is a need for any onsite trainings and/or events at any time.

      Note that your legal agreement will be with Percona Staffing LLC, a USA corporation and a subsidiary of Percona LLC.

      Please review our .

      Percona GDPR Privacy Policy
      Apply for job

items.title: Director of Wireless Systems and Networks, remote - Job Or
items.content:
• This individual can be located anywhere from NYC to DC and work at home. Of key importance is the person have a strong technical background in wireless communications and also have experience bidding on and winning contracts with DARPA, CERDEC, AFRL or similar agencies.
Director of Wireless Systems and Networks, remote - Job Order 2954
US citizens only
Remote work, located anywhere from NYC to DC
Compensation DOE
They are more than a research lab; they are an innovation hub. They have an entreprenurial spirit molding technology of the future. They are involved in cybersecurity, data analytics, advanced networking, wireless and mobility, display technologies, optical and quantum, power grid and IoT security, and electronic warfare. The industries they work in include smart cities and smart phones, intelligent battlefields and autonomous systems, telecommunications, energy, finance, government, life sciences and defense. They have 225 scientists, engineers and analysts on staff, 260+ issued, licensed and pending patents. They have more than 125 PhD's on staff, 40+ collaborations with universities, research organizations and vendors. Additionally they have 100+ on-going customer-funded research and technology programs.
Job Description Develop a unified technical and business strategy for the Wireless Systems and Networks department,
Expand both the business and customer base of the department,
Ensure successful execution of projects and transition of technologies to downstream customers,
Line management, including recruiting, hiring and professional staff development, and
Collaborate with other managers within the company to ensure the overall success of the organization
.* Must be able to obtain a TS clearance or higher.
The location for this position is flexible to anywhere on the East Coast till Washington, DC .

Qualifications Requires BA/BS with 12 to15 years, with at least six plus years as a manager. Incumbent will have a specialized knowledge in one or more fields of disciplines and general knowledge in a number of others.
Preferred:
Ph.D. in Engineering or Applied Physics or M.S. in Engineering with required experience.
Experience in Wireless Systems research, in areas such as RF Signal Processing, digital communications, wireless networking, including network control and optimization
The location for this position is flexible to anywhere on the East Coast till Washington, DC .

items.title: Business Manager/PA to Directors
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Breadwinner is a dynamic global SaaS company that integrates Salesforce with financial software. We are leaders in this field and move at an exciting pace. Our growing team is dotted all across the globe and we are looking for a full-time tech-savvy Business Manager to join us.


In this role, you will be working with the management team in our central London office a few days a week and you will also be working remotely, therefore access to reliable high-speed internet is a must.


Your responsibilities include assisting with HR, customer success, marketing, and administrative tasks and you will occasionally help the sales team. You will also be responsible for the day to day running of the office and supporting the directors with their travel needs.


You will be working independently as well as with the team, therefore, we are looking for someone who is highly proactive, a self-starter, and a problem-solver. The role also requires someone who can wear different hats whilst keeping up with the pace of a tech company. As a software company, having the ability to learn technical skills is imperative.


As the Business Manager, your duties include assisting in the following departments:


Human Resources - assist directors with relevant new staff paperwork, keeping staff files updated, provide other HR support as and when required.


Administrative - organising staff travel & accommodation for events, managing office bills and payments, ordering office supplies, supporting the directors with day to day admin tasks.


Customer Success/Events - booking lunch for partner demos, ordering and organising promotional material and supporting the directors with marketing events, assist with managing a database of partners including updating details and sourcing potential new partners to work with the company.


Sales - contact customers regarding renewals and expired credit cards.


To be considered for the role, you’ll need the following key skills and qualifications:




  • Excellent computer skills, knowledge of standard software packages, and the ability to learn company-specific software if required.




  • 1-2 years minimum in a professional office environment in a similar administrative function.




  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.




  • Exceptional organisational skills and the ability to multitask




  • The ability to be proactive and take the initiative




  • The ability to work independently and under pressure




  • Be a team player




  • Flexibility and adaptability




  • Discretion and trustworthiness




Role: Business Manager/ PA to Directors


Company: Breadwinner, Global Leading Tech Company


Location: London, UK


Salary: £28k-£35k, dependent on experience


Working hours: Full-time. Contractor. Flexible to meet management needs. We work across multiple time zones.

items.title: People Development Manager
items.content:
People Development Manager at Giant Swarm

Remote | International
  • Cologne, DE – Remote OK
  • Full-Time

Your Job:

  • You are part of our People Ops Team, (currently 3 people) working on enabling our growth through feedback processes, onboarding, our transparent salaries, team structures, and other tasks beyond hiring new colleagues.
  • You will be our direct contact person for all employees regarding their individual development. As we believe that no two people are the same and that there is no “one fits all” solution, “individual” is the keyword here.
  • You’ll work closely with the MoCs (Master of Ceremonies) of our teams and help them on their road to continuous improvement. You are the people person for those teams when it comes to moderation of retros as well as a sparring partner for people issues. We encourage self-organization a lot, but if there is a need for your support, you are there.
  • You foster our self-organization throughout the company, enabling individuals and teams to make their own decisions with confidence, allowing the company to remain a group of individuals walking in the same direction. Nobody is left behind. You ensure this structure is under constant review and communicated in a way that makes it understandable for all involved.
  • You will work with diverse parties of the organization on topics such as team development, self-organisation, individual growth, responsibilities and accountability. We strongly believe in agility and want to continue being at the forefront of the new work era. All your initiatives need to fit in our remote and agile context.
  • To learn more about how we work, you can check out the Inside Giant Swarm Blog Posts: https://blog.giantswarm.io/inside/

Requirements:

  • You have at least 5+ years experience in working in People Operations (or in an agile consulting company) and you’ll survive the fact that we really like iterating. We will never have a final plan, knowing that things that work today won’t work tomorrow. Uncertainty is your motivator.
  • You can give proposals, and defend them when challenged, in a very self-organized environment where obviously everyone has an opinion about people topics as it affects us all.
  • You have been working in a startup environment and having worked remotely already is a plus as this will help you understand the challenges that come with working in this way, as few companies are currently organised this way
  • You’re happy to hop between individual (people) and organisation levels. In the beginning, it will be more organizational work.
  • You have a strong interest and at best you already have experience in agile methodologies. It would be great if you have already worked with software teams. Our purpose is to create similar structures in the entire company, so if you have experience there – great!
  • Being a certified coach and or scrum master is a big plus
  • You are happy with English as our company language

Why we think this job is worth applying (challenge us!):

  • Impact, Impact, Impact! We are a remote-first organization with a growing team (from 15+ European countries) Every new team member changes the team. This is great! People who know things we don’t are highly welcome.
  • “It’s better to ask forgiveness than permission” (Paolini) – sure, it’s not 100% like this, but we have a strong culture of failure which, is part of our agile mindset. We don’t do things by the guidebook. You can try things out! Our default to 100% transparency will help you here.
  • Appreciation and trust are the columns for our People Operations work. We try not to use “new work” as a buzzword, we try to live it. Larissa, Mirco and Anna (your future colleagues can talk for hours about that ;))

WHY Giant Swarm?

We can give you a glimpse on how working with us will be like:

Self-organization

Creative work needs freedom and openness. We encourage you to do your work wherever and whenever you want. We expect passion and encourage sustainability. If you need rest, take it. We don’t count holidays – we count outcome.

Teamwork

We are a growing company with 50+ team members distributed all over Europe and plans on expanding to the US. Our ambitious goals are only achievable as a team. Everybody’s input is highly welcome and appreciated. Although sometimes rules and processes are necessary, we try to keep them as lean as possible. Always question the status quo and find new ways of collaboration and team-work.

Learning

Learning is mandatory and fun at the same time. If you realize you want to expand your knowledge in a specific area, we support you with conferences, books etc.

Basics

We offer fair (transparent and open) salaries with benefits like choosing your own laptop, additional perks (for example, a location-aware, fixed amount paid each month to cover costs like co-working, phone contracts or gym memberships), paid parental leave and healthcare compensation are compulsory. And you will participate in our stock options program. Currently, our team members have more children than we are employees. So family-friendliness is a must.

We are not hiring job descriptions. We hire humans.

We welcome applications from everybody, regardless of ethnic or national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation or age.

Apply for job

items.title: Operations Manager
items.content:
Join a fast growing company that is setting out to make anyone feel at home, anywhere in the world.


LifeX is a rapidly-growing co-living startup, providing a network of shared homes and access to an active international community of professionals.


We are expanding at a lightning pace, and with that so is our team! What does that mean for you? We are currently looking for an Operations Manager in London to manage the setup and maintenance of our properties.


More about us


We take away the stress and uncertainty of moving somewhere new, and build communities that connect people from every corner of the world.


To do this we offer:



  • Fully serviced co-living apartments, furnished with contemporary Scandinavian design

  • Social events and connections across an inclusive community of expats from every corner of the world


In 2 short years, we have grown to over 50 apartments in the centre of Copenhagen, Berlin, Munich, Paris, London and Vienna with more than 200 active members. With early investment from Founders, Cherry.vc and stellar angel investors, we are planning to scale rapidly to take over Europe and beyond.


This is a unique position to get insight into what it takes to scale a fast growing international start-up and work with people who are passionate about making a difference, challenge the status quo, have the drive to learn new skills and desire to be a leader.


In the role as Operations Manager in London you are responsible for ensuring that daily operations in the apartments in London run smoothly and that new apartments are rebuilt and furnished.



REQUIREMENTS


What you’ll do:



  • End-to-end operations responsibilities as we scale LifeX in London

  • Maintain the relationship with cleaning staff in regards to re-stocks, tasks and performance tracking

  • Manage ongoing operations issues, tracking and follow-up with members

  • Create and maintain restocking systems for order management in apartments

  • Organising the renovation and furnishing of new apartments with support from our global set-up team

  • Enforcing high quality standards to increase member happiness

  • Ability to travel between apartments and work at different locations

  • Build sustainable relationships with landlords, partners and the members


You:



  • Are a hustler who wants to own daily operations processes

  • Have good hands-on skills

  • Have previous hospitality, building or facility management experience or education

  • Have a ‘can do’ attitude combined with a practical approach to tasks at hand

  • Are driven to learn new skills and optimize processes

  • Can direct people to make sure deadlines are met

  • Love to create order from chaos

  • Are able to multitask and manage multiple communication channels

  • Have an obsessive attention to detail

  • Have a high stress threshold

  • Take pride in making others feel welcomed, safe and secure

  • Can work independently

  • Have a valid driver's license

  • Are fluent in English; both written and verbal




BENEFITS



  • Join an ambitious startup, solving real life issues

  • International and diverse team with a flat hierarchy

  • Team Camps in different european cities

  • Flexible working around your schedule incl. Home Office

  • Personal and professional growth as you progress in the role

  • We believe an enjoyable work atmosphere is crucial to getting the best work done.


Does this sound like you? Then don’t hesitate to reach out and apply!

items.title: Campaign Manager (New Marketplace Program)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
About us:


Crozdesk.com runs software marketplaces and comparison sites helping businesses globally decide on which software solutions to use. From CRM to Accounting and Marketing Automation to Supply Chain Management - we cover 250+ categories of business software and compare almost everything for our users! Our vendor solutions portal helps thousands of software companies connect with their ideal customers.


We have a dynamic team that's distributed globally with our head office (4 - 5 people) based in Shoreditch, London - which is where you will be located.


If you like a collaborative and productive environment in which responsibilities are shared and where you'll come in contact with all aspects of the business, you'll fit right in.


 


The role:


We are looking for an entrepreneurial self-starter, with a hands-on attitude and a knack for details. You will work on a new program that we are currently piloting that helps software buyers find the information they need through dynamically generated recommendation reports and seamless vendor introductions. You will work with partners, software vendors, users and technical colleagues to refine, test, tweak and scale this digital matchmaking machine. You will run campaigns to promote the program, build new partnerships and develop your own ideas to scale the new program through our marketplaces and wider partner network.


The role sits at the intersection between marketing, sales, product management, customer success and program strategy. Since you will be the point person on this, the program’s success is your success. You will get the chance to earn a bonus and get stock options in line with the program performance. If you are a versatile individual who’s up for a challenge, this role is right for you.


 


Requirements:



  • 1.5+ years of marketing, operations or sales experience in B2B tech and/or startups

  • A Bachelor's degree or above with a demonstrable interest in business, technology, statistics or analytics

  • A keen understanding of the SaaS / software market and marketplaces in general

  • Experience working with CRMs, planning and implementing sales and marketing strategies and dealing with B2B clients

  • Experience working with large datasets (Excel, Google Sheets, etc)

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • The ability to foster and grow client relationships

  • An entrepreneurial mindset and good technical acumen


 


We offer competitive salaries, a direct and uncapped bonus structure based on the program performance, attractive stock options and pension benefits - all of which will scale with the impact you have on our business. Your base salary will depend on your level of experience and overall skillset.


 


Base: £25K – £35K    Bonus: based on program performance


Stock Options: based experience and probation performance


 


Join us at Crozdesk and become part of our fast-paced, close-knit team in a flexible role with plenty of responsibilities and room for growth!

items.content:
Product Manager – Voting Information Project at Democracy Works

Remote | High-paying

Location: Brooklyn, NY or remote within the US

Salary Range: Salary range is $68,000-100,000 per year. (Offers will vary based on experience and location-based cost-of-living calculations. Brooklyn-specific salary range is $80K–$100K.)

Benefits: Vision, dental, & medical insurance; 403(b) retirement savings plan; generous vacation policy; parental leave; long-term disability; employee assistance program

Level: Mid-level to Senior

Organizational overview

At Democracy Works, we believe voting should fit the way we live. To that end, we build technology for both voters and election administrators that simplifies the process and ensures that no voter should ever have to miss an election.

TurboVote, our first service, helps voters register, stay registered, and cast a ballot in every election, from municipal to national. TurboVote signed up its six millionth voter in 2018 by building the largest college, nonprofit, and corporate voter engagement coalition in the country, including more than 300 campuses, companies like Starbucks, Univision, Facebook, Google, Snap, and dozens more. We also helped (basically) everyone find their polling place through the Voting Information Project. Its data had 123 million impressions in 2016, and over 11 million voters looked up where to vote on GetToThePolls.com. Ballot Scout helps election administrators track absentee ballots through the mail, providing transparency in the vote-by-mail process and making it easier to follow up when things go awry. And in 2018, we became the organizational home of the National Association of State Election Directors (NASED).

As a Product Manager on the Election Administration team, you’ll be working from end-to-end to manage the development of The Voting Information Project – from roadmapping high-level product strategy down into the details of planning sprints and coordinating partner support. While you will be the first dedicated Product Manager for VIP, you’ll be supported by a team of software developers, including a team of data engineers; VIP’s program and partnerships manager; and a Senior Product owner and Engineering Manager supporting the entire Election Administration team.

You will:

  • Lead the ideation, development, testing/QA, and launch of new features to make these tools best-in-class software for election administration
  • Synthesize user interviews, partner feedback, and staff insights into clear roadmaps for future growth, and into the user stories to see them built
  • Pair with a lead developer to define implementation for new features, ensure clear conditions of acceptance (including unsexy stuff like internationalization, accessibility, scaling, security, and browser compatibility), and take part in regular sprint-planning meetings with the developer team to prioritize their work
  • Manage a roadmap and vision for VIP’s family tools, owning prioritization and strategy in service of the Voting Information Project’s goals.

You are:

  • Empathetic and comfortable acting as users’ biggest advocate
  • Attentive to detail and fluent at managing the minutiae
  • Able to see the big picture and maintain strategic focus
  • Constantly communicating the information your team needs to do their best work
  • Able to clearly communicate your vision to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • A fantastic listener
  • A creative decision-maker who isn’t afraid to make hard calls regarding ideation and feature set
  • At ease working solo and as part of a team
  • Able to be productive working remotely with a team scattered across the city and/or country.

You have experience:

  • Creating and managing a roadmap for a product or large feature
  • Drafting robust product and feature requirements, whether solo or in collaboration with a technical team
  • Communicating across different areas of expertise and coordinating teams with diverse viewpoints
  • Conducting user interviews/direct product research and distilling insights
  • Working with UX and Design (and recognizing when their expertise is needed)
  • Representing a product or project to clients or other external stakeholders
  • Developing strategic plans

Physical demands

This position requires regular, daily use of a computer to conduct work and communicate with colleagues.

Social expectations

Democracy Works’s regular operating hours are 10 a.m. – 6 p.m. Eastern time, and all employees are expected to be available and working during regular operating hours, whether or not they are physically located in New York and/or working out of the Brooklyn office.

Travel expectations

Two times per year, all full-time staff members participate in a five day retreat in our Brooklyn offices. All staff is held each year in May and November. There may be occasional travel to liaise with our partners or attend conferences to represent Democracy Works and/or for personal development.

Application Instructions

To apply, please send a resume and respond to the following questions (in lieu of a cover letter) using the form below.

In your cover letter, please include only the following information:

  • How did you find this job listing?
  • In one sentence, what makes you interested in Democracy Works?
  • In one sentence, what makes you interested in this role?
  • Would you be available to start by 11/25/19?
  • Are you willing to work at a non-partisan organization?
  • In one sentence, what is one product or significant feature that you have managed/owned as a part of a team (either officially or unofficially)?
  • Are you familiar with the software development lifecycle?

As part of our application, you’ll see an optional form used to collect EEOC demographic information. The data collected in this form is useful in our EEOC reporting and in our assessment of our recruitment practices. However, please keep in mind that the standardized EEOC language used in this form does not reflect the values of Democracy Works–for example, we don’t view gender as binary. We also encourage all applicants to state their pronouns when applying for any job opening at Democracy Works.

Democracy Works is committed to diversity and inclusion in everything we do and aspires to have a team that’s representative of the voters we serve. When hiring, we practice proactive outreach to top talent that’s underrepresented in our sector. We conduct an anonymized skills evaluation, to reduce implicit bias and resume-dependency in our process. We’re a woman- and gay-founded nonprofit, and promote an inclusive culture that stands against racism, sexism, homophobia, and ableism (to name a few). To be explicit, we strongly encourage applicants of all races, ethnicities, political party associations, religions (or lack thereof), national origins, sexual orientations, genders, sexes, ages, abilities, and branches of military service.

Feel free to contact work@democracy.works if you have any questions about our commitment to inclusion or about general hiring practices, or if you need an accommodation for a medical condition during the hiring process. Democracy Works posts all current career opportunities at democracy.works/careers.

Apply for job

items.title: Junior Project Manager
items.content:
Junior Project Manager at Alegeus

Remote

Job Locations: US-FL-Maitland | US-MA-Waltham | US-WI-Wauwatosa | US-Remote

ID: 2019-1110

Category: Client Services, Support & Experience

Type: Regular Full-Time

Overview

SUMMARY:
Alegeus is the market leader in consumer directed healthcare solutions, offering the industry’s most comprehensive platform for the administration of healthcare benefit accounts, the industry’s most widely-used benefit debit card, and powerful engagement solutions to help consumers maximize savings and optimize spending for their healthcare. Over 300 clients – including health insurance plans, third party administrators and financial institutions – leverage Alegeus’ deep expertise and proven technology to administer benefit accounts for more than 29 million members and process more than $8.9 billion in consumer healthcare payments annually. As the healthcare and benefit markets continue to evolve, Alegeus delivers solutions that enable clients to evolve their service offerings, operate their businesses more efficiently, and focus on their customers.

Alegeus is part of the Vista Equity Partners portfolio of companies, working in partnership with the market-leading technology investment firm to reinvent the consumer directed healthcare marketplace. Our talented associates benefit from this partnership through increased capital for strategic investments, access to exceptional toolkits, best practices and resources for success, and strong cultural and value alignment focused on talent development and growth.

Alegeus seeks a Project Manager to join our dedicated, passionate team of professionals. The Project Manager reports to the Director of Professional Services and is responsible for helping our company succeed by leading implementation project teams to ensure flawless execution.

MISSION:

Your mission is to ensure that every new client has an exceptionally positive onboarding experience and becomes a referenceable client. Your consultative approach ensures best practices are persuasively presented throughout the implementation process, positioning Alegeus as a valued trusted advisor. As a team leader, you encourage and support the efforts of the implementation team assigned to each project. As a project management professional, you seek continuous process improvement opportunities throughout each project to ensure continuous improvement and efficiency.

Responsibilities

The desired candidate is expected to have an understanding of the Alegeus operating model and system infrastructure or the industry knowledge and experience to quickly grasp and internalize it. Excellent organizational, verbal and written communication skills are a must. The ability and willingness to work as needed to ensure every project is successful is key. During certain times of the year this can include extended hours and weekend work for extended periods of time.

ROLE BASED COMPETENCIES:

The desired candidate will have direct experience managing client-facing projects that follow project management best practices as prescribed by the Project Management Institute (PMI). They demonstrate exceptional organizational, communication and presentation skills and have a working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite of products, including Project, Visio, PowerPoint, Word and Excel.

The candidate will have a demonstrated track record of successfully working in matrixed organizations, providing services to a variety of internal and external clients, and successfully leading teams. They are persistent, detail oriented, and work efficiently to meet all deadlines and deliverables. They bring an optimistic and positive approach to problem solving and join their colleagues in creating successful solutions for complex problems.

CULTURE-BASED COMPETENCIES:

At Alegeus, equally important to the “What” (the individual performance goals that each employee commits to in support of the company’s overall success) is the “How” (the framework of principles that guide how we work together to drive our business forward). Overall performance success includes individual delivery on our corporate values:

Accountability Empowerment Protect the Family Challenging

Collaborative Fun & Passionate Results Over Activity Integrity

Innovation Value One Another Customer Focused

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Facilitate the definition of project scope, deliverables, workstreams, milestones and project timeline
  • Create detailed project plans utilizing appropriate resource levels and secure stakeholder approval
  • Communicate project status and details clearly and effectively with all stakeholders
  • Execute and manage the project plan to successful completion
  • Champion all project changes through the Change Order process to successful completion
  • Provide direction and support for the project team
  • Set up project site within SharePoint and ensure all project artifacts are documented and filed
  • Escalate issues quickly and accurately to the appropriate stakeholders
  • Ensure that project scope is met and that client expectations are exceeded
  • Ensure all deliverables are on time, within budget, and of the highest quality
  • Lead and document “Lessons Learned” session within 30 days of go-live
  • Engage Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) as necessary to ensure best possible solutions
  • Update Professional Services scorecard weekly and represent project during status meetings

Qualifications

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

  • BA/BS required
  • Relevant work experience in healthcare technology, benefits administration, financial services, financial operations, software operations or related fields
  • Demonstrated experience successfully leading mid-sized and large-sized projects using PMI principles
  • Working knowledge and understanding of the US healthcare system, health plan operations, Consumer Driven Health Plan (CDHP) purpose and functions, and CDHP funding
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification is not required but is expected within 12 months of hire date or before promotion between job levels is considered. It is a prerequisite for, but not a guarantee of, promotion.

PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS, SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:

  • A positive attitude and positive self-expectancy in all situations with a high stress tolerance
  • A strong believer in the power of teams as a leader and team member
  • A passion for Consumer Driven Healthcare, behavioral economics, the value we create for the end user and ultimately the positive impact we make on their lives on a daily basis
  • Life-long learner with strong interest in learning new things and comfort in pushing new boundaries
  • A critical thinker with a passion for organizing and problem solving
  • A hands-on, detail-orientated leader who understands and embraces technology
  • Strong decision-making, conflict resolution and negotiation skills
  • Must be adaptable and embrace change
Apply for job

items.title: Finance Manager, IT
items.content:
Finance Manager, IT at American Red Cross

Remote

Location: Denver, CO, United States

Job Description
This is a remote position can be anywhere in the US, ideally in the Denver/Boulder CO area.

Position Summary
This position will supervise critical financial projects and processes supporting IT. This position will primarily be focused on analysis and reporting, will directly supervise staff, and perform ad-hoc tasks as needed.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage daily, monthly, and annual reporting for IT Run & Maintain and Projects.
  • Manage month-end closing processes including discrepancy analysis, and preparation and approval of accounting journal entries.
  • Produce and present detailed monthly and as requested analysis of IT Run & Maintain and Project expenditures.
  • Provide data, tools, and financial expertise to assist IT leadership in forecasting responsibilities and historical analysis.
  • Coordinate the annual budget cycle, including goal setting, allocation among responsible units, and documentation of assumptions.
  • Educate program staff on financial concepts and policy through formal presentations and trainings.
  • Produce and verify the accuracy of reporting to be shared with external stakeholders.
  • Leads and assists with special projects, as assigned.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or business administration.
  • A minimum of five years experience in accounting or finance, preferably in a not-for-profit environment
  • A minimum of three years in a supervisory (people manager) role.
  • Advanced experience with software packages including Hyperion, CFS Business Objects (Webi), MS Excel and MS Powerpoint

Desired Qualifications:

  • Excellent interpersonal skills are needed to coordinate activity with Red Cross staff nationwide.
  • Must display good judgment, decisiveness and the ability to take independent action while leading a team effort.
  • Must have the ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing with all levels of staff and management.

*LI-EH1

Apply now! Joining our team will provide you with the opportunity to make a difference every day.

The American Red Cross is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

The American Red Cross is a diverse nonprofit organization offering its employee’s professional development and growth opportunities, a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a collaborative team spirit environment. To be considered for this position, please visit www.redcross.org/jobs to apply.

Apply for job
