items.content:
People Development Manager (100% remote)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Giant Swarm GmbH | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin +/- 2 hours

Technologies

agile
kubernetes
go

Job description

Your Job

  • You are part of our People Ops Team, (currently 3 people) working on enabling our growth through feedback processes, onboarding, our transparent salaries, team structures, and other tasks beyond hiring new colleagues.
  • You will be our direct contact person for all employees regarding their individual development. As we believe that no two people are the same and that there is no “one fits all” solution, “individual” is the keyword here.
  • You’ll work closely with the MoCs (Master of Ceremonies) of our teams and help them on their road to continuous improvement. You are the people person for those teams when it comes to moderation of retros as well as a sparring partner for people issues. We encourage self-organization a lot, but if there is a need for your support, you are there.
  • You foster our self-organization throughout the company, enabling individuals and teams to make their own decisions with confidence, allowing the company to remain a group of individuals walking in the same direction. Nobody is left behind. You ensure this structure is under constant review and communicated in a way that makes it understandable for all involved.
  • You will work with diverse parties of the organization on topics such as team development, self-organisation, individual growth, responsibilities and accountability. We strongly believe in agility and want to continue being at the forefront of the new work era. All your initiatives need to fit in our remote and agile context.
  • To learn more about how we work, you can check out the Inside Giant Swarm Blog Posts: https://blog.giantswarm.io/inside/

Requirements

  • You have at least 5+ years experience in working in People Operations (or in an agile consulting company) and you’ll survive the fact that we really like iterating. We will never have a final plan, knowing that things that work today won't work tomorrow. Uncertainty is your motivator.
  • You can give proposals, and defend them when challenged, in a very self-organized environment where obviously everyone has an opinion about people topics as it affects us all.
  • You have been working in a startup environment and having worked remotely already is a plus as this will help you understand the challenges that come with working in this way, as few companies are currently organised this way
  • You’re happy to hop between individual (people) and organisation levels. In the beginning, it will be more organizational work.
  • You have a strong interest and at best you already have experience in agile methodologies. It would be great if you have already worked with software teams. Our purpose is to create similar structures in the entire company, so if you have experience there - great!
  • Being a certified coach and or scrum master is a big plus
  • You are happy with English as our company language

 Why we think this job is worth applying (challenge us!)

  • Impact, Impact, Impact! We are a remote-first organization with a growing team (from 15+ European countries) Every new team member changes the team. This is great! People who know things we don’t are highly welcome.
  • “It's better to ask forgiveness than permission” (Paolini) - sure, it’s not 100% like this, but we have a strong culture of failure which, is part of our agile mindset. We don’t do things by the guidebook. You can try things out! Our default to 100% transparency will help you here.
  • Appreciation and trust are the columns for our People Operations work. We try not to use “new work” as a buzzword, we try to live it. Larissa, Mirco and Anna (your future colleagues can talk for hours about that ;))

WHY Giant Swarm?

We can give you a glimpse on how working with us will be like:

Self-organization

Creative work needs freedom and openness. We encourage you to do your work wherever and whenever you want. We expect passion and encourage sustainability. If you need rest, take it. We don't count holidays - we count outcome.

Teamwork

We are a growing company with 50+ team members distributed all over Europe and plans on expanding to the US. Our ambitious goals are only achievable as a team. Everybody’s input is highly welcome and appreciated. Although sometimes rules and processes are necessary, we try to keep them as lean as possible. Always question the status quo and find new ways of collaboration and team-work.

Learning

Learning is mandatory and fun at the same time. If you realize you want to expand your knowledge in a specific area, we support you with conferences, books etc.

Basics

We offer fair (transparent and open) salaries with benefits like choosing your own laptop, additional perks (for example, a location-aware, fixed amount paid each month to cover costs like co-working, phone contracts or gym memberships), paid parental leave and healthcare compensation are compulsory. And you will participate in our stock options program. Currently, our team members have more children than we are employees. So family-friendliness is a must.

We are not hiring job descriptions. We hire humans. :)

We welcome applications from everybody, regardless of ethnic or national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation or age.

Interested? Questions? Coffee? Contact Larissa or apply directly

Apply now

About Giant Swarm GmbH

Giant Swarm is a fast growing open source infrastructure management platform used by modern enterprises. Our vision is to empower developers around the world to ship great products.

We're a distributed, diverse, and growing team, spread across Europe. The company is based in Cologne, Germany, where we have a small office in a coworking space. However, only a few people work there. All workflows are created to function remotely - but of course, if you want to visit Cologne, you are more than welcome!

While we are remote first, we appreciate quality time with our co-workers, so we meet in person twice a year to work and have fun together.

Work-life integration

  • Flexible working hours, and working from home or anywhere you prefer but please note that your permanent location should be somewhere in Europe.
  • Currently, the number of kids from our team members outnumbers the number of employees.
  • We don’t only care about the kids “within” the company, but also about all children - for example, we compensate the carbon of all our flights.
  • As an international company, we want to create similar standards for everyone, regardless of location. So, additional perks (for example, a location-aware, fixed amount paid each month to cover costs like co-working, phone contracts or gym memberships), paid parental leave and healthcare compensation are compulsory.

Benefits

  • unlimited holidays
  • fair and transparent open salaries
  • familiy friendlyness is a must
  • choose the time you want to work
  • choose the devices you want to work with
  • remote work possible

items.title: Vendor Manager
items.content:
Vendor Manager at Smartcat

Remote | Entry-level | International

Location: Boston, USA / Moscow, Russia / Remote

Our team is passionate about building a product that improves the global language industry. Smartcat’s goal is to develop the world’s best environment for translation and industry-specific payment automation and make it a vibrant network enabling easy collaboration for all market participants, including freelance linguists, translation agencies, and translation buyers.

Smartcat is backed by Matrix Partners, a top VC firm focusing on SaaS and marketplace startups (you might recognize names like HubSpot, Oculus, Zendesk, and Quora in their portfolio).

Mission

The mission of Head of VM is to build a strong foundation for fast revenue growth in the Smartcat Vendor Management department by offering solid and high-quality search results to our clients worldwide. This includes providing an out-of-the-box approach to tackling Smartcat clients’ demand for Vendors — both Freelancers and LSPs — and enabling a sustainable growth of the Smartcat freelancer database in a variety of language pairs. You will work closely with Smartcat Sales and Customer Success who will be requesting you to source vendors for various projects and programs.

Your outcomes

  • Have full ownership of Smartcat’s 200,000+ freelancer and LSP database.
  • Lead Smartcat’s vendor management department to fulfill dozens of requests per day from both clients that hire us as an outsourced Vendor Management department and those sending one-time requests.
  • Proactively improve and strengthen the freelancer database for both filling the gaps in it and improving its quality.
  • Meet quarterly plans on the revenue generated by Vendor Management services.
  • Collaborate with other teams in Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Product, etc. to improve the Vendor Management offering.

Requirements

  • Active management of supplier database
  • At least 1 year of experience working as a Customer Success Manager with outstanding measurable achievements.
  • Find and test new specialized vendors based on production needs
  • Accurately forecast revenue and Jobs Filled
  • Anticipate and plan resource demand
  • Develop, track, and validate vendor KPIs
  • Evaluate and track vendor performance
  • Provide feedback to vendors and arbitrate
  • At least two years of experience working as a head of VM or in a similar role in an LSP, with outstanding measurable achievements.
  • Excellent communication skills to interact with clients, colleagues, partners, and freelancers. We are in a niche global industry ($45b) where trust and good relations matter.
  • Easy-going personality, high tolerance to different cultures. We love our users, who are literally everywhere on the planet, and they love Smartcat back.
  • Ability to understand Smartcat’s vision and functionality of the whole platform in depth. We are building a market network for the global translation industry, which is a complex multi-sided marketplace on top of an industry-specific workflow automation solution. (To learn more about the market network concept, read this article.)
  • Data-driven approach to business. Readiness to measure success based on numbers.
  • Integrity and full commitment.
  • Readiness to work in a highly intense startup environment, requiring extreme focus, a sense of urgency and persistence to break through.
  • Openness to constructive criticism and others’ opinions and ideas.
  • Being eager for success and aggressive for growth.
Apply for job

items.title: Director of Sales
items.content:
Director of Sales at Chili Piper

Remote | International

Location: Brooklyn New York United States

Employment Type: Full-time

Company Description:

Chili Piper helps businesses help their buyers.

People interested in your business typically have to wait hours or days after filling out a form. Not anymore. Our intelligent assistant offers them a simple way to book a meeting or start a phone call immediately upon form submission.

Unlike the traditional method of inbound lead management, Chili Piper uses smart rules to qualify and distribute leads to the right reps in real time. Our software also allows companies to automate opportunity distribution from their SDRs to their AEs, and book meetings from their marketing campaigns and live events.

Companies like Square, Twilio, DiscoverOrg, SalesLoft, and SiriusDecisions use Chili Piper to create an amazing experience for their leads, and in return experience higher conversions for their business.

Chili Piper is focused on helping Businesses help their Buyers – building a new category we call Buyer Enablement

Job Description:

What You’ll Do

  • Forecast sales activity and revenue achievement, while creating satisfied and referenceable customer
  • Comfortable in a fast-paced startup environment
  • Owning and hitting/exceeding annual sales targets
  • Developing and executing strategic plan to achieve sales targets and expand our customer base
  • Bring your thinking, strategy and ideas to the team to advance our unique culture and vision for the future
  • Drive revenue through new customer acquisition, meeting or exceeding all sales targets and performance metrics
  • Lead, inspire, manage, and mentor sales executives to maximize their individual potential and professional growth as well as ability to function effectively as a team
  • Develop a culture of accountability and urgency by transparently leveraging metrics and reporting to drive the right behaviors
  • Develop a deep understanding of our product messaging, technology platform, partner ecosystem, and competitive landscape
  • Cultivate a culture of teamwork, openness, creativity, and continuous improvement
  • Support and assist AEs with all aspects of the sales process
  • Identify topics and partner with sales enablement to plan product and competitive training sessions
  • Listen carefully to prospects and clients to provide market feedback to the Product team and help prioritize functionality needed to drive sales opportunities
  • Provide new customers a seamless onboarding experience by working closely with the customer success team
  • Optimize the sales recruitment and hiring plans and serve to further the capabilities, diversity and impact of the sales teams

Qualifications:

  • Proven sales executive experience, meeting or exceeding targets
  • Previous experience as a sales executive, sales manager or sales director
  • Proven ability to position products against competitors
  • Demonstrable experience as head of sales, developing client-focused, differentiated and achievable solutions
  • Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills
  • BA/BS degree or equivalent
  • Minimum of 6+ years of mid market/enterprise outbound B2B SaaS sales experience with at least 3+ years of management
  • Demonstrable track record of above target performance, especially in a startup environment
  • Smart, organized, self-motivated, flexible and team player
  • Clear and direct communicator
  • Experience selling to CMOs or S/VPs of Marketing
  • Experience bringing new products to market
  • Experience with working in a growing company vs. an established, known Enterprise brand

Additional Information:

  • Freedom and flexibility.Were a 100% distributed team working from around the world.Our team members can work from wherever they want in the world, as long as they show up on our weekly all hands meeting on Zoom.
  • Solve interesting problems.The software landscape has exploded. There are dozens of solutions for each problem. We want to be different. We come up with new angles on existing problems or invent better solutions to help companies with their sales and marketing. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software.
  • Autonomy and ownership.Working on a distributed team means you dont have someone micromanaging you or looking over your shoulder to make sure youre getting things done. Were a team of do-ers who take full ownership for their results.
  • Be helpful.Our first value as a company is help. Help our customers be successful. Help our prospects get the right information and make the right decision whether or not it includes our products. Help our team members reach their full potential.

The Perks

  • Unlimited Vacation
  • Generous Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • WeWork membership so you can work from anywhere
  • Any equipment/software/tech that you need to do your job
Apply for job

items.title: Healthy Hemp Oil: Director of Operations for Health & Wellness Brand
items.content:
Director of Operations for Health & Wellness Brand

The Opportunity:

Here at Healthy Hemp Oil, we believe in the healing power of CBD to transform our health, and the health of those we love for the better. We are a thriving e-commerce business in a rapidly growing industry, providing the highest quality hemp-based CBD products and education to the masses via our digital platform, healthyhempoil.com. 
 
Our passion for this plant informs our mission to support our customers by empowering them with the information they need in order to make the best decision about using CBD. The Hemp industry is set to grow by 700% in the next 3 years to a $2.1 billion market. With our years of experience and strategic investments in supply chain and marketing, we are well-positioned to capitalize on this huge opportunity.
 
Healthy Hemp Oil is a company comprised of self-motivated and highly talented people. Our team is small but mighty, and we’re ready to welcome a kick-ass individual into this crucial new leadership role during an exciting time of growth!
 
We are seeking a Director of Operations to support our CEO in day-to-day business operations and personnel management. The right person for this role is an experienced leader with prior work managing teams and directing company goals, who is unafraid to take responsibility for the success of the business as a whole. 

What you’ll be doing:

Business Strategy
  • Working with the CEO to set operational goals -- tracking performance and adjusting as needed to improve business success
  • Setting both short and long-term business objectives, and identifying the path to achieving them
Project Execution
  • Leading key projects, including marketing initiatives, to grow the business and achieve outlined objectives
  • Managing project budgets, and reporting on key operational processes, financial metrics, and performance indicators to stakeholders
Systems & Processes
  • Overseeing the creation, implementation, documentation, and improvement of systems and processes across the organization
Team & Culture
  • Managing a motivated and capable team of individuals in support of their personal and professional growth
  • Exemplifying and nourishing our fun, collaborative, and compassionate company culture 
General Management
  • Cultivating new partnerships and sustaining existing relationships in support of business objectives 
  • Serving as general manager of the business as a whole

Who you are:
  • You’re an experienced leader and people manager with a background in early-to-mid-stage startup companies, and you’ve worked on a remote-first team. 
  • You know how to establish systems and processes to enhance business performance and growth, and you’ve managed a P&L.
  • You’re self-motivated and comfortable operating under ambiguity. 
  • You enjoy leading a team, supporting people, and seeing them succeed.
  • You’re a problem solver and a lifelong learner. You relish new projects and desire growth in your capabilities and responsibilities. 

What’s in it for you:
  • A supportive, collaborative, and flexible remote-first culture that prioritizes trust and personal responsibility
  • The chance to be a part of a team of kind and passionate people from all around the world who are united in spreading the good word about CBD
  • The opportunity to grow with a company at the forefront of a rapidly growing industry that’s transforming people’s lives

Job Details:
  • This is a full-time role, but it may take a month or so to ramp up. The workweek might initially total 20-25 hours per week and will grow from there as projects increase.
  • This is a 1099 contract position, and we are looking to hire for the long term. Many of our contract positions are 3-5+ years. 

How to apply:

We’d love to learn more about you and explore a potential fit at our company. To be considered for the role, click ‘Apply’ and tell us about your leadership style and philosophy and how it would benefit the Healthy Hemp Oil team. We look forward to hearing from you!
 
Cheers,
Brandon
 
CEO of Healthy Hemp Oil
https://healthyhempoil.com/
  
P.S. We believe very strongly in the quality of our products and the benefits they provide. I’d like to encourage you to check out our website and read some of our customers’ reviews to see for yourself how our products have positively impacted people's lives.

items.title: Project Manager
items.content:
Project Manager at Bitfinex

Remote | International

Job description

Founded in 2012, Bitfinex is a digital asset trading platform offering state-of-the-art services for digital currency traders and global liquidity providers. We’re on a mission to create the most innovative cryptocurrencies exchange. This is a unique opportunity, a rare window of time at the tipping point of the financial evolution. Much like the early days of the internet, blockchain technology faces complex new challenges and having the best team plays a pivotal role in success.

Our team is fully remote and globally distributed to capture the best talent from around the world. So far our company has grown fast and stayed lean to secure its place as a leader in the space.

If you get excited about being in an industry that is breaking new ground and have confidence you can conquer the most challenging feats we’ll encounter, we want to talk to you. Join us, and help lay the foundation for a decentralized future

Project Manager (Remote)

Job description

As a Project Manager in the Product team, you will work with fellow project, program and product managers and with members of the engineering and design teams to execute our business and product strategies across the various Bitfinex products and services.

As a Project Manager at Bitfinex you will take ultimate responsibility for one key project. Of all product team members you are closest to the actual planning and implementation of individual projects, so expect to get your hands dirty. You will manage release cycles, running release sprints and retros; collaborate with the development, marketing, etc teams to break work down, taking large-scale projects and turning them into manageable tasks; track & report on progress to Program and Product Managers, and other stakeholders, to ensure business needs are being met; and generally do whatever it takes to ensure that things stay on track, figuring out alternatives if they don’t. In a nutshell, you own the project deliverables and support your team to deliver the highest standards of quality in a timely manner.

Project Managers have the opportunity to progress into: senior project management positions where they work on the most important projects in the company; program management roles which oversee multiple projects and a team of project managers; or product management roles focusing on our customers, our competitors and business strategy.

Responsibilities

  • Align project objectives with company goals, and make sure the project team is clear on objectives. Act as the voice of the product team and key stakeholders in their absence.
  • Ensure that the project targets are met within the project timeline and costs, and monitor and control all stages of the project life cycle. Suggest reasonable solutions and plans for the problems in the process of the project.
  • Coordinate the progress and quality of each stage of the project to ensure the smooth progress of the project and delivery on time.
  • Where necessary, lead communications with external partners supporting the project.
  • Lead process of issue identification and resolution.
  • Monitor and manage scope.
  • Manage all documentation, project tracking and reporting within the product team and cross-functionally where necessary.

Requirements

  • Minimum 2 years in a project management role working on software development or financial services.
  • Excellent time-management and organizational habits, and the ability to develop these habits in the teams you join.
  • Self-starter attitude, strong problem solving skills and sense of responsibility.
  • Strong analytical and communication skills, and the ability to produce concise reports ongoing to management covering progress of projects, with an aim to improving decision-making on business strategy and product development.
  • Comprehensive understanding of project management methodologies and best practices, and experience implementing fast-moving, large teams.

Additional preferred requirements

  • Experience with high growth, technology, financial, or cryptocurrency products and services
  • PMP certificate
Apply for job

items.content:
SEO Project Manager at Coalition Technologies

Remote

Our company is devoted to doing the best possible work for our clients and maintaining a fun, thriving environment for our team. You will work side by side with top talent to improve your skills and advance the company as a whole. We listen to your ideas and use them.

We offer opportunities for growth and training and the best profit sharing bonus plan in the industry. Up to 50% of all profits are paid out monthly to all full-time employees! All team members enjoy paid time off and subsidized gym memberships. In addition, our in-house team members enjoy flex days, free Friday lunches, regular company events, higher base salaries, and comprehensive insurance. We offer medical, vision, and life insurance in all US states.

We consider all applicants for positions at our company and while we prefer in-house employees, 70% of our team work remotely around the world thanks to the time tracking software, Time Doctor. We welcome all applicants, wherever in the world you might be!

YOU SHOULD HAVE:

  • Experience with search engine optimization
  • Experience managing Google AdWords accounts (preferably AdWords certified)
  • Project management experience and certifications preferred
  • Knowledge of project management software such as Basecamp, MS Project, Visio, Sales Force, etc
  • An understanding of web development (ability to write HTML / CSS /PHP is preferred)
  • Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, negotiating, influencing, facilitation, organizational, prioritization, decision making, and conflict resolution skills
  • A solid understanding of project management methodology including the ability to identify and resolve issues, manage risk, develop detailed work plans and specifications, perform resource allocations, and run team meetings
  • Great attention to detail and be highly organized
  • The availability to work 40 hours per week from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm PST
  • Demonstrate leadership capability with teams of 3 or more people (preferred)
  • Experience with WordPress and/or Magento (preferred)
  • Reliable transportation if working in-house
  • A reliable workstation with a fast computer, microphone and speakers, reliable internet and power if working remotely

YOUR DUTIES AND TASKS:

  • Managing the workload of our SEO team: assigning tasks, following up on tasks, making sure client work is done well and is on time and on budget
  • Creating and executing project work plans and revising as appropriate to meet the changing needs and requirements.
  • Participating in client meetings as needed
  • Creating training, improving our work processes and identifying concerns and dealing with them appropriately
  • Research and development of new online marketing methodologies
  • Identifying resources needed and assigning individual responsibilities
  • Reviewing deliverables prepared by team before passing to Digital Producers
  • Clarifying and communicating project objectives and success criteria to team

Remote/Telecommuting optional. No education or experience required for candidates who excel in our skills tests.

items.content:
Commercial or Sales Director with Background In Organic Spices-Herbs /FMCG Distribution /Retail Sales.


 



  • Entrepreneurial and commercially rewarding opportunity to be part of an organization committed to pioneering in the manufacture, design, development and distribution of WellBeing products and services.

  • An early stage health startup with a mission to provide cost effective and on demand health empowerment services to billions of people globally. We are currently looking for an experienced Sales /Commercial Director to join our growing team.

    Who we are: The Words First complete 360 WellBeing Platform - Telehealth ,Online Shop, Academy  & Events
    A 11 person team highly motivated to build a global health platform (powered by big data, AI and cloud) to empower people live healthier and longer lives. 
    2. Company was incorporated in London in 2018. 
    3. Our platform www.myearthylife.com is currently live and can be viewed, and about to launch the beta version of our mobile app.


 


About My Earthy Life Ltd.


Everyone deserves the very best of what Nature has to offer. Its pure and simple. To us, it’s as clear as daylight and it is this belief which is at the heart and soul of our Company ethos.At the heart of our 360 WellBeing Lifestyle Brand are our WellBeing Nutrition products which are Sustainably Sourced, of the Finest Premium Grade, Organic and Natural. Our Lifestyle Brand products range from WellBeing Nutrition, Essential Oils, Skincare, Personal Hygiene and Cosmetics. All of which are Sustainably Sourced, of the Finest Quality, Organic and Natural. Headquartered out of the UK with regional offices in India, USA, Dubai and HongKong, we are strategically located to serve Local, Regional and International Distributors, Retailers and end customers. An organisation establishing itself with a clear vision to innovate and pioneer in the multi billion dollar WellBeing space.


 


WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR :


 



  • Someone who has a black book and existing relationships of Go To contacts within large chain, small chain, pharmacy and independent Grocery retailers in Europe and the USA.

  • Experience in Organic food/supplements Distribution is an advantage.

  • Educational and professional knowledge and experience in Distribution & Sales is required. 

  • Open up new Markets and grow the business.

  • Experience of working with large and cutting edge startups and firms would be a big plus.

  • Is creative and full of ideas on how to grow our international presence, with the energy and resourcefulness to make this happen.

  • Have a new business sales mentality and drive for success and demand results.

  • Own and hit/exceed annual sales targets within assigned territoryand accounts

  • Develop and execute strategic plan to achieve sales targets and expand our customer base

  • Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships

  • Partner with customers to understand their business needs and objectives

  • Effectively communicate the value proposition through proposals and presentations

  • Understand category-specific landscapes and trends

  • Reporting on forces that shift tactical budgets and strategic direction of accounts


 


Requirements



  • Proven sales executive experience, meeting or exceeding targets

  • Someone who has a black book and existing relationships of Go To contacts within large chain, small chain, pharmacy and Independent Grocery retailers in Europe and the USA.

  • Experience in Organic food/supplements Distribution is an advantage.

  • Ability to communicate, present and influence all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level

  • Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close

  • Proven ability to articulate the distinct aspects of products and services

  • Proven ability to position products against competitors

  • Demonstrable experience as head of sales, developing client-focused, differentiated and achievable solutions

  • Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills

  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills


What's on Offer.


Lucrative remuneration package.

items.content:
Project Manager / SCRUM Master

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Cryptocurrency, SaaS, Software Development
Company size: 1–10 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: RChain Cooperative | No office location

Technologies

jira
scrum
project-management

Job description

RChain core development team project manager 

Our team is looking for an experienced project manager / SCRUM Master to join our team as we continue the development of our blockchain project.  If you are an experienced project manager / SCRUM Master with good technical understanding of blockchain technology, please consider joining our team.  

Skills

           ●  Highly skilled with project management: planning, initiating, executing, risk management, resource management, and stakeholder communications

           ●  Ability to manage an Agile team

           ●  Understanding of the software project life-cycle and ability to manage it

           ●  Comfortable working in a fast-paced and sometimes ambiguous environment

           ●  Experience with QA, release management, and systems reliability engineering is a plus  

           ●  Experience with JIRA and confluence is a plus

           ●  Experience managing a git workflow is a plus

           ●  Experience managing a distributed team is a plus

Position requirements 

  • ●  Lead a distributed, Agile development team with ○ backlog grooming
    ○ sprint planning
    ○ stand up facilitation
    ○ management of velocity
  • ●  Manage the effort to capture, make sense of, and accept feature requirements
    • ○  Work with stakeholders to capture feature requirements
    • ○  Facilitate feasibility study of proposed feature requirements
    • ○  Schedule and resource research and development of new features
    • ○  Convert and prioritize proposed and feasible feature requirements to the backlog
  • ●  Act as a community liaison for the core development team
    • ○  Provide weekly updates on the work of the development team during the RChain community call
    • ○  Provide, when asked, updates on the development team’s work to the RChain board of directors or other stakeholders
    • ○  Monitor and respond to conversation in all public discord channels under
      Developer
    • ○  Plan for and facilitate weekly RNode community test sessions
    • ○  Maintain the RChain development wiki and Jira for stakeholder use
  • ●  Manage the release of software
    • ○  Work with the development team to test and release software at the end of each sprint.
    • ○  Document the contents of the release in release plans
    • ○  Update the roadmap with the release
    • ○  Notify RChain communications of the release
    • ○  Announce the release in relevant developer channels
  • ●  Manage the RChain public testnet
    • ○  Manage the SRE team in administration and maintenance of the RChain public
      testnet
    • ○  Act as a liaison for users of the RChain public testnet
  • ●  Participate in the work to administer the development team
    • ○  Review and approve submitted timesheets
    • ○  Participate in the hiring/firing process as needed
    • Competencies:
    • ●  Leadership Skills
    • ●  Communication skills
    • ●  Technical Knowledge
    • ●  Organization skills
    • ●  Attention to Detail
    • ●  Multitasking
    • Education: 
  • Bachelors degree in a field such as Information Technology, Software Development Management, Software Engineering or Computer Science, or similar.
  • Location:
    The position works from a remote location suitable to the incumbent provided they have sufficient and reliable internet access.
Apply now

About RChain Cooperative

The RChain core development team is primarily made up of RChain Cooperative managed developers. There are a few RChain community members who also work on the core development team.

We are a completely remote workforce located in the USA, EU, Australia and Asia Pacific regions.  

We work in an Agile environment with standup 3 x per week.  

Benefits

  • Open Source project
  • Cooperative Community engagement
  • Developing a new blockchain
  • Scalable, concurrent, with proof-of-stake consensus
  • Health benefits for Full Time employees
  • All remote workforce; USA, EU, Australia, Asia Pacific, adding more.
  • Agile environment

items.title: Director of Social Media
items.content:
Director of Social Media at Matador Network

Remote
Matador Network is looking for a visionary leader to become our next Director of Social Media.
We are Matador.
If National Geographic made a baby with VICE, it would be Matador. Over the last 13 years, we have become the Internet’s #1 digital travel and adventure publisher for millennials and Gen X.
We are rare in the world of digital media companies, in that we are both independent and profitable…and growing fast.
Globally, we inspire 120 million people per month across our platform with our travel article features, city guides, original shows, and documentaries. We are doing as much as we can as fast as we can, building the world’s most exciting travel lifestyle brand for people in their 20s, 30s, and 40s. And we want your help!
Things you will be ROCKING:
  • Driving growth and strategy across Matador’s social media channels
  • Ideating, testing, and measuring new ways to reach millions of people with Matador’s brand and content
  • Investigating and developing new sources of high-quality web traffic
  • Forging and maintaining close partnerships between the Matador editorial team and other publishers and influencers
  • Ensuring consistency of Matador’s brand voice across our O&O channels
  • Managing a remote team that includes both social media producers and video editors
You’re really good at:
  • Solving problems with creativity
  • Distilling lots of information into short sentences
  • Taking calculated risks and thinking way outside the box
  • Explaining just about anything to just about anyone (bonus points if you can make them laugh while doing it)
  • Staying extremely organized in the face of many tasks and priorities; nothing falls through the cracks on your watch
  • Listening well and being part of a (badass) team of distributed professionals
Location: Remote, North America. New York preferred.
You have:
  • 3+ years experience working in social media and 1+ year leading a team
  • Proven success in growing social reach at a large brand or online publication
  • Ability to manage, communicate with, and direct a distributed workforce
  • Familiarity with reporting tools and the ability to extract broad trends from detailed performance data
  • A deep understanding of Matador’s voice, audience, and brand
  • A love for travel, adventure, and people!
Extra awesome:
  • Expert understanding of audience development across different platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, Pinterest, and email
  • Expert understanding of social and audience targeting, retargeting, and other marketing tools and strategies across social and email
Nuts and bolts:
  • Full-time independent contractor
  • Remote position (i.e., working from your home office)
  • Based in US time zone
To apply:
Please send a cover letter, resume, and salary expectations to jobs@matadornetwork.com.
Location: North America
Apply for job

items.content:
Software Development Project Manager

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Manager
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Entertainment, Manufacturing
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Dillon Software, Inc. | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-07:00) Mountain Time

Technologies

project-management
postgresql

Job description

We are looking for a Project Manager to fill a senior position responsible for managing multiple software development initiatives while helping Dillon Software and our clients mature our shared Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies. 

Working closely with our clients and our leaders, the Project Manager’s focus will be two-fold: to drive continuous improvement of our hybrid agile SDLC methodologies, and to implement those methodologies to ensure that we exceed our client’s expectations in both process and outcome.

The successful candidate will have excellent English communication skills and proven leadership skills, and will possess a deep understanding of formal project management methodologies, processes and tools as demonstrated by extensive experience managing medium, large and enterprise-level software development projects.  In addition, the successful candidate will have a strong understanding of our technical environment, including:

  • Web (React.js) and mobile (Swift, Kotlin) application development
  • Content protection mechanisms (FairPlay, DASH, HLS, encryption)
  • RESTful and GraphQL web services
  • Search services (ElasticSearch)
  • Relational Databases (PostgreSQL, Oracle)
  • Amazon AWS services, cloud-based infrastructure, devops

Position Responsibilities

  • Ensure Client Success
    • Engage client stakeholders to acquire and internally communicate a deep knowledge of the client’s history, values, culture, team and processes for collaborating with Dillon Software;
    • Engage client stakeholders to acquire an understanding of their software development methodology and processes, and to align Dillon Software and client development efforts;
    • Engage client stakeholders to acquire and internally communicate a deep knowledge of the client’s business strategies, objectives and goals and how they translate into the client’s software functional requirements;
    • Learn and stay proficient in our technology stack, tools and implementations in order to provide effective functional and technical consultation to the client;
    • Drive alignment with the client on clear definitions of success at the Epic and Story levels for their functional requirements, including how those requirements translate into detailed designs;
    • Manage and mentor individuals within Dillon Software, particularly the team members that interact directly with the client.
  • Manage Client Projects
    • Function as the primary point of contact for the client at the project level, including consulting the client in the definition of achievable functional and technical priorities relative to scope, schedule and budget;
    • Build and maintain Dillon Software’s components of the project’s budget and schedule, and work with the client to integrate those components into the overall project plan;
    • Effectively share the client’s business requirements and priorities with our team;
    • Drive engagement and collaboration between the client and our team leads to translate the business requirements into a clear and technically actionable, functional, user experience and user interface designs;
    • Drive engagement and collaboration between our teams to decompose the client’s design into well-defined technical deliverables and work plans that are aligned with the clear set of established client priorities;
    • Follow up and manage progress with our team leads to ensure delivery of client projects within agreed upon schedule and budget;
    • Lead all project-level communication within Dillon Software to the client, including maintaining and submitting regularly scheduled progress reports.
  • Drive Project Management Best Practices
    • Lead collaboration with our senior staff in the continuous improvement of internal SDLC processes and tools;
    • With forethought for balancing the existing and anticipated demands across the entire portfolio of projects, proactively make decisions to resolve competing resource allocation requirements;
    • Anticipate and remove roadblocks while holding teams accountable for our commitments to the client.

Position Skills and Competencies

Required Skills and Competencies:

  • 5+ years of Software Development Project Management experience, including business and team management experience that consistently meets or exceeds client expectations;
  • Demonstrated expert-level experience in both Agile and traditional project management principles and practices, including the ability to appropriately blend them together according to the specific business context;
  • Demonstrated success at managing and delivering large, complex software development projects involving multiple geographically dispersed functional and technical teams;
  • Demonstrated experience overseeing multi-function project teams, including business analysts, designers, architects, developers, and QA personnel;
  • Deep business acumen that is sufficient to collaborate with clients in developing strategies and solutions of high business value with a high degree of credibility;
  • A depth of technical understanding that is sufficient to be able to accurately and objectively evaluate complex project issues and risks with a high degree of credibility;
  • A depth of understanding and experience with relevant processes and tools related to Agile and traditional project management (e.g., Jira, MS Project, etc. or equivalent);
  • Outstanding interpersonal skills, including clear and concise verbal and written communication and the ability to discuss and describe highly technical issues in non-technical terms.
  • Outstanding analytical, planning and organizational skills, including the ability to calmly, efficiently and effectively manage and resolve conflicts inherent in competing demands;

Desired Skills and Competencies:

  • Experience working with media and/or ecommerce software solutions;
  • Experience working on web and mobile software solutions;
  • Basic knowledge of relational database technology, including experience writing SQL;
  • Project Management Certification

Desired Personality Traits

  • Driven by values that inspire investment through the cultivation of trust-based relationships;
  • Passionate about achieving client satisfaction through quality and continuous improvement;
  • Self-motivated, proactive problem solver willing to take initiative and drive resolution of issues;
  • Unafraid of change and able to adapt and learn quickly;
  • Critical thinker with good logical and creative problem-solving skills.
Apply now

About Dillon Software, Inc.

Dillon Software is a team of 40 highly skilled system architects, designers, and developers delivering web and mobile applications to clients in the entertainment, financial and manufacturing industries.  Our core strengths are Java and Javascript technologies, relational databases, web, iOS, and Android applications.  For the right candidate, we offer challenging long-term projects, a large degree of creative input, location and scheduling flexibility, and the opportunity to interact with a great bunch of people who are at the top of their respective fields.

We strive for perfection as much as possible.  Service and quality are what distinguish us from our competitors.  If you're accustomed to delivering "good enough", this is not the right position for you.  Code formatting, variable names, unit test structure, appropriate use of whitespace, spelling, and grammar in comments and written communications - all these things are very important to us.  Great code is like a race car - high functionality and performance for the intended task, but every detail is beautiful and thoroughly engineered.

Based in beautiful Whitefish, Montana, we have a diverse team of remote professionals from New York to California and points in between.  You must be very comfortable working on a geographically dispersed team - and you must have the personality type that allows others to feel comfortable working with you.

Benefits

  • Join an outstanding team of seasoned developers
  • Fun, engaging long term projects
  • Startup excitement but with no funding worries

items.content:
Web Project Manager at ePublishing

Remote

100% Work From Home

Web Project Managers at ePublishing are an amazing, talented, highly-motivated team of individuals who speak to clients with a voice of authority and an undeniable air of confidence.

They are able to perform the following small miracles with ease and grace

  • Juggle the needs of multiple high-value clients while making each feel important and loved
  • Manage simultaneous projects involving multiple technical team members
  • Investigate, comprehend and translate technical and business requirements from clients and 3rd party vendors
  • Create clear and concise Statements of Work
  • Create and maintain detailed and comprehensive documentation

If this sounds like you, read on…

Web Project Manager is a salaried position and includes standard benefits such as healthcare, generous vacation accrual and the greatest benefit of all: working remotely.

You must be committed to customer service and excellence.

Required Skills:

  • Minimum of 3 years experience managing the design and development of web sites and applications.
  • Minimum of 3 years experience managing projects and their dependencies in a fast-paced environment
  • Minimum of 3 years directly working with external clients in a customer service-oriented capacity
  • Spectacular written and oral communication skills
  • Possess a high level of motivation to provide strong customer service
  • Ability to stay highly organized and motivated in a remote environment
  • Experience working with both web developers and designers
  • High level of comfort working with web technologies, video conference, messaging and social media

You must be able to connect to the internet through a reliable high speed internet connection with little or no downtime.

You are responsible for supplying and maintaining your own work station. We are platform agnostic and the choice of tools (desktop, laptop, smartphone, operating system, etc) is yours but they must be able to handle the applications, websites, web-based tools and communication solutions required to successfully execute your duties and stay connected to teammates and clients.

ePublishing, Inc is an enterprise-class CMS solution provider serving content publishers small and large. We have been around for more than 15 years and are staffed by 100% remote employees who tirelessly work at home from multiple countries and time zones.

Apply for job

items.title: Director of Wireless Systems and Networks, remote - Job Order 2954
items.content:
• This individual can be located anywhere from NYC to DC and work at home. Of key importance is the person have a strong technical background in wireless communications and also have experience bidding on and winning contracts with DARPA, CERDEC, AFRL or similar agencies.
Director of Wireless Systems and Networks, remote - Job Order 2954 US citizens only
Remote work, located anywhere from NYC to DC
Compensation DOE They are more than a research lab; they are an innovation hub. They have an entreprenurial spirit molding technology of the future. They are involved in cybersecurity, data analytics, advanced networking, wireless and mobility, display technologies, optical and quantum, power grid and IoT security, and electronic warfare. The industries they work in include smart cities and smart phones, intelligent battlefields and autonomous systems, telecommunications, energy, finance, government, life sciences and defense. They have 225 scientists, engineers and analysts on staff, 260+ issued, licensed and pending patents. They have more than 125 PhD's on staff, 40+ collaborations with universities, research organizations and vendors. Additionally they have 100+ on-going customer-funded research and technology programs. Job Description Develop a unified technical and business strategy for the Wireless Systems and Networks department,
Expand both the business and customer base of the department,
Ensure successful execution of projects and transition of technologies to downstream customers,
Line management, including recruiting, hiring and professional staff development, and
Collaborate with other managers within the company to ensure the overall success of the organization
** Must be able to obtain a TS clearance or higher. The location for this position is flexible to anywhere on the East Coast till Washington, DC . Qualifications Requires BA/BS with 12 to15 years, with at least six plus years as a manager. Incumbent will have a specialized knowledge in one or more fields of disciplines and general knowledge in a number of others. Preferred: Ph.D. in Engineering or Applied Physics or M.S. in Engineering with required experience.
Experience in Wireless Systems research, in areas such as RF Signal Processing, digital communications, wireless networking, including network control and optimization
The location for this position is flexible to anywhere on the East Coast till Washington, DC .

items.content:
Project Manager - Remote

Are you a Project Manager who likes managing multiple projects simultaneously? What about working with BIG brands?

A business trusted by some of the world biggest brands to deliver an industry-leading eCommerce SaaS platform that helps them understand their customers better is looking for a Project Manager to deliver some market-leading projects.

Their SaaS app has three key components that make it so effective, the first is a supped up SEO function that only brings up what YOU the buyer wants.

The second feature is a visual online merchandiser, this removes the steps that sometimes slow down the release of new content or products.

The final piece that really makes all tick is the machine learning feature that learns the behaviour of customers to give better recommendations based on how they shop.

So your role as Digital Project Manager will be to provide hands-on project management throughout the lifecycle of ongoing and new projects, from initiation, gathering requirements, design, testing all the way through to deployment.

Ideally you will have worked on eCommerce SaaS-based projects and working on multiple projects simultaneously.

So, a little about your team, you will be working in a cross-functional team of BAs, Product people, Designers, Testers and Devs. This company is all about collaboration and knowledge sharing.

You are probably thinking what's in it for you? As a Project Manager you will work with some of the most attractive, luxury and fast-moving brands in the retail world. As Project Manager, they can guarantee you will never be bored, you will get exposure to a multitude of customers and their operations, giving you the opportunity to always be learning.

As a company they understand the importance of your time outside of work so you get flexible and remote working options, they have offices in London, Amsterdam and Paris that you can work from if you decide to have a cheeky or well deserved weekend break!

Hit apply so we can talk about the next steps. In your cover letter tell me the name of your favourite brand. Unfortunately, we are only able to consider applicants eligible to work in the UK with no restriction.

Charlton Howard is a Trading Name of Talent Point Ltd. Talent Point Ltd and Charlton Howard are equal-opportunity employers and do not discriminate against these or any other class protected by applicable law. No terminology in this advert is designed to discriminate on grounds of gender, race, colour, religion, creed, disability, age, sex or sexual orientation

items.content:
Project Manager - Web Development

 
Interpersonal Frequency (I.F.) is seeking a Project Manager to add to its awesome and growing team.

Who you are:
  • You’re a professional project manager who has experience managing the full life-cycle of website implementations, including project scoping, budget management, and project planning.
  • You adhere to project management best practices and use them in your daily work. 
  • You can interface seamlessly with research analysts, designers and developers. You have experience guiding the work of others.
  • You enjoy client interaction.
  • You assess risk, and anticipate issues, working proactively to solve them quickly and effectively.
  • You bring both creativity and maturity to your work: you’re a self-starter who can jump in quickly and can manage your own time effectively in a remote work environment. 
  • You’re a team player who loves technology, communicates clearly (verbally and in writing), learns quickly and always carefully review work before hand off.
  • You’re skilled at and experienced with collaborating effectively with remote colleagues while working from home. 

Requirements: 
You must either be a US Citizen or already have a Green Card to apply


Minimum five years’ experience project managing teams engaged in designing and developing websites and web applications (or equivalent experience)


Experience being primary client contact, responsible for client satisfaction throughout project lifecycles


Experience managing remote teams and resources and communicating/coordinating with tools such as Zoom, Basecamp, Slack, Gitlab, and Zendesk:


  • Demonstrated ability to inspire trust in the project team, other internal teams, and clients 
  • Ability to lead virtual teams in a matrix management environment
  • Demonstrated success in working in a highly collaborative team environment and ability to resolve conflict, while fostering a collaborative and communicative environment
Experience project planning, including establishing and meeting key milestones and budget


Experience analyzing user and website data and leveraging analytics to drive design and create authority as the "internal client" for I.F.'s creative director, user interface designer, developers, and testers


Experience running senior and executive team meetings, as well as client sprint reviews and internal scrums/weeklies and communicate via clear, regular status reports


Experience managing project budgets and notifying/mitigating when costs begin trending higher than expected


Experience predicting and monitoring risks for large, complex projects with multiple internal and external stakeholders 


Demonstrated ability to manage multiple complex issues/projects: Ability to anticipate and adapt to changing conditions and opportunities 


Excellent verbal and written communication skills, the ability to interface effectively with senior managers, business partners and clients, and the discernment to sense of when to strongly advocate for a position and when to seek compromise 


Demonstrated commitment to I.F. Purpose & Principles based on employment history and experience and interview(s)


Willingness to travel



Nice to Have Experience:
Experience with clients in the vendor/agency realm very helpful


Experience with content management systems, particularly Drupal 7/8


Experience with post mortems (internal team) and client satisfaction efforts to continually improve process and satisfaction


PMP Certification


To Apply:
Please send your resume and optional cover letter to pmjobs@ifsight.com.

items.content:
CoGo - Connecting Good 


Finance & Operations Manager


Location :  Central London / Flexible. 


Contract: Part-Time. 


Start Date: As soon as possible. 


Salary: This is a 0.5 FTE (20 hours) role, with a start salary of £35 - 45K pro-rata, depending on skills and experience. 


ABOUT COGO: 


CoGo is a FinTech-for-good app allowing consumers to vote with their money for a more sustainable and ethical future. Launched in the U.K. in December 2018, after 6 years operating in New Zealand, CoGo wants to transform every pound that U.K. consumers spend into a vote for a better future. The platform is the first tech innovation that has the aim of leveraging spending data and every transaction made by a consumer.  


 


CoGo has recently launched the world's first-ever "ethical wallet share". We are the UK’s national aggregator of data on accredited businesses and we are using this data, in conjunction with Open Banking, to build a platform that can tell our users what percentage of their spending is with businesses that align with their values. This enables our core value proposition: a recommendation engine that helps our users shift more of their spending to ethical and sustainable businesses.


ABOUT YOU: 


 


You are a clear-thinking, dynamic person who is equally happy bringing a strategic perspective to our operational scaling as getting your hands dirty keeping our books.  You will thrive on a challenge and have initiative in spades. Your passion for keeping CoGo ship-shape will be infectious, and you’ll have the vision and drive to position our finance and operations functions for growth.  


 


We work collaboratively, so excellent relationship and communication skills are essential, but you’ll also have plenty of autonomy and need to be happy working on your own. You’ll enjoy working in a fast-paced, tech-savvy and entrepreneurial environment.  You’ll contribute superb organisation and project management skills, and exemplary attention to detail – even under pressure.


 


You’ll have a proven track record with 5 or more years experience across the full range of functions in your portfolio, but you don’t need to be a chartered accountant (we have a Virtual Financial Controller for that).  We use Xero, so it would be ideal if you’re already familiar with it, but if not we’ll support you to learn fast.   


 


CoGo is a values-driven business, and it’s our commitment to a better future that drives each and every one of us. You’ll love working with us if you care about people and the planet, and believe in the power of data, technology and consumer demand to bring about meaningful change.


ABOUT THE ROLE: 


 


Our CEO is looking for a strategic right hand to help run the day-to-day operations of the company - with a focus on the UK market but also supporting the NZ team.  


 


Operations


 



  • Lead the recruitment strategy for new staff and contractors. Manage the onboarding and offboarding processes, including contract management, and maintain relevant HR policies. 


 



  • Support staff in their day to day work, and with their professional development. Help make the team thrive! 


 



  • Oversee all internal communications, document management and compliance. Run the machine that supports the team. 


 



  • Help create the systems and processes that foster exceptional efficiency and build great culture. 


 


Finances


 



  • Accounts payable for both UK and NZ, batched monthly, including monitoring accounts mailbox. 


 



  • Payroll fortnightly for NZ (monthly UK payroll and pensions is done by a payroll contractor that you will manage).


 



  • Accounts receivables for both UK and NZ, although most of our clients are on direct debit, so this is relatively straightforward.


 



  • Annual accounts in NZ and the UK will be handled by our accountants, with support from you as required


 


 ADDITIONAL INFORMATION 


 



  • We’re based at Google’s Start-Up campus in Shoreditch, London.  The campus is a buzzing community full of a diverse range of tech-led Start-ups. Google hosts multiple free events daily that you’re welcome to attend as a resident. Find out more information here.  


 



  • This is a 0.5 FTE (20 hours) role, with a starting salary of £35-45k pro-rata, depending on skills and experience.  For now, we are offering the post on a 1-year fixed-term basis, with potential for extension.


 



  • There will be a 3 month probation period. 


 



  • You will provide your own phone and laptop.


 



  • You’ll get 20 days annual leave and 40 days sick leave, pro rata, and be able to opt in to our pension scheme. 


 



  • Start date is flexible, but the sooner the better





HOW TO APPLY 


 


Please email your CV (or just a link to your LinkedIn profile, if you prefer) along with a statement of not more than 350 words outlining why you’d be a brilliant hire to:


ben@cogo.co by Thursday 26th September.


 


***CoGo welcomes direct applications from candidates. Recruitment agencies should not respond.***

items.content:
About CardAlpha


CardAlpha is an early stage fintech start-up, currently under development, to meet financial needs of SME businesses. CardAlpha is in a pre-revenue stage and is based at Level 39, the fintech accelerator at Canary Wharf, London. CardAlpha will enable small businesses to accept card payments, hold business funds securely in a digital account, make payments via electronic transfers and a business debit card. SMEs transacting on the CardAlpha platform will also access business loans, at competitive rates based on their transaction history and credit bureau records.


Job Summary


We are looking for a Head of Core Services/Fullstack Developer to help with building CardAlpha’s mission critical systems.


Responsibilities



  • Translating business requirements to technical specifications.

  • Designing and developing microservices as per business requirements

  • Participating in regular code reviews

  • Collaborating with the team on new conventions, libraries, tools and technologies

  • Reporting progress of tasks undertaken to team members everyday


Requirements



  • Excellent understanding of SQL and ORM tools such as GORM

  • Strong understanding of software development and ability to apply this knowledge to various programming languages – we are using mostly Golang but the environment is polyglot

  • Experience with GRPC and Protocol Buffers

  • Experience with scalable APIs and microservices

  • Exceptional problem-solving and communication skills

  • Ability to work remotely and autonomously

  • Familiarity with unit testing frameworks and test driven development

  • Familiarity with git

  • Familiarity with docker and kubernetes


Nice to have(s)



  • Golang

  • IOS development experince with Swift

  • Basic HTML and JS experience

  • Experience building solutions for cloud-based environments (e.g. GCP)

  • Advanced understanding of Kubernetes and GKE

  • Team management experience

  • An entrepreneurial spirit


Head of Core Services will be a member of the founding team and is expected to initially contribute 60-80 hours in a month and will be compensated via “START-UP EQUITY ONLY”. The contribution and role may potentially change to a full time position with normal working hours and incremental benefits, post later stage funding and full commercial rollout of CardAlpha.


Job Type: Part-time
