items.content:
VP of Engineering

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Industry: Market research, Web Technology
Company size: 501–1k people
Company type: Private
Company: YouGov | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-08:00) Pacific Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

python
python-3.x
r
javascript

Job description

Incredible opportunity to become the VP of Engineering for Crunch.io! 

Crunch.io, part of YouGov PLC are looking for a VP Engineering that can drive innovation, quality and agility in our engineering.  Crunch.io is an innovative analytics company in the market research industry. We offer a survey data analysis platform that allows market researchers, analysts, and marketers to collaborate in a secure, cloud-based environment, using an intuitive drag-and-drop interface. Crunch users can quickly gain insights from their data and communicate them to their clients.

You will leverage latest cloud-computing and open-source technologies. You will manage distributed development teams to realize our technology vision. We are looking for someone who is entrepreneurial with a proven record building and managing successful software development.

What will I be doing?

  • Direct responsibility for managing approximately 20 developers, split across three teams.
  • Work with senior leadership and product marketing to create a roadmap for the product.
  • Develop, lead and inspire a team of approximately 20 developers. Be a magnet for technical talent and accelerate the hiring of engineers.
  • Allocate resources, set priorities, and manage schedules for the teams. Deliver high quality software on time and within budget.
  • Promote a culture of success, pride, performance, discipline, and creativity. Play a leadership role within the company.

What do I need to bring with me?

  • Experience managing teams using agile and test-driven development.
  • Strong computer science foundation
  • Expertise building big-data analytic solutions with appropriate use of relational and NoSQL database technologies
  • Fluency in multiple programming languages, but especially Python.
  • Understanding of JavaScript frameworks, such as React.
  • At least ten years’ experience in software development.
  • B.S. in computer science or related degree. Advanced degree preferred.

Any additional info:

This position is a full time role, based 100% remotely

Apply now

About YouGov

YouGov works with the world's leading brands and organisations to understand what people think.

Powered by Digital Development

Our Global Dev group is a tight group of seven teams comprised of about 40 developers based globally in the UK, Poland, USA and beyond.

The teams coordinate on efforts to build applications and innovate in data collection, survey authoring, profile data management, integration, data analytics, content management, and other areas.

These applications drive the opinion data engine of YouGov; empowering the biggest and the best organisations around the world with accurate information about what the world thinks. Enabling these organisations to make effective predictions based on what their audience or stakeholders think.

We believe the more people are able to participate in the decisions made by the institutions that serve them, the better those decisions will be.

Diverse as the Audience we work with

YouGov is part of Stonewall's Global Diversity Champions Framework.

Benefits

  • Flexibility
  • Best Equipment
  • Salary + Bonus
  • Well-being at Work
  • Various lifestyle benefits
  • Culture of Learning
  • Pension (401K in the USA)
  • Employee Assistance
  • Games and Social Events
  • Good Holiday allowance

items.content:
VP of Engineering (Remote)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Digital Media
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Daily Kos (Kos Media LLC) | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-08:00) Pacific Time

Technologies

reactjs
ruby-on-rails
mysql
haskell
elasticsearch

Job description

LOCATION: Oakland, CA preferred, but remote considered for right candidate

Daily Kos is the nation’s largest liberal online political community, news organization, and activism hub. Powered by millions of dedicated activists, we’re transforming media and organizing by empowering regular Americans to reshape politics.

We are seeking an experienced VP of Engineering to manage and scale our growing engineering team. This person will set and achieve our engineering strategy and goals by working closely with leadership and the product team to deliver what’s next for Daily Kos, ensure the maintenance and performance of the existing systems and features, grow the engineering team and demonstrate technical leadership. This person should expect to consistently, collaboratively and efficiently deliver engineering excellence.

Daily Kos is an exciting workplace! Our site is used by hundreds of thousands of people a day who care deeply about progressive politics and are working to affect real political change. We provide an extensive feature set that extends from blogging to activism and beyond, built on top of a modern tool chain that includes Rails, React, Varnish, Nginx, RDS/MySQL, Haskell, Nix, ElasticSearch, and AWS. We have an energized team of great people with diverse backgrounds and skill sets. If you’re interested in a position that offers more than just a technical challenge, we’d love to hear from you.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Execution of dynamic management, leadership, and strategic vision for growing engineering team.
  • Build and inspire a diverse world-class engineering team that delivers with quality and efficiency.
  • Establish key internal relationships and cross-functional teams to deliver creative, high-performing, secure and sustainable solutions.
  • Manage architecture to produce scalable product in a steadily growing political media organization.
  • Ensure attitude of constant vigilance around security of software that is critical to an organization with a highly visible public presence.
  • Develop and implement top-notch product road-map and development processes.

EXPERIENCE:

  • Successfully recruiting, managing, and retaining remote staff including contractors.
  • Maintaining and/or replacing legacy software.
  • Building on top of Rails and React is highly desirable.
  • Ideally, dealing ad networks from the publisher side, doing any or all of the following: creating ads; managing the integration of ad networks; advertising client relations; ad trafficking; and ad inventory creation.
  • Leading, mentoring, motivating, and developing diverse teams.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Leader with a demonstrated track record building and scaling technical teams to deliver compelling experiences for large audiences across multiple channels and platforms.
  • Influencer with the capacity to bridge existing solutions with new and innovative software architecture and features.
  • Strategic thinker with the ability to identify complex issues early and address them systematically before they become problematic.
  • Team leader who believes transparency, collaboration, and inclusiveness can be key to scaling.
  • Engineering authority who understands that quality is paramount, but speed is critical to keep pace with American politics and liberal activists.
  • Superb communicator, able to bring alignment to teams with individuals at all levels.

SALARY RANGE: $180,000 - $200,000

BENEFITS:

This position is a 40 hour/week, full-time exempt position and reports to the Chief Technical Officer. Candidates must be legally eligible to work in the United States. The position offers a flexible work environment, the ability to work remotely or from home, competitive salary, excellent benefits including: full medical, dental and vision benefits, optional 401K with a company match, professional development stipend, a generous vacation package, as well as employer-paid maternity/family leave. Our organizational commitment to personal growth and work-life balance reduces churn and encourages a very rewarding long term position.

At Daily Kos, we believe that the diversity of ideas, experiences, and cultures that our employees contribute to our organization help us be more effective activists, and we are proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity workplace. We have a team of amazing people with different backgrounds and talents that are energized by the day’s news events, and people united by common cause. We’re a company that loves learning and supports growth and training for all our employees.

Women, people of color, and LGBTQIA individuals strongly encouraged to apply.

Apply now

About Daily Kos (Kos Media LLC)

Daily Kos is the nation's largest liberal online political community, news organization, and activism hub. Powered by millions of dedicated activists, we’re transforming media and organizing by empowering regular Americans to reshape politics.

At Daily Kos, we believe that the diversity of ideas, experiences, and cultures that our employees contribute to our organization help us be more effective activists, and we are proud to be an inclusive and equal­ opportunity workplace. We're a company that loves learning and supports growth and training for all our employees. This position will be located remotely or in our Oakland, CA office.

Benefits

  • 100% Medical Coverage
  • 6 weeks paid vacation per year
  • 401K Plan

items.title: Sales Enablement Program Manager
items.content:
Sales Enablement Program Manager at DataStax

Remote

Location: Anywhere – United States

Type: Full time
Category: Sales Operations
Employee Type: Regular
Job Summary: DataStax delivers the always-on, Active Everywhere distributed hybrid cloud database built on Apache Cassandra . We are seeking a talented Sales Enablement Program Manager to join our team.
Job Desc:

As a Sales Enablement Program Manager, you would collaborate with Sales Leaders to position our Sales team for success; through the creation and delivery of learning programs, liaison between Product Marketing, Release Management and Sales Enablement. This role will work closely with the Sales Enablement Instructional Designer (ID) as well as the Sales Enablement Trainer.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Individual contributor role responsible for the development, delivery and tracking of Global Sales Training and Enablement frameworks, blended learning programs, content and communications tools and platforms.
  • Spearhead the planning, coordination and facilitation of the sales onboarding program and certification process that is customized by job role, location and experience.
  • Build blended learning programs that leverage elearning, self – paced learning activities for fact-based content with an opportunity for skill practice/hands-on application in workshops based on a sales simulation.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams and subject matter experts to build relevant programs and iterate based on feedback.
  • Build content for and facilitate sales enablement workshops and provide coaching/feedback to participants including sales leadership team.
  • Maintain learning roadmaps and certification for sales roles via learning management system.
  • Drive sales communication programs. Spearhead the agenda and content for the global sales call, post regular articles in the Field Communication channels and develop content/sessions for the global sales kickoff.
  • Help to spearhead global sales task force to gather sales best practices, vet sales training initiatives and ensure that programs are relevant and on target with sales team needs.
  • Assist Sales Leaders with assessing, ranking and rating their sales employees and help develop individual training and improvement plans to get the entire sales organization to the desired level of professionalism and productivity.

Job Requirements:

  • Minimum of 7-8 years of professional work experience with a minimum of 5 years experience in corporate sales training and enablement role.
  • Strong, confident presence, facilitation skills in front of a room and over web conference, credible in front of a field sales team and executive audience.
  • Formal knowledge and practical experience in formal and informal/social learning.
  • Experience with eLearning tools and learning management systems i.e. Brainshark, Camtasia, Captivate, Cornerstone or other LMS etc.
  • Recent experience in fast-growing global software or SaaS start-up company preferred.
  • Strong project management and organizational skills, ability to multitask.
  • Strong understanding of sales process and can share best practices for improving productivity and sales close rates.
  • Quick learner and ability to pick up new skills and self-train when necessary.
  • Industry experience a plus. Technical aptitude will be important.
Apply for job

items.title: Brilliant: Creative Partner (Account Manager / Project Manager / Designer hybrid)
items.content:
Creative Partner (Account Manager / Project Manager / Designer hybrid)

Help bring brands to life as a Creative Partner at Brilliant.

Work with our clients help them design and produce creative branded products, achieve marketing goals and delight their customers and colleagues with better branded products and flawlessly executed campaigns.

The Creative Partner is tech-savvy, has excellent communication skills, design chops, a great eye and a passion for ecommerce, retail trends and creative, well-designed physical products.

Primary activities include product research and selection, light product design, production logistics coordination, project management and account management. You will interface with Brilliant designers, vendors and our clients to develop creative solutions, pitch them to clients, and execute projects from beginning to end.

This is a special hybrid role for a special hybrid kind of person. The role is a little bit of each of the following:
  • Account Management
  • Graphic Design
  • Project Management
  • Creative Direction
  • Shopping and Retail Trend Analysis
  • Vendor Management
  • Customer Service
  • Exception Handling

About you:
  • 2-4 years of full-time work experience required (minimum)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skill
  • Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop experience
  • Good design sense 
  • Strong customer service mentality
  • Tech savvy
  • Positive attitude - this is a heavy client-service role, so strong empathy is a must!
And finally:
  • You love branding, design and retail -- you will ultimately be selling prospective clients on Brilliant and our mission to bring their brands to life through impactful branded merchandise, creative packaging and thoughtful collateral
  • #remotelife: You love the freedom remote work brings, and you know that with great freedom comes great responsibility. You’re ready for both

Compensation:
  • Base $60-85k DOE
  • Open vacation / PTO policy
  • $3,000 a year in healthcare reimbursement through our QSEHRA program
  • 401k plan and profit sharing
------

We are a small, nimble team. You will have room to grow in your role, manage others, take on additional responsibilities, or focus on specific skills as desired. Opportunities available to work on company branding, content creation, email marketing, software product management, ops, reporting, buying, merchandise planning if interested.

We are a fully remote company, so you can be based anywhere in the US and should be enthusiastic about working remotely.

items.title: Head of Design
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=2, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=18, frontend=0}
items.content:
Head of Design at HashiCorp

Remote | International

As the Head of Design at HashiCorp, you are the leader for all things design, encompassing brand identity, product design, digital design, and design operations. You will build and grow the design organization, and collaborate with other executives to integrate design through an embedded model. You will advocate for design as a key stakeholder, maintain a high standard of work, and drive a consistent implementation of the brand both internally and externally.

HashiCorp is the multi-cloud infrastructure automation company. Our open source software is used by millions of users to provision, secure, connect, and run any infrastructure for any application. The Global 2000 uses our enterprise software to accelerate application delivery and drive innovation through software. We have a strong focus on the practitioner experience and treat it as our “true north.” Our Tao of HashiCorp highlights a workflow focus as being more important than technology, and this impacts deeply how we think about user experience. We are a highly distributed company as well, with employees located around the world. Our culture embraces autonomy and asynchronous work to support a global team.

We’re looking for a Head of Design who is excited about owning and evolving a highly visible brand in the technology community, and making HashiCorp recognized for its dedication to design excellence. The ideal leader is strategic, collaborative, and can scale with HashiCorp. Our brand needs to evolve with the business, and the design leader needs to develop and mentor a team who can scale to the various design challenges across the marketing and product portfolio.

This role would be a Senior Director or VP role, reporting directly to one of the co-founders in the Office of the CTO. This allows the design organization to be outside of engineering and product management, to allow for more effective advocacy of design.

The design team today is more than a dozen individuals who are distributed between engineering and marketing. One of our goals is to create a centralized design function and use an embedded model to work closely with internal customers and partner teams. As we continue to scale, we expect the design team to grow and allow us to further focus on user research, advancing the user experience, refining the brand, and pushing for more consistency across the portfolio.

Responsibilities:

  • Own the overall creative vision and design strategy across HashiCorp
  • Drive a consistent implementation of brand and experience principles across products, digital properties, and marketing collateral
  • Ensure a high bar for all creative delivery
  • Grow the team and recruit design talent
  • Define a career path and help people identity growth opportunities
  • Provide mentorship to the design organization and build a world-class team
  • Collaborate with other functional leaders to embed design in marketing and engineering teams
  • Advocate for design as a stakeholder and nurture a design-oriented culture
  • Communicate brand strategy and major changes to key stakeholders
  • Drive improvements to the overall design process and scale delivery

Skills and Experience:

  • 7+ years of experience in design leadership role. Experience designing for developer tools/platforms or at user-focused technology company a plus.
  • 5+ years of managing designers
  • Experience leading teams and recruiting designers
  • Experience crafting and managing a large brand
  • Real-world experience in a variety of functional areas including brand leadership, product design, and marketing
  • Experience with remote teams preferred but not required

Attributes we look for:

  • Empathy for end-users and consumers
  • Humility and a learning mindset
  • Listening to understand
  • Explain complex ideas simply
  • Written, verbal, and visual communication skills
  • Reflective
  • Responsible and takes ownership overwork

HashiCorp embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be. #LI-MM1

Apply for job

items.title: Product / development manager: spec tasks, test and manage developers
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Likvido.com

Product / Development Manager: Spec Tasks, Test and Manage Developers


Worldwide
Hi future Likvido employee! As the co-founder and Chief Technical Officer (CTO) of a very fast-growing startup: I need you. We’re looking for a remote “development manager” / "product manager". This is basically “The Right-Hand of the CTO”, as I need help with everything from speccing new tasks, testing tasks, answer questions from developers and even conceptualize new features. YOU DON’T HAVE TO BE ABLE TO CODE. However, It’s expected you’re the rare unicorn that is both technically very strong but also very good at communications, user experience and understands the business side of things. What are we doing: Since we launched Likvido in April 2018, we’ve absolutely nailed it. Not only do we now have 1.000+ customers - among many of the hottest startups and scaleups in Denmark - we also managed to get very serious funding, have very good unit economics and built a really cool technical platform. However, we’re just getting started. So what are we doing? We are solving the biggest reason for companies going bankrupt in Europe. You see, 19 % of all invoices are paid late, and roughly half of all bankruptcies are caused by lack of cash. Likvido is defining a new category we’re calling a “customer payment system”. Today you integrate Likvido with your accounting system, and then we automate sending out invoices, send our reminders, start debt collection and post back to the accounting system. Looking ahead, we will add financial products, give the whole organization access to our system and much more. In brief, we help companies get paid - on time - and forecast their cash flow. # Responsibilities Your job responsibilities will be: - To maintain a high product quality, through both lots of testing of new features & continuously improve everything we have live - Ensure great performance by metrics such as: errors in logs, fast page-load, check request amounts - Release management and making sure new code goes live (without problems) - Help our CTO specify new tasks to our development team, and verify specification makes sense on all new tasks - Help our development team with questions on features - Be responsible for our internal IT support email To make it concrete, during an average day, you could expect to do some of the following: - Testing a new feature made by a developer, and giving structured feedback (in Github) - Checking website speed and amount of requests (in Azure) - Testing a new release is ready to be rolled into production and then pulling the “release trigger!” (in Azure Devops) - Reply to support tickets from our internal support department (in Intercom), and realize we have a bug, that you specify a solution for our development team (in Github) - Help developers with questions about tasks (in Slack) - Get a few hours to come up with some examples of how a new type of page could look (concept development) # Requirements We’re very open to your background, but the following is important to have in mind: - Fluent in English - Some kind of formal education in business, economy, communication, IT or marketing is required - You’re very detail oriented and structured - You’re IT-savvy. You should be able to: 1) download development programs & run applications from your computer 2) be open to learn SQL / databases if you don’t know it 3) use many different systems - You have a Windows computer or are OK with installing Bootcamp and running Windows when you work. Parallels is not good enough A big part of the job is providing feedback to our developers by testing and speccing. It’s also extremely important that you’re able to quickly understand what we do, so you can help us improve the product. It’s a huge plus if you’ve worked with SaaS (software-as-a-service) before, or has worked in accounting systems. It’s also worth noting that we’re a startup with big ambitions. This also come with big expectations. We don’t expect you to work crazy Silicon Valley hours, but you should also expect to work significantly more than 40 hours per work. #Location - Worldwide

items.content:
*This is a remote job! Work from anywhere!Mission
To reinforce our commitment to customers' privacy and security, for its PaaS solution, Platform.sh is looking for a Security Operations Manager with a taste for Python and Go, excellent Linux system understanding, outstanding written English skills, experience working on PCI and/or SOC compliance, line management experience, and a real hunger for the challenges of building compliant distributed systems. If you're looking for an exciting, high-growth opportunity with an award-winning, cutting-edge company, this could be the job for you.We are targeting managers that can function in a high performing, multithreaded environment. Management duties are expected to be about 25% of your time with the remaining 75% being hands on technical work.
Security, privacy, and compliance controls are at the heart of what we do as our mission is to simplify the cloud. The job is to transform what is often regarded as red-tape and constraints to a well-oiled machine where everything is automated and where every constraint becomes a feature making the product better.
This position reports directly to our Data Protection Officer, and in close interaction with our Chief Product Officer, CTO, VP of Infrastructure, and our Engineering and Customer Support teams. In a given day you might be:
Acting as a technical liaison between the Security & Compliance department and our product, engineering, and operations staff.Creating documentation and processes in English to help satisfy compliance requirements.Evaluating, deploying, and creating, systems and tools that will enhance our support and operations efficiency.Supporting our data protection officer and compliance team with information requests, pen testing, disaster recovery, and related activities.Executing our security incident management process.Working with appropriate teams to deploy and operate security tools and solutions.Ensuring all systems, security applications, and services in environment are securely configured and managed through operating system appropriate security platforms and tools.Ensuring optimal operation of all security solutions and tools.Management of the Security Team plan and report activity of the teamdefine roles in the teams and communicate to other teamscreate and maintain processes on the team and communicate to other teamshire and on-board new staff team training and developmentevaluate team's performanceplan skills requirements in the teamreport on team performance, set up action plans when necessary

Qualifications:Minimum Qualifications
Excellent written English skills4+ years of line management experienceCISSP, CISM, Security+, GCED, GICSP, GCIH, SSCP, or CASP Certification or similarExperience with Linux (preferably Debian-based)Familiar with markdownExperience implementing PCI, SOC, or relatedOperate largely independently (go take that hill) with management supportJuggle several requests at the same timeProven successful experience in an operations roleExposure to cloud services (AWS in particular)Understands how an OS works, knows networking, how git works, and the constraints of a distributed systemProficient in Python or GolangExperience with containerization technologies (LXC/LXD, Docker)Has an understanding ofPatch and Vulnerability Management processPrinciple of Least PrivilegeIncident responseIdentity and Access ManagementIPTABLESWAFs
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with vendor managementExperience with PuppetDemonstrated the ability to successfully manage cloud-based infrastructure for a fast growing organizationKnowledge of Magento Ecommerce, Symfony, Drupal, eZ Platform, or Typo3Relational database skillsPublic speaking experienceAbility to speak French or German a plusAbility to kick ass in Chess or beat Zork without using a mapCan bravely take on new challenges like a Gryffindor, analyzes problems like Ravenclaw, protects our infrastructure and client data like a Slytherin, and talks with clients like a Hufflepuff.
Sound Like a Good Fit? We'd love to talk to you!
* This is a remote job. About Platform.sh
Platform.sh is an idea-to-cloud application platform that simplifies cloud infrastructures. We give developers the tools they need to experiment, innovate, get rapid feedback, and deliver better-quality features with speed and confidence thanks to our unique rapid cloning technology.
Platform.sh serves thousands of customers worldwide including The Financial Times, Gap, Magento Commerce, Adobe, Orange, Hachette, Ikea, Stanford University, Harvard University, The British Council, and Lufthansa.
We want people who are passionate, open, multicultural, friendly, humble, and smart to join us and help this fast-growing, award-winning company to revolutionize the tech industry.

items.content:
Director of Development (100% Remote)

Tremendous opportunity for a Director or Manager of Development/Engineering to join a growing technology company.

You will provide technical leadership and management, manage and drive the development of the next generation platform (from the planning stage through production), prototype new ideas and make individual code contributions when necessary, collaborate within and across cross-functional teams, continue to develop and improve delivery processes, mentor and help engineers grow and develop in their careers and professional skills, deliver projects against technical roadmap, and create a culture that encourages open communication, accountability, creativity, and innovation.

The focus of this job is technical leadership and management, however, you must be able to participate in architecture discussions and some prototyping but not hard core coding.

This is a direct hire position where you can work 100% remote from your home and live anywhere. Awesome opportunity to make an impact at a growing technology company.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

  • 2+ years as a Senior Manager or Director of Development/Engineering
  • Experience with Python and Django web applications
  • 7+ years experience shipping high-quality, scalable, customer-centric web applications
  • 2+ years experience developing and supporting SaaS/Web applications in the cloud for a software/technology company
  • Strong experience with AWS or Google Cloud
  • Experience with building messaging, event-driven architectures
  • Strong understanding of domain driven design
  • Microservices patterns and architectures
  • Experience working for a startup or small company
  • Ability to thrive in a fast paced environment
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • No heavy contract backgrounds or job hoppers

PREFERRED SKILLS:

  • Mobile applications
  • RDS, DynamoDB, ElastiCache, Lambda, Step Functions, API Gateway CloudFormation, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, S3

items.title: vidIQ: Senior Delivery Manager
items.content:
Senior Delivery Manager

We’re looking for a Senior Delivery Manager who will organize and coordinate product launches across an entirely remote team. You will bring focus and set clear priorities across all areas of the product including our web-suite, browser extension and mobile apps. 
 
As a fully remote company you will be managing teams across multiple time zones, and coordinating projects in a way which maximises the benefits of being a remote team. 
 
Who you’ll be working with
We’re a creator obsessed company and have several highly experienced YouTube creators on our team. You’ll be working closely with our growing product and engineering teams (currently around 18 team members) in shipping value to our millions of users. 
As well as working with individual contributors on the team, you’ll also be working with team leads who’ll be on hand to help with planning and getting the most out of our team.


What we’re looking for in a Senior Delivery Manager
We’re looking for someone who can bring our teams together in focusing on achieving common goals. This will include making trade-offs on prioritising which projects to take on with the resources we have, working with the engineering team to fine tune their work estimates and facilitating cross-team communication and collaboration.
 
Outline of the role responsibilities:
  • Ensuring we’re shipping on time and on a regular basis
  • Maintaining a high quality standards in what we ship
  • Learning and iterating on how we build products
  • Lead the collaborative effort of sprint planning and project prioritization
  • Facilitating stand-ups and planning sessions in our 4 week sprint cycles
  • Work with team leaders in managing requirements, dependencies and risks when scoping projects
  • Empowering the team to do high quality work within set timescales
  • Create strong lines of communication and collaboration across multiple teams over the entire product development lifecycle,­ from requirements gathering to release and rollout education
A bit more about what we’re working on
We help YouTube creators through a suite of products that are designed to help millions of creators leverage data-driven insights to grow their audiences and optimize their content online.
 
We have a ton of new features on our roadmap and we’re excited to bring someone on-board who can help us ship the value we have in our roadmap to users faster. 

What would make you a great fit…


Your qualities
  • You thrive on being organized
  • You’re calm under pressure
  • You have excellent communication skills
  • You’re able to motivate and get the best out of people
  • You’re self motivated and have a strong desire to make an impact
  • You’re able to use data to make better decisions
Your experience
  • You have 3+ years experience in a similar role
  • You have experience in working with dozens of engineers across multiple time-zones
  • You’re comfortable working with Asana
  • You have experience in working with both small and large teams and understand what it takes to build a growing tech company.

Benefits of working at vidIQ
  • Competitive salary with potential team profit sharing when we hit our targets
  • Remote flexible working environment
  • Annual team retreat - our last retreat was in Lisbon, Portugal
    (we ensure we have a good balance of fun and working on the big picture together)
  • Excellent career growth opportunities in a fast paced environment

items.title: Branch Manager
items.content:
Branch Manager at Carlson Wagonlit Travel - CWT

Remote

Carlson Wagonlit Travel SatoTravel (CWTSatoTravel) is seeking an experienced and talented Branch Manager for our Emergency Services Center a 24/7 operation.

As a Branch Manager, your mission will be to “Deliver the Perfect Trip” in order to sustain optimum results for our clients and for CWTSatoTravel.

As the U.S. military and government division of Carlson Wagonlit Travel(CWT), CWTSatoTravel is a global leader specializing in seamless travel management services to our U.S. federal clients. We employ a team of more than 900 associates throughout 187 locations in 14 countries and U.S. territories. Though our offices are spread across the world, we are a tight-knit group with access to resources and innovations that enable us to deliver the best services in the industry.

We are very proud of our 65+ year history serving U.S. military and government clients, and are always looking for new talent to help us grow as a team. Our most valuable asset as a company is the quality of our people. We are a growing family, and encourage you to check out our career opportunities and start your journey with CWTSatoTravel today.

Operational/Communication:

  • Works with manager to monitor expenses and control costs to ensure a profitable operation.
  • Performs all necessary supervisory functions to effectively and efficiently manage their areas of responsibility:
    • Maintains a qualified staff.
    • Communicates areas of accountability and performance expected of assigned staff.
    • Determines standards of performance as a basis to review progress of assigned staff.
    • Recommends transfers, promotions, and dismissals.
    • Ensures proper training of assigned staff.
    • Fosters a cooperative and harmonious working climate conducive to maximum employee morale and productivity.
    • Develops individuals for future advancement.
  • Reviews telephone statistics ensuring company standards are met and realigns staffing levels as appropriate.
  • Assists manager/program management with follow-up on customer service issues.
  • Keeps management promptly and fully informed of all matters of significance and proactively takes prompt corrective action where necessary or suggests alternative courses of action which may be taken.
  • Manages a profitable operation through the supervision of staff that ensures company procedures, guidelines and standards are followed in all job functions by assigning the operational work flow at each location (i.e. customer service, ticketing, productivity, attendance, accuracy of work, invoicing, etc.)
  • Assists staff with problems that arise.
  • Works closely with CWT Program Management to ensure that each account is serviced as required in the contract. Handles complaints and answers inquiries timely.
  • Responsible for ensuring all staff are fully trained on CWT standards, new enhancements and products. Training includes continued orientation to ensure that they are well-prepared, well-informed, and fully qualified to fulfill the requirements of their position. Works on service coaching and continuing to improve levels of service from the counselor(s). Prepares subordinates, demonstrating advancement potential, for promotion into leadership positions. May utilize CWT training and vendor training, if necessary.
  • Reviews telephone statistics ensuring company standards are met and realign staffing levels as appropriate, including scheduling time off and requests for additions and replacements to staff. Ensures that part-time/flex-time employees are utilized effectively to meet operational needs.
  • Assists manager with follow-up on company comment cards or other client input vehicles either in writing or by dealing directly with client to resolve any service problems. Identifies trends of locations and/or employees with ongoing issues.
  • Analyzes monthly profit and loss statement reviewing for accuracy, changes and improvements. As appropriate, creates SMART action plans to correct problems identified as a result of this analysis.

Leadership:

  • May represent staff at client meetings and develop relationship with client to promote better service.
  • Acts on behalf of manager when manager is absent, in carrying through company procedures and standards.
  • Keeps manager promptly and fully informed of all matters of significance and takes prompt corrective action where necessary or suggests alternative courses of action which may be taken. Identifies root cause of the issue and communicate changes to ensure problem is resolved.
  • Performs all duties and responsibilities in a timely and effective manner in accordance with established company policies to achieve the overall objectives of the position.
  • Performs other duties and responsibilities as required or requested.

Qualifications

Demonstrated ability to:

  • Act as role model
  • Review and monitor information to identify patterns and opportunities for improvement.
  • Develop and maintain respectful, collaborative relationships and effective teams.
  • Work resourcefully and model resiliency in the face of shifting priorities and demands, champion new ideas, and encourage new ways of looking at problems, processes and solutions to improve results.
  • Comfortable working in an ambiguous, rapidly changing environment.
  • 1-3 years in travel management.

Primary Location: United States

Work from home: Yes

Employment type: Standard

Job Family: Travel Operations

Scope: Regional

Travel: No

Shift: Day Job

Organization: Customer_Military & Government

Experience Level: 1 to 3 year

As an Equal Opportunity Employer/Affirmative Action employer, the organization will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant’s race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other federal, state or local protected class

Apply for job

items.title: Internal Communications and Director of Culture
items.content:
Internal Communications and Director of Culture at Auth0

Remote | International
  • Location: Remote – North America

Auth0 s mission is to help developers innovate faster. Every company is becoming a software company and developers are at the center of this shift. They need better tools and building blocks so they can stay focused on innovating. One of these building blocks is identity: authentication and authorization. That s what we do. Our platform handles 2.5B logins per month for thousands of customers around the world. From indie makers to Fortune 500 companies, we can handle any use case. We like to think that we are helping make the internet safer.

We have raised $210M to date and are growing quickly. Our team is spread across more than 35 countries and we are proud to continually be recognized as a great place to work. Culture is critical to us, and we are transparent about our vision and principles.

Join us on this journey to make developers more productive while making the internet safer!

Auth0 is a pre-IPO unicorn. We are growing rapidly and looking for a Change Communications expert to create and lead the Employee Experience that will take us to the next level. One team, one score.

We never compromise on identity. You should never compromise yours either. We want you to bring your whole self to Auth0. If you re passionate, practice radical transparency to build trust and respect, and thrive when you re collaborating, experimenting and learning this may be your ideal work environment.

We are looking for an entrepreneurial Communications and Change Management expert to build and/or partner on WE ARE AUTH0 programs, including:

  • Employee communications
  • Change management
  • Employer and internal employee brand
  • Employee experiences and our yearly offsite
  • Diversity, equity and inclusion programs

Our ideal candidate will have:

  • Bachelors or Masters Degree in Human Resources or related degree.
  • 15 + years experience in the Human Resources field with prior experience in a Director level role.
  • Exceptional writing, language and communication skills.

We hold ourselves to the highest standards. We give a shit it shows up in how we have fun at work. We care intensely about what we do and we embrace challenges tenaciously. We don t give up.

We are clear on our mission. If your heart beats faster when you read this, we invite you to join us on our journey. And tell us: What s your mission? Where do you feel at home?

Apply for job

items.title: Head of Finance
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Head of Finance at Shield GEO

Remote | International
  • Remote Worldwide
  • Full-Time
  • Finance

Category: Accounting & Finance
Job Type: Full-Time
Job Desc:

Head of Finance

Are you passionate about international business, looking for flexibility and creative freedom?

Then come and lead our finance team! We are looking for a team-oriented, resourceful and self-motivated person to make an impact in a young, growing company.

Job Purpose: Head of Finance

Shield GEO provides outsourced employment and payroll for hundreds of employees in over 60 countries. Our Finance team is the engine that makes sure all our GEO employees get paid on time every month. The team collaborates closely with colleagues in Global Mobility, Subject Matter Experts and Implementation to ensure our clients have a great experience.

This is a broad reaching role as you’ll be responsible for the smooth operation and ongoing improvement of our three functions within finance. Our Operational team create invoices, process payments and generate payslips. Our SME team resolve issues and answer questions about international tax, payroll and finance. They also setup new GEO employees and process termination payrolls. And our Reporting team handle our internal payroll, company administration and reporting.

You’ll report directly to the company founders and be a key contributor to our leadership team. You’ll have plenty of support from your team leads, the operational and project teams, our systems and our technology platform. All employees at Shield have flexibility about when and where they work. Most of us choose to work remotely with flexible hours.

Working with Shield

If you are excited by the thought of playing an active role in a company that provides opportunities to create and innovate, you’re at the right place.

We’re a remote-friendly company with employees all around the world. We don’t want to be limited by location and are open to hiring anyone from anywhere as long as it’s a great fit for us and you. Before we get to know you, we’d like to give you a sense of who we are and what is important to us. We hope this helps you decide if you want to be a part of Shield GEO.

Every person is unique. At Shield GEO, we encourage an inclusive culture that embraces each individual’s differences. We believe that diversity of thought and experience is vital to generating creative ideas, developing effective strategies and making better decisions.

When hiring we do not discriminate by any unlawful means including, but not limited to, race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.
We offer reasonable accommodations for people with disabilities wherever possible. Our employees are provided with the basic equipment required to give them a comfortable, safe and productive workplace. If you require additional equipment beyond our standard offering we are happy to work with you to try to find a solution.

We can’t quite show you what it’s like to work with us but you can hear from our employees themselves. Here’re some articles written by our Co-Founder, Customer Success Manager and Digital Marketing Manager.

  • Working remotely and flexibly with Shield Geo
  • Leave policy
  • Work equipment policy
  • Workplace Diversity policy

Do you share our values?

Our 4 values are integral to who we are. Our company culture is constantly evolving, every person who joins us adds something unique to our culture. But our values are shared by all Shield GEO employees. Do these values resonate with you?

Grow

We believe that personal growth and company growth go hand in hand. We look to foster our own growth and help grow the company. Every day is an opportunity to face a new challenge and get a little better. In our world of international employment it is impossible to know all the answers. Instead of trying to know everything, we focus on knowing how to solve problems. When mistakes happen we know it’s all part of the learning curve and we seek feedback to help us improve. We keep an eye on the big picture so we can identify improvements to processes and systems. As the problems become larger and more complex, it means that we’ll need more flexible and agile minds to come up with solutions.

Own It

We are self-motivated and love to see tasks to completion. Our managers and team mates are often in different time zones, and that’s ok! We aren’t afraid to step up when things get a little tough. We don’t like to micro-manage or be micromanaged. We trust our team mates to carry out their part of the process. We are responsible for our own workload and making sure we get our most important things done each day. If we get stuck we proactively seek help. And we show our reliability and accountability by keeping our systems updated. This also means our results can speak for themselves.

Do The Right Thing

Our clients trust us with compliance on their most important asset – their employees. This is a big responsibility! Doing the right thing means often times we choose a harder path and see it through to the end. It means we are open with our colleagues, clients and suppliers about bad news just the same as we share good news. And sometimes doing the right thing means we have to make decisions that will upset the very person we are trying to help. It’s a high standard but we stand by this very strongly. Doing the right thing also means considering how our actions impact those around us.

Be Human

We are a service business and helping people is at the core of everything we do. We pride ourselves on how we interact with colleagues, service providers and clients. We recognize that in all areas we’re dealing with real humans.

We know that working remotely and dealing with such a mix of people around the world is challenging. We know that if we are having trouble understanding someone, they are also struggling to understand us. Empathy is fundamental to helping us discover what people mean and how they are feeling. To avoid misinterpretation we assume best intent in others.

Because so much of our communication is written and asynchronous, we default to over-communication. This means we give extra details because we don’t leave people guessing. We make sure our words are clear and easy to understand. And we are kind to our fellow humans.

Your Background

  • More than five years experience within Finance
  • More than five years experience in a leadership role
  • International tax or payroll experience required. You must be very familiar with concepts related to the employment and payroll of workers in multiple countries like; employer social security; foreign exchange; gross ups; and expense reimbursements.
  • Specific experience of employment and payroll in any of the following countries is an advantage; Australia; Canada; India; Singapore; UK; and USA.
  • Comfortable with technology. We are mostly remote and we rely on a bunch of applications and communication protocols to keep connected. That means video conferences and voice calls (Zoom), chat and messaging (Slack, Skype and Salesforce Chatter), shared documents (Dropbox). You’ll likely be working by yourself during parts of your day without access to tech support.
  • Experience with Salesforce or Xero is helpful but not essential.

Essential Characteristics of this role

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to absorb information quickly. Because we are distributed across 9+ time zones and often working asynchronously clear and detailed written communication is particularly important.
  • Able to prioritize effectively and work autonomously while coordinating with an international team.
  • Able to both create and improve processes and workflows as well as coach your team on the same.
  • Exceptional attention to detail.
  • Ideally located between UTC+3 and UTC+8 time zones
  • Some flexibility in working hours. We discourage overtime work and you will only be expected to work a standard number of hours each week. But we have clients and colleagues all over the world so sometimes you will need to be on calls in the morning or evening.

Responsibilities

Finance

  • Ensure Shield GEO finance delivers a reliable, efficient and customer focused service.
  • Line management of the 3 finance team leads.
  • Encourage growth for finance team members.
  • Setting the direction for the teams and supporting their ongoing progress.
  • Agreeing and taking ownership of financial growth goals. This will be done in conjunction with the company owners and the leadership team.
  • Build and maintain collaborative working relationships with our leadership team and other colleagues.
  • Act as a point of escalation for finance team leads.
  • Encourage the finance team to represent Shield GEO’s values in their day to day work.
  • Other ad-hoc duties

Operational

  • Support Operational team lead in the creation of hundreds of invoices and payslips each month
  • Prepare the team, processes and systems for growth as we continue to scale
  • Work with the operational team and our technology team to introduce automation and process improvements

SME

  • Support our Subject Matter Expert team in resolving the hundreds of cases raised by our Clients, GEO Employees and Service Providers each month
  • Assist in resolving escalated issues
  • Work with SME team and other departments to identify ways to reduce volume of issues and improve issue resolution times.
  • Identify and develop future Subject Matter Experts within other finance teams.

Reporting

  • Support our Reporting team in creating monthly profit reporting, audit, tax filing, , internal payroll, insurance and compliance for 3+ corporate entities with more to come
  • Include financial goals in reporting and track progress
  • Work with Reporting team to analyse historical performance and identify trends
  • Jointly identify opportunities to improve reporting processes and introduce automation

Next Steps

If you like what you’re read so far, this is a fantastic opportunity to join a global team committed to service. We’d really like to hear from you! Please submit a cover letter of under 250 words and include the achievement you’re most proud of.

Apply for job

items.content:
Job Description:

This Sr. Director - Information Security role has the ability to work remote from anywhere in the US. We would PREFER this candidate should also have some kind of security or audit certification, but not required, such as CISSP, CCSP, CISA, CISM, CIPP/US, etc. Looking for: ? Hands on engineer with scripting/coding experience ? Thought leadership for automating numerous Info Sec processes, then take a hands on role in leading the transformation to automate; ? Candidates should list programming languages and coding skills ? Have an app dev background. ? The engineering experience is more important, as we can help build out the Info Sec expertise. ? This is a Director level role, but also involves hands-on work as a high level Engineer. This position is the technical leader for a business unit or an operational area within the company. This individual should be a visible leader both internal and external to Magellan. Will be included in evaluating potential mergers and acquisitions and help drive Magellan to become a global leader in using technology to deliver better outcomes to our members. Is a technologist, a think tank and visionary in the scope of the portfolio managed by assigned department. Understands strategy of other business units and exchanges best practices with the counterparts. * Influences changes and system enhancements to business processes, policies, and infrastructure to deliver the most effective IT services. * Manages the selection, evaluation, contracting and integration of externally available hardware, software, and processes to deliver business solutions. * Directs and manages, through analysis, the planning, design, development, testing, installation and maintenance of support systems for both internal/external clients. * Selects and builds strong teams through formal training, diverse assignments, coaching, mentoring, and other team development techniques, along with regular individual and group meetings. * Develops tactical and strategic plans to satisfy technical business needs and new business proposals. * Manages and develops project cost estimates, benefits, justification and assessment of potential project risks. * Manages projects, staff, customer expectations and business priorities to achieve customer and business unit satisfaction. * Manages, plans and tracks all budgets and expenses. * Oversees vendor relationships and projects. * Directs and manages business process re-engineering associated with existing, developing and implementation of systems. * Develops and maintains strong, cooperative relationships with other IT services groups. Shares and establishes best practices experiences and opportunities throughout the organization. * Applies Agile development practices in delivery of transformational programs as required. General Job Information Title Senior Director, Information Security (REMOTE) Grade 32 Job Family Info Technology Group Country United States of America FLSA Status United States of America (Exempt) Recruiting Start Date 6/17/2019 Date Requisition Created 5/31/2019 Work Experience IT Education Bachelors: Information Security (Required) License and Certifications - Required License and Certifications - Preferred Other Job Requirements Responsibilities * 12+ years of relevant experience deploying and/or administrating infrastructure solutions. Requires strong knowledge and experience with multiple infrastructure solutions. * 2 or more certifications of the following: AWS Sysops Certification, MTA, MSCA, Cisco-CCNA, CCNP, Database Administration (Oracle, SQL Server, Big Data/Hadoop), Avaya (ACA, ACSS, ASIC, ACE), AWS Solutions Architect Associate Certification, ITIL v3 Foundations, Kepner-Tregoe Resolve or Agile and Design Thinking (Coursera). * Critical thinker. * Demonstrated problem solving techniques. * Strong verbal and written communication skills. * Ability to coach and build skills within the team. * Experience in health care, insurance or related field. Magellan Health Services is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Tobacco-free workplace. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled. Every employee must understand, comply and attest to the security responsibilities and security controls unique to their position.

items.title: Finance Director
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Founded in 2016 by food-lovers and serial entrepreneurs JP and Alex, allplants is an award-winning planet-positive food brand and VC-backed B-Corp with around 65 employees on a mission to build Earth’s most forward-thinking food company, operating out of Seven Sisters, London.


We’re passionate about inspiring a more plant-based future. The way we eat has an enormous impact on our health and the health of our planet. So we keep it delicious while creating an exciting balance of healthy, convenient, more sustainable food choices. That takes teamwork, empathy, smarts, creativity, confidence and boundless positive energy.


Today allplants’ range of chef-prepared meals are imaginatively tasty and nutritionally balanced with 100% natural plant-based ingredients - from our creamy Cashew Mac to our rich and spicy Jerk Jackfruit -  every dish is handmade with love. Eating plants is the most impactful way to reduce your environmental footprint, so our mission is to inspire the next billion plant-powered people, using flavour and convenience. We’ve already served over 750,000 meals to homes all over the UK, subscribing for an easier way to enjoy plant-based living. 


Our plans for 2019 and beyond are bold, delicious and daring - with big growth plans involving both new products and new markets. To achieve our growth ambition of inspiring the next billion plant-powered people we are expanding our teams at pace, whilst also putting in place the foundations of a deeply mission-driven and customer-led culture.



the role.


This is a brand new high-impact, high-visibility role in the team. As our new CFO/FD you’ll be the most senior member of our Finance team as we grow; working collaboratively and cross-functionally at all levels to make sure Finance is a value-add function that supports the wider business and provides us with a platform for further growth. We’re looking for someone with the right mix of accounting expertise and an open mind to find new and innovative ways to increase financial efficiency, who has demonstrable experience working in start-up and scale-up businesses, and relishes building and scaling. 


You will be an integral part of the senior leadership team, helping to lead a culture of attention to economics, and will help architect and grow the Finance function from a base level - across bookkeeping, payments, reconciliations, controls, systems, reporting, people, processes and relevant BI. You’ll also own, plan and execute our financial strategy, ensuring that all financial operations are in line with overall business objectives.


We hope you’d step in and quickly take full ownership of all day-to-day accounting, you will also drive monthly management accounts and financial reporting, as well as managing ad-hoc finance projects and working cross-functionally to improve our overall operational/financial performance and cash flow.


Due to the projected growth of the business, a lot of the role will require agility to jump between delivering continuous growth of the finance function, implementing robust tools & processes to futureproof the business for scale-up, whilst also working closely with the CEO and leadership team to drive fundraising activities including regular reporting and presenting to the Board and investors on plans and progress. This encompasses a hands-on approach to leadership, while also zooming out to steer strategic direction and coach your team.


The role reports into, and will work daily with, the Founder-CEO Jonathan Petrides (JP). This is a pivotal role at the core of our executive team (alongside Food Production, Marketing, Operations, Creative, and People) and interfacing with the Board. The role will be a key player in our team’s mentorship and hierarchy, so we plan to find a seasoned leader to inspire world-class teams which exist in all our functions.



what you’ll do.


The scope & main responsibilities of this role are detailed below. This isn’t fully exhaustive but covers the main elements of first 6-12 months.

Key responsibilities.



















  • Strategy




  • Craft and lead the finance strategy for allplants; designing, owning and streamlining the execution of process, budgets and governance into the organisation

  • Oversee the commercial health of the business; continuously monitoring and developing allplants’ financial performance, managing and coordinating actions plans accordingly and where required



 



  • Function and Operations Building




  • Lead on configuring and implementing core financial systems for success and scale

  • Shape and grow Finance function: hiring a lean high performing execution team

  • Manage financial forecasting and budgets; extracting structured data; feeding it back to the rest of the organisation and into continuous forecasting process




  •  Fundraising and Board




  • Evaluate and report on all fundraising plans and activity, communicating and driving monthly financial and performance reporting to our Board, investors and advisors

  • Drive a robust financing strategy for a breadth of aggressive growth and performance scenarios; expect to utilise all available equity, debt and other creative asset classes while ramping our business’ ability to drive bold pursuit of market-leadership and expansion




what you’ll need.


We’re open-minded and believe smart driven people can learn fast, you’ll be a great fit here if you are:


  • Leader and strategist. Experienced in planning and executing equity, debt, grant and other fundraising activities, and comfortable presenting business plans to investors.

  • Coach/player. You’ll be as comfortable leading a small team, showing them what best-in-class finance team looks like, while leaning in when they need hands-on support.

  • Hyper organised. Experienced in high paced environments, with confidence and ability to independently prioritise, plan and coordinate people/processes to ensure seamless execution.

  • Analytically sharp. Highly data-driven with a focus on architecting a strategy built bottom-up with business partners. Excel/Sheets for financial modelling and reporting is second nature.

  • Habitual problem solver. Track record of continuous process improvement - e.g. implementing systems, processes and automation to improve accuracy and speed of reporting.

  • Rapid adaptable learner. Takes feedback well, is highly self-aware and personable. Willing to dig-in, research and learn a way around any challenge autonomously.

  • Proactive doer. embodies proactivity, with a can-do attitude, will go the extra mile(s) when needed, and has solid project management skills. 

  • Applied accounting and finance specialist. Qualified (ACA or CIMA/ACCA equivalent) with +10 years at in-house finance team. Intimately familiar with cloud-based accounting software, ERPs etc.

  • Excellent communicator. You are equally good at listening as explaining to / convincing others.

  • You. Sense of humour with high energy and passion for the plant-powered future we’re building.



our offer.



  • Be part of a fast growing organisation built to shape the future of food

  • Collaborative, flexible and friendly environment

  • Competitive salary, 24 days holiday, pension plan and stock options from day one

  • Career development plan & personal training budget

  • Healthy lunches, breakfast and snacks, and lots of allplants tastings (!)

  • Be part of a business with purpose, using commercial growth to better serve people & planet

  • Join an energetic, passionate team of mission-driven people who’ll stretch and challenge you


 


a fair chance


Every role in the allplants team is open to applications from all sections of society. We believe in the superpowers and potential of everyone; regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic origin, different physical ability, family structure, socio-economics, age, nationality or citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other difference that makes you, well, you.More than just encouraging your application, we're committed to conscious inclusion that (we hope) cultivates an ethos of belonging, connection and shared purpose. It’s this philosophy that drove us to contribute to a better world through our allplants purpose and mission, and we open our doors to everyone who shares our motivations.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Scrum Master

Company: SafeBoda
Location: Kampala, UG
Level: Intermediate
Language: English
Product/Project Management
Skills:
  • Agile Methodologies
  • Scrum

    • Intro

    SafeBoda is a rapidly growing consumer platform that is revolutionizing transportation, payments and on-demand services in Africa. SafeBoda has built a large motorcycle-taxi  (commonly known as the boda boda in East Africa) community that is bringing safety, trust and professionalization to an informal industry that is vital to the livelihoods of millions of drivers and passengers across the rapidly growing cities of East and West Africa. 

    Based in Kampala, Nairobi, Lagos and Barcelona, we are a company that is already having huge impact for millions in East Africa. In November 2018, SafeBoda was announced among the 2018 AppsAfrica award winners at an event held in Cape Town and we beat four startups from Nigeria and South Africa to become the Best African App. 

    What you will do

    • Guide the creation of scope and detailed requirements for projects, including facilitating requirements gathering sessions with key stakeholders, ensuring requirements are documented, and managing the requirements through the life of the project.
    • Serve as a dedicated team member with the primary responsibility to support the team and successfully achieve daily iteration, release goals, and delivery objectives.
    • Implement and enforce Scrum principles and practices, facilitate continuous improvement (CI), and identify and remove team impediments.
    • Facilitate the team for better creativity and improve the efficiency of the development team.
    • Continuously facilitate a team dynamic intended to maximize performance and continuously improve agile practices.
    • Responsible to remove the impediments for the scrum team.
    • Support the Product Owner with documentation of User Stories and Acceptance criteria and making the product backlogs in good shape and ready for the next sprint.
    • Arranged daily stand-up meetings, facilitate meetings, schedule meetings, demo and decision-making processes in order to ensure quick inspection and proper use of adaptation process.
    • Responsible to Conduct retrospective meetings.
    • Acts as safeguard for the team.
    • Actively participate in driving continuous improvement of the organization's project management processes and standards.

    Every person on our team:

    • Has fun and is passionate about their work
    • Plays a critical role in the company's success
    • Is willing to pitch in and do whatever is needed
    • Cares about their co-workers and our customers - drivers & passengers 

    Work philosophy

        • Get stuff done - flexible work hours
          Sometimes and in some roles you’ll need to be in the office, however, it’s about getting the work done. We’re pretty flexible when it comes to managing workload and time. It’s about delivery!
        • Mental hydration
          The only way to stay sharp in the office is to make sure you leave it from time to time. Go for a stroll, pump some iron, play some Fifa. No-one will judge you or look over your shoulder.
        • Vacation - up to you!
          Creativity feeds on outside stimulation, not staring at the same four walls day in, day out. That’s why we offer a generous holiday allowance. You can freely pick when to do your vacation.
        • Grow yourself - we can help this
          At SafeBoda, learning is a habit. It happens every day on the job, from our successes and our failures. 
          We empower people and we want you to grow with us. Tell us the areas you wish to improve and if it makes sense for the business, we’ll do what we can to help you do just that.
        • Casual dress code

    Main requirements

    • Certified Scrum Master (CSM / PSM)
    • 2+ Years of Agile experience (User Stories, Continuous Integration, ATDD, TDD, Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing, Agile Games)
    • Experience facilitating, preparing, and leading agile process events including agile planning, demo / sprint review, and collaborative design sessions; experience prioritizing tasks and mitigating road blocks.
    • Experience with JIRA and Confluence project management software
    • Excellent communication skills
    • Attention to detail, fast learner
    • Enthusiastic and self-confident
    • Ability to keep up in a fast-moving environment
    • Strong collaboration skills
    • Strong problem solving and influencing skills
    • Strong coaching skills 

    Nice to have

    • Experience working with remote teamsg
    • Knowledge of other Agile approaches, like: Kanban, Crystal, FDD, XP, etc 

    Perks

      • Flexible work hours - We’re pretty ﬂexible when it comes to managing workload and time. It’s about delivery! You can start from 8h to 9.30h and on Friday leave at 15h!
      • Discovery days - Every 3 Fridays we spend the whole day to hack, read, talk to customers, try a new experience... explore and create what you want to!
      • Vacation - up to you! - You can freely pick when to do your 24 days of vacation
      • Grow yourself  - At SafeBoda, learning is a habit. We empower people and we want you to grow with us. Tell us the areas you wish to improve in and if it makes sense for the business, we’ll do what we can to help you do just that
      • Free water and coffee
      • Be part of a passionate team that is changing the mobility landscape in Africa
      • Opportunity to travel to East Africa and interact with the product and our multi-cultural team
