items.content:
Senior Program Manager at American Institutes for Research

Remote

Job Location: US

Job ID: 11219

Job Location: United States

Category: Project Management

Overview

Do you want to be a part of something innovative and cutting edge? If your answer is yes, then join our team of project managers, designers, and software specialists that are smart, creative and excited about the impact they are making on students’ education around the nation. American Institutes for Research (“AIR”) Assessment provides assessment services and technical assistance to school systems nationwide.

The Senior Program Manager will be located in Washington, D.C. (remote opportunities for industry experienced candidates). Looking to hire Senior Program Managers at varying levels.

Responsibilities

Senior Program Managers assume overall responsibility for managing all aspects of state testing projects at AIR. They must be able to work collaboratively in a fast paced environment; anticipate problems and come up with creative methods of solving them; develop strong, positive, constructive relationships with senior-level state clients and multiple stakeholders; manage project teams; and make sure that quality control procedures are adhered to in order to produce high quality assessments within deadline and budget. They must be able to work in an environment where project requirements often change and evolve, and must be comfortable seeking out information and advice, when necessary. They must be able to conceptualize how all the parts of a complex project fit together and what a change to one part will mean for the other parts. Successful candidates will create a proactive culture in which the efficient creation of high quality products is second nature.

The responsibilities of the Senior Program Manager include:

  • Managing all aspects of complex, large-scale assessment programs in a high security environment often with high-stakes attached
  • Managing the transition of large-scale paper and pencil testing programs to an online, computer-adaptive format while working closely with senior-level clients at the State Department of Education
  • Developing and implementing processes, procedures, and schedules for meeting project deliverables and client needs.
  • Working with state clients to ensure that all plans and schedules are viable, that the state understands their roles and deadlines, and that clear lines of communication are established
  • Chairing and facilitating high-level client and sub-contractor meetings with multiple participants and guiding discussions among multiple stakeholders to reach concrete decisions
  • Developing a master schedule that reflects client needs and team’s work requirements
  • Monitoring schedule, deadlines and deliveries to ensure project commitments are executed on time
  • Communicating schedule and any changes to project staff
  • Working directly with senior level clients to provide solutions to day-to-day operational issues
  • Ensuring scope changes are reflected in contracts, budgets, activities, and schedules
  • Communicating scope and budget changes to team members
  • Managing team leads for item development, technical, reporting, website, software and operations and making sure that each team receives required guidance
  • Keeping AIR senior management informed of any potential risks, potential missed deadlines or budget over-runs
  • Managing subcontractors
  • Monitoring budgets

Qualifications

  • Minimum education: Bachelor degree required, M.B.A., M.A. in relevant field, or the equivalent preferred
  • Minimum of 5 years, but prefer 10 years plus, of progressively increasing responsibility managing tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment
  • Experience working directly with senior-level clients
  • Must have experience working in large-scale assessment
  • PMP certification preferred
  • Experience working with on-line, secure delivery systems a plus

AIR Assessment is one of America’s leading K -12 educational assessment entities, currently holding prime contracts for educational testing and scoring in many states. AIR Assessment is a national leader in computer based adaptive assessments; a market that is rapidly growing. We focus on providing our clients with customized assessments that not only measure student achievement against state standards, but also provide meaningful score reports that can help students, parents, and educators address any areas of student weakness. Our environment is fast-paced and requires people at all levels who are willing to roll up their sleeves to get the work done on time while maintaining high quality. As a part of AIR, a not-for-profit organization, we are more than 1,900 people working to improve lives in communities domestically and around the world. Our mission calls for us to turn the best research into practice, which we do in every arena in which we work.

*LI-DG1

Please note, each section of the application is required in order for you to be considered for this opportunity. If you do not complete the required screening questions, or if you close your browser before completing each section of the application, your application will not be submitted for this position.

American Institutes for Research is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to excellence through diversity. Minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and veterans are encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

American Institutes for Research’s commitment to Diversity goes beyond legal compliance to its full integration in our strategy, operations and work environment. Diversity is valued and Inclusion is reflected in all efforts to recruit, develop, and engage the diverse staff needed to accomplish our mission.

Apply for job

items.title: Regional Recruitment Manager
items.content:
Regional Recruitment Manager at Trilogy Education Services

Remote

Location: Remote

The Trilogy/2U global network is 70+ university partners strong and growing. Our business continues to rapidly scale behind the organic growth of existing academic program, the addition of new university partners, as well as the launch of new boot camp courses and innovative academic offerings. There’s never been a more exciting time to join our team!

Summary Of Job:
The Recruiting Manager leads a team of professionals that are responsible for recruiting industry practitioners to teach Trilogy boot camp courses across a regionally based portfolio of university partners. The Recruiting Manager holds accountability for the on-time delivery of candidates to meet Instructional team hiring targets at universities in the assigned Region. In addition to ensuring that open Instructional roles are filled in the assigned Region, the Recruiting Manager is also responsible for ensuring the development of a deep bench of fully qualified talent to meet future hiring goals. The position-holder is a player-coach who can be hands-on recruiting talent for high-profile Instructional positions, while also leading, developing, coaching, and performance managing, the team to develop and implement customer-centric, market-specific recruiting strategies that are tailored to address the needs of each university partner and unique aspects of various geographic markets.

The Recruiting Manager serves as the primary recruiting expert and point-of-contact for both external university contacts as well as internal cross-functional counterparts in the Region (Field Operational Regional Directors, University Relations, etc.). In addition to owning the day-to-day delivery of instructional recruiting operations in the Region, the position will contribute to departmental or cross-functional teams to support new product launches, strategic initiatives, or business process improvement projects.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead a direct team of recruiting professionals to achieve on-time delivery of qualified candidates for Instructional positions in the Region.
  • Participate in annual workforce planning to determine future Instructional Recruiting needs, collaborating with departmental peers as well as cross-functional leaders in Field Operations, University Relations, Product/Curriculum Management, and others.
  • Develop strategic plans to ensure the regional recruiting team’s ability to deliver the annual Instructional hiring goals for each university in the Region.
  • Guide and assist the development and implementation of local market talent engagement strategies to support Instructional staff recruiting for the Region’s university partners, collaborating with Field Operations, Industry Engagement and Strategic partners and others.
  • Participate in improvement projects or other initiatives to support the achievement of departmental and corporate goals.
  • Meet or exceed targets for core recruiting and hiring metrics such as hiring lead time, time to fill, candidate conversion rates, sourcing efficiency, etc.

Education, Skills and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • 3-5 years of professional experience directly related to full-cycle recruitment in a high volume environment.
  • 1-2 years of experience leading direct teams.
  • Strategic thinker who is solutions-oriented and process-driven.
  • Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, high-volume, deadline-driven environment.
  • Proactive, adaptable, flexible, and able to pivot when the business priorities shift.
  • Proficiency with productivity platforms (including Google Suites tools), Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and CRM platforms such as Salesforce and Greenhouse.
  • Proficiency with recruiting and sourcing platforms such as LinkedIn Recruiter, Indeed, ZipRecruiter.

About 2U Inc. (NASDAQ: TWOU)

Eliminating the back row in higher education is not just a metaphor it’s our mission. For more than a decade, 2U, Inc., a global leader in education technology, has been a trusted partner and brand steward of great universities. We build, deliver, and support more than 250 digital and in-person educational offerings, including graduate degrees, professional certificates, Trilogy-powered boot camps, and GetSmarter short courses. Together with our partners, 2U has positively transformed the lives of more than 150,000 students and lifelong learners.

2U Diversity and Inclusion Statement

At 2U, we are committed to creating and sustaining a culture that embodies diverse walks of life, ideas, genders, ages, races, cultures, sexual orientations, abilities and other unique qualities of our employees. We strive to offer a workplace where every employee feels empowered by the ways in which we are different, as well as the ways in which we are the same.

Why It’s Great to Work at 2U

2U offers a high-energy work environment that’s both challenging and fun. We work hard, but our offices are casual and social places. We wear jeans to work and fuel brainstorming sessions with snacks and seltzer.

Benefits

2U offers a comprehensive benefits package:

  • Medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Life insurance, disability and 401(k)
  • Unlimited snacks and drinks
  • Tuition reimbursement program
  • Generous paid leave policies including unlimited PTO for your vacation, personal, or sick days
  • Additional time off benefits include:
    • time off to volunteer for non-profit organizations
    • parental leave after 9 months of employment
    • holidays that include a winter break from Christmas through New Year and more!

Note: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by individuals assigned to this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

Apply for job

items.title: Head of Product at Scrapinghub
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Head of Product

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Manager
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Big Data, Data Science
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Scrapinghub | No office location

Technologies

product-management
product

Job description

Scrapinghub is on pace to grow revenue more than 5x in the next 3 years, with the largest growth coming from our SaaS product business lines. We are seeking our new Head of Product to lead our Product team and define our strategy as we enter this new phase of growth.

Defining process, developing talent, and guiding the growing team through the growth that we are experiencing is just the start. As a member of the leadership team, you will help set overarching business strategy and goals, identify opportunities, and maintain relationships with key stakeholders (internal & external). Ultimately, your responsibility is to ensure the success of Scrapinghub’s products.

This is the role for you if:

  • You’ve done this job before, either in a growth-stage company, or in a team/division experiencing exponential growth
  • You’re eager to take advantage of a rare opportunity to lead a global product team in a category leading technology, with competitive salary and equity participation

Job Responsibilities:

  • You will be responsible for the commercial success of Scrapinghub’s product portfolio:
    • Evaluate opportunities to determine which to pursue and, perhaps equally important, which not to pursue
    • Know the customers better than anyone - using data to understand what they do (SaaS metrics, financial KPIs, usage data & analytics platforms), and talking to them to understand why
    • You will be a key spokesperson for our products internally and externally and you should be comfortable engaging with customers, partners and internal teams.
  • Lead our product culture and spearhead improvements as the Product team grows and Scrapinghub expands:
    • Creating a consistent methodology for iterative product development, to be used across all of Scrapinghub: research, design, development, and delivery
    • Enforcing Lean principles to ensure we are continually shipping & learning from real customers
    • Reinforcing Scrapinghub’s values (Open by Default, Team Players, Ambitious, Customer Centric) via our processes, and making sure we’re living them, as a team, in how we execute
  • It goes without saying, but your role will include all of the standard parts of Product Management not already mentioned above:
    • Own the product roadmaps and work with the leadership team to develop long term product strategy and the Go To Market strategy for the organisation as a whole.
    • Develop strong partnerships with Engineering, Customer Success, Sales, and Marketing to create a well-rounded product offering
    • Deep strategic thinking about our place in the market and how we will continue to differentiate ourselves in fulfilling customers’ web data needs

Requirements:

Education & Experience:

  • 8+ years years experience in managing growing product development teams, ideally within a SaaS product environment. This includes recruitment, talent development, and adapting processes to an expanding team.
  • Strong track record of delivering successful (commercially and otherwise) products
  • Deep experience in the commercial side of product management, with past responsibility for the marketing, sales and full customer lifecycle around your product(s)
  • Experience in building business cases for product investment decisions

The Intangibles:

  • Great people skills: Insight into those you work with, coupled with the tact and humour to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
  • Always persuadable by evidence: You are always open to changing your mind when the evidence dictates. Conversely, you use well structured data to inform your own opinions and persuade others.
  • Technically competent: You are able to quickly learn and understand the technical details of Scrapinghub’s products, and how/why our customers use them. This doesn’t mean that you need a formal software development background, but you will be involved in deeply technical decisions and conversations.
  • A love of talking to customers and an insatiable curiosity to understand how and why they use Scrapinghub’s products.
  • Unwavering focus on results: revenue and growth targets, delivering quality features on-time, great NPS scores, etc - regardless of the metric, you love setting the bar high and driving for results.
  • A great fit with Scrapinghub’s culture
Apply now

About Scrapinghub

Scrapinghub is a fast growing and diverse technology business turning web content into useful data with a cloud-based web crawling platform, off-the-shelf datasets, and turn-key web scraping services.

We’re a globally distributed team of 180 Shubbers working from over 30 countries who are passionate about scraping, web crawling, and data science.

As a new Shubber, you will:

Become part of a self-motivated, progressive, multi-cultural team.

Autonomy to make the role your own, supported by great people

Join a team with huge opportunity to make a difference

Have the freedom and flexibility to work from wherever you want.

Have the opportunity to go to conferences and meet with the team from across the globe.

Get the chance to work with cutting-edge open source technologies and tools.

Benefits

  • Flexible working hours
  • Remote working
  • Paid time off
  • Paid open source work
  • Global team meet ups
  • Learning & Development Opportunities

items.title: Drops: Vice President (VP) of Engineering
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=12, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Vice President (VP) of Engineering

If you have a soft spot for bootstrapped, profitable companies with a meaningful product, and you would like to develop a small, super-capable technical team in a refreshing work environment, you might quite like this extremely rare executive position at Drops.

About us:
Drops’ goal is to turn language learning into a delightful game while ensuring effective learning. Drops is one of the top10 most innovative education companies according to FastCompany. Our app is in the Appstore for 3+ years, teaches 32 languages, was featured by both the App Store and Play Store multiple times - App of the Year in 2018 on the Play Store - and the company is still run by the founders. We are a small, super-capable remote team mainly spread across Europe (we have a small marketing crew in California) . We’re working synchronously, so time zones matter for us. We communicate via Slack, Github and Monday. We want to be the no.1 app for vocabulary learning and we are getting there quickly with our current user base of 15 million, a monthly active of >1,500,000 and an average store rating of 4.7.
You can find us here: http://drops.app.link/

Here’s what we’re currently after:
  • You’ll be responsible for the tech team’s effectiveness, well-being and development, and that its working aligns well to the business’ and our users’ needs.
  • You’ll be making sure that the technical aspects of the projects are getting done on schedule, that we’re making the right trade-offs.
  • You’ll be leading, mentoring, managing the people who are part of the tech team.
  • You’ll be recruiting, onboarding top talent, sometimes. We’re a small team, and we’re not expecting to grow the headcount a lot (but we do expect to grow the impact each of us have!).
  • You’ll be working closely together with the leadership team, to lay down the tracks for future product and infrastructural expansion.
  • You’ll be in charge of flourishing our engineering culture - organise information sharing, hackathons, processes, developing new, helpful routines.
  • We value clear and honest communication and transparency, it’s the linchpin of our culture and current success and independency.
  • You will be involved in both high and low level decision making and will be available during European working hours (9AM - 6PM GMT).
  • We are looking for a missionary rather than a mercenary.

Skills and experience You have:
  • Can see a problem from the product, business’ and the team’s perspective.
  • You have excellent technical and people skills. (yes, we know, it’s rare!)
  • You are more of a frontend than a backend engineer. (we’re frontend heavy)
  • You held senior software engineering management position such as CTO, Head of Development, or VP of Engineering positions in the past and enjoyed it.
  • You have introspective tendencies, and you’re looking for a position where you can grow fast.
  • You can represent the technology, infrastructure, and the engineering team at the executive level.



What’d be different here:
  • We’re a small team. We’re optimising for impact, not for headcount. You’ll be carefully considering any tradeoff that would lead to increased complexity.
  • We’re using a single programming language - TypeScript. We have strict linter rules. Every pull request needs to be approved before it lands in master. We use the rebase workflow.
  • We’re using React to develop UI, on both mobile and the web.
  • We’re doing things in a functional way, concentrating state, minimising side effects and making dependencies explicit. We’re sharing 98%+ of the code between Android, iOS and Web.
  • We’re writing software with a web developer’s mindset.
  • We automate where it has positive ROI.
  • Our biggest challenge is (and will remain): managing the complexity of sharing a lot of code between different apps.
  • We’re not building a hierarchy. We’re encouraging everyone to be autonomous. You’ll _not_ be an arbitrator between business and engineering. You’ll be helping both project owners and the tech team to work more closely together.
  • Your average day will be about helping with team members make technical decision, adjusting processes as needed, doing research and automation, actually developing software and also, recruiting.



We offer:
  • All the perks of remote working
  • An awesomely compact 19 person team
  • Yearly educational allowance
  • Fitness allowance
  • High-end Apple hardware and ergonomic accessories
  • 30 days of holiday per year (including Christmas and other holidays)
  • ✈️ Quarterly team gathering somewhere in the world (Amsterdam, Iceland, Lisbon and Budapest were previous locations)

items.title: Director of UX Design (Remote!) - Enterprise Saas - Security
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
UX Design, User Experience, User Research, Enterprise, SaaS, UI/UX, Mobile, Usability, Human-Computer Interaction, Web

This is an opportunity to bring your strategic experience to the table, and have a seat at that table with the strategic leadership of the company!

You will play a role in pushing forward the UX practice, and keeping UX Design at the forefront of the of the organization as a priority.

We are looking for a leader to come in and push the UX practice and drive the importance of design as we grow the company.

If you are a UX Design Leader and are interested in helping to build a distributed UX Design team building Enterprise SaaS Security products, please read on!

What You Will Be Doing

Most importantly, you'll have a seat at the leadership table and be trusted to drive strategy for our long-term UX Design plans. This is not just a management position, but certainly a strategic position critical for helping the company grow.

You will be the Head of UX Design for our growing company. You'll be bringing your expertise to execute hands-on while also bringing your experience in building a team and helping to establish the UX practice and grow the organization.

You'll get User Research up and running to ensure that the products we continue building on are based on the user's needs and accomplish our business objectives.

You'll conduct design reviews and gather feedback from users and ensure that we are iterating on application features to improve usability and drive key metrics.

You will define and implement web and mobile best practices for our UX Design group

And more!

What You Need for this Position

More Than 5 Years of experience and knowledge of:

- UX Design

- User Experience

- User Research

- Enterprise

- SaaS

- Security products

- UI/UX

- Enterprise Mobile and web application

- Usability

- Human-Computer InteractionSo, if you are a UX Design Leader with Enterprise SaaS Security product experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Security Clearance will be needed - therefore, only US citizens can be considered.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

items.title: Director Of Technology
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=21, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=24}
items.content:
Happy Tax

 

Director Of Technology

Company Overview Happy Tax is the fastest growing tax preparation company three years in a row according to Entrepreneur Magazine. We operate multiple brands including GetHappyTax.com, HappyTax.com, CryptoTaxPrep.com and CryptoTaxAcademy.com. What makes Happy Tax standout from other traditional tax preparation companies is we have patent pending technology that separates the front end from the back end of the tax preparation process. CPA's focus on the tax preparation while franchisees and contractors take care of the initial sales. Happy Tax's technology and processes, gives customers a fresh new experience with none of the hassles traditionally associated with preparing their taxes, meeting them anytime, anywhere including house calls.  What You'll Do You will oversee our technology infrastructure, work on development and manage outside developers. We recently acquired a SaaS vendor for one of our platforms which we will be further integrating into our operations and making enhancements to. The SaaS is built on Heroku with JQuery, Rivets.js (soon to be React), Bootstrap, Node.js with Express framework and PostgreSQL. Knowledge of them is necessary for this role. Enhancements include OCR, intelligent routing and machine learning.   Location? * Your house or office. No exceptions.  Remote position. Type of Employment * Full-time Responsibilities and Duties Here is the list of skills we believe are necessary for this job. Most importantly, we are hiring based on careful balance of relevant experience, cultural fit, and motivation: * Are organized and completes tasks timely without intervention * Solve problems independently * Improve processes and technology * Has experience coding Qualifications and Skills * Must be nimble and growth oriented. We are a growth company and we intend to accelerate that growth. No bureaucracy, if you like that, this isn't the place for you. Must have a make it happen attitude and get results. This is not a big corporation and does not operate like one, we go from idea to implementation in days or weeks, not months or years. * A tech minded person who do it themselves, lead their team leads and collaborate with the c-level execs. As a startup, we'll need you to be able to get your hands dirty in designing and implementing processes while being able to be a leader yourself and work with our leadership team. Benefits and Perks * Competitive Pay: Willing to look at experienced people who use this as their "in" to the company, and can scale pay accordingly. IMPORTANT NOTE: The salary is not all you will make. All team members are entitled to stock options and yearly bonuses. We are raising additional rounds of capital through multiple channels and we expect there to have liquidity in our shares in the very short term. At the end of tax season, we assess everyone's performance and give bonuses accordingly. * Be Part Of A Happy Team: We see ourselves as a team of people who are working hard together to accomplish a specific mission (become the default tax preparation business opportunity for business owners and the go to tax prep service for consumers), in service of a larger purpose (create time for what matters). Yes, every company says they take culture seriously...and most are full of it. We don't just talk about our culture, and then ignore it in action--we live this mission every day, and we have a pretty awesome set of principles that we live by as a team, because this is the operating system for our tribe, and everyone in our company lives these principles). * Freedom: Once you're established, you can work from home, work while you travel, make your own hours--we don't care. We only care that you produce the necessary results (that's one of our core values in fact). * Make A Real Impact: We are a small start-up (still under 15 full time year round team members that scale drastically during tax season) and you will be a major part of our team, and help shape our growth. Not only that, you won't just impact the company, you'll impact the world. Taxes and entrepreneurship are two of the very best ways to influence other people and change the way they think--and you'll be helping to make them a reality. * Fun & Fast-Paced Work: We don't have boring days. Some are hectic, some are hard, some are incredibly rewarding...but they are never boring and never exactly the same. That's what happens when you're solving real problems for people. * Meet Interesting People: You're not just working on any tax company. Our company is winning awards regularly for our growth and innovation. The people that are part of our team are truly a special bunch. You'll get to work hand in hand with some of the most amazing and experienced professionals in the space.

items.title: Director of Recruiting
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Director of Recruiting at Mattermost

Remote

SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA OR REMOTE

PEOPLE

FULL-TIME

Location: San Francisco (California), Greater Toronto Area (Ontario),or work-from-home

Mattermost provides the world’s leading enterprises an open source collaboration platform offering unparalleled levels of trust, flexibility and innovation. Customers include Uber, Samsung, ING Bank, U.S. Department of Defense, NASA/JPL and hundreds of leading organizations.

We are fast-growing Silicon Valley startup that’s announced $70M of new funding in 2019 with a work-from-home workforce powered by Mattermost’s own collaboration software. We’re seeking an outstanding recruiting leader to play a critical role building and leading recruiting team to accelerate hiring in the U.S., Canada and internationally.

About the Role:

You will have a direct hand in driving the next phase of growth at Mattermost. This is an exceptional work-from-home opportunity to optimize how we identify, recruit, develop and retain top talent. The ideal candidate is an experienced and passionate leader who has helped influence and build a great and high performing culture at an early to mid-stage growth startup. In addition, we are seeking a leader familiar with or passionate about a remote-first culture.

Responsibilities

  • Design and execute creative, data-driven techniques to identify, attract, assess, and close “90s”: new hires with a 90% probability of success in their role and in our culture across technical and non-technical departments
  • Maintain talent pipelines with referrals, applicants, and sourced candidates
  • Manage, coach, and grow a high performing talent acquisition team to deliver impactful results across the entire organization
  • Develop individualized hiring plans for each role
  • Write compelling job descriptions, interview guidelines, and tailored and personalized messaging
  • Track and present pipeline updates, recruiting progress reports, and headcount plans to hiring managers and leadership teams
  • Manage and prioritize hiring across a variety of teams and hiring managers
  • Partner with and cultivate strong relationships with hiring managers and other internal stakeholdersEnsure a phenomenal candidate experience from start-to-finish
  • Play a pivotal role in employer branding and contributing to an online experience to accelerate candidate pipeline
  • Source new engineering talent from an active open source community of over 1,000 contributors, which is how 70% of new engineering talent is currently hired

Requirements

  • Eight plus years overall experience in full life-cycle recruiting, preferably in a high growth environment supporting multiple teams, with increasing levels of responsibility
  • Four plus years experience building, mentoring and leading teams and organizations in high growth mode including Recruitment, Ops, Sourcing, and Coordination
  • Experience building technical and business teams from scratch
  • Exceptional talent assessment and interviewing skills, a strong command of assessment and selection methodologies, and deep knowledge in closing and negotiation techniques
  • Experience recruiting for all levels of an organization, including management and above
  • Experience recruiting for international and work-from-home organizations, particularly in U.S., Canada, Germany, and United Kingdom
  • Patient, communicative, collaborative team player who is detail oriented and has outstanding communication skills (both written and verbal), as well as experience with negotiation
  • Undergraduate degree in business, human resources or equivalent professional experience preferred
  • Enterprise software start-up experience is preferred
Apply for job

items.content:
Technical Project Manager at Polarity.io

Remote
  • Engineering
  • Arlington, VA, USA

About

Polarity specializes in enabling high performing teams with human memory augmentation software. Polarity is like augmented reality, but for your computer, with no bulky glasses. We are a fast growing startup whose customers already include some of the world’s largest organizations including 7 of the Fortune 100, 2 of the top 3 banks, and many other large enterprises.

The position

Polarity is looking for a Technical Project Manager who loves nothing more than planning, organization and efficiency. You’re a critical thinker who is comfortable communicating on a technical level with our engineers and on a business level. You’re a scrum master who can guide and motivate the team through successful releases.

You’ll be responsible for:

  • Managing and documenting release and project timelines, workflows, and deliverables
  • Facilitating internal communication across functions
  • Using metrics to ensure quality and improvements
  • Helping remove productivity blocks
  • Using your technical writing skills for product documentation, e.g. user guides and feature documentation

This job is for you if you have:

  • A bachelor’s degree or higher in business, computer science or related
  • 5+ years of experience working as a Technical Project Manager at an enterprise software company
  • Experience leading stand-ups and planning sprints as a Scrum Master / Agile Coach
  • Experience with team metrics tracking
  • Strong eye for detail and top-notch communication and technical writing skills
  • Previous experience with JIRA or other project management tools

Polarity is an equal opportunity employer. The position is based out of Connecticut and Northern Virginia, with the option for telecommuting from another location.

Apply for job

items.title: Interim Head of Marketing
items.content:
At Geckoboard, we’re helping businesses all around the world make use of their data and align their teams on the things that matter most to them. With ambitious plans to connect with more teams, we have been hard at work in the lead up to some really exciting projects launching (spoilers below). Right now, we’re looking for a Marketing Leader to take us through our next chapter of growth! 

 

You’ll be joining Geckoboard at an exciting time: on the back of a major rebrand and marketing launch. Working with our Head of Marketing for a handover period, you’ll align on the Marketing Strategy for the year ahead and own its delivery through 2020. A core part of your role will be driving new customer demand and to grow the Geckoboard brand.

 

It should come as no surprise that we consider ourselves to be data-geeks and we’re looking for somebody equally data-driven and results focused. You’ll have background in driving customer demand (ideally within SaaS) and can marry quantitative and qualitative analysis to drive high-performing campaigns (whether focused on top of the funnel acquisition, on-page conversion, or customer engagement). 

 

As well, you’ll have a keen interest in the people side of things: We’re looking for great people manager who will defining and framing problems for the team and working with them to execute solutions in the best way possible. You will be teaching, mentoring, motivating and growing an exceptional multi-disciplinary marketing team. Day-to-day you will be responsible for planning the team’s workload and initiatives for each cycle, while regularly reporting on project progress, as well as ensuring they’re delivered on time, within budget and to a high standard.

 

We’re based in a leafy office in East London (Shoreditch), though most of the team work remotely once or twice a week (usually Wednesday). Currently the team is made up of a B2B Digital Marketing Manager, Customer Marketing Manager, Copywriter, Marketing Designer and a Senior Product Marketing Manager. 




Success in this role looks like:




    • Signups are increasing month by month.

    • You have established yourself within the Leadership Team to enable delivery and alignment across the business.

    • Your team say that they trust you and value your contributions.

    • Your team have a clear understanding of their role, how they're measured, what success looks like and how they can continue to develop their skills.







Within your first 90 days you will have:




    • Established yourself within the business and cultivated a strong understanding of the Geckoboard product and our customers.

    • Aligned with the Head of Marketing on the strategy for the next twelve months.

    • Taken over the day-to-day management of the team and delivery of the Marketing strategy for 2020.







You should apply if:




    • You’re available for at least 12 months, ideally starting Oct/Nov 2019.

    • You have a background in B2B software marketing background.

    • You have direct experience with demand or lead generation, and brand development.

    • You’re a passionate people manager (you’ve managed a team of at least four before and you care about helping individuals grow).

    • You’re iterative and a rigorous experimenter, backing your hypothesis with data.

    • You are a strong and persuasive communicator and able to speak to clearly through positive and negative situations, adapting for your audience.






We know that there are great candidates who may not exactly fit into what we’ve described above, or who have important skills we haven’t thought of. If that’s you, don’t hesitate to apply and tell us about yourself.

 

The Geckoboard Story

 

Thousands of businesses use Geckoboard to build live TV Dashboards that focus teams on what matters. We take the complexity out of connecting data and make it simple for anyone to understand key metrics at a glance. We have pre-built integrations with 60+ tools including Google Analytics, Salesforce, Zendesk, Intercom and MailChimp and our customers include the likes of Slack and Skyscanner, Marketo and Hootsuite, to Happy Socks and New Scientist.

 

In our mission to make data useful, our growing team of 40+ is headquartered in London and span across eight time zones - from Mumbai to London, San Francisco to Hawaii and more. We're always looking for people with diverse backgrounds who bring unique perspectives and skills to join our team and in return we constantly strive to ensure that we offer the most encouraging, inclusive, and efficient environment possible.

 

We don't just pay lip service to work-life balance, we actively and strongly encourage it. Flexible working hours and the ability to regularly work from home lets you work in a way that fits you and your family. We see our contractual obligation to offer 25 days of paid holiday as a minimum for everyone in the organisation, not a limit.

 

We actively contribute to professional development, courses, conferences, and books. Our Engineering & Product team also have regular Innovation days, where everyone has complete freedom to work on anything that interests them, from contributing to open source, to learning a new skill, or improving our internal tools and processes.

 

And, don’t take our word for it, see what the team say about the projects they work on: https://medium.com/geckoboard-under-the-hood and their experience of working with us on Glassdoor: https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Reviews/Geckoboard-Reviews-E878996.htm. You can also read more about our values and benefits on our Careers page at https://www.geckoboard.com/careers/.

CustomerBloom

Design & Development Manager At Digital Marketing Agency

verified
US-only
Working at CustomerBloom means working with great people on an interesting range of projects. Our headquarters is in Clifton, NJ but our team spans the globe. We’re looking for folks who are friendly, hard-working, curious, and smart. We are currently looking for an experienced Technical Marketer with strong with excellent communication skills who is ready to run a team of graphic designers and web developers. You will experience these perks: * Work from anywhere in the US (Pacific, Mountain, Central, or Eastern Time Zones)! CustomerBloom is a tight-knit, fully distributed team. * Work with a highly engaged team, learn together, and make decisions that impact the whole company. * Enjoy paid US holidays * Competitive salary based on experience # Responsibilities As Manager of Design & Development, you will: * Work with our sales team to scope new projects * Interact with clients to assess needs, establish time frames, and set clear-cut expectations * Oversee the design and development teams to guide projects to completion * Be comfortable jumping into code if needed to ensure projects meet deadlines * Provide constructive feedback to team members when needed * QA all projects before sending for client review * Manage clients through the revision request process * Accept complete ownership of all design and development projects (the buck stops with you!) # Requirements Sound interesting? Please reach out if you have: * At least two years of building solutions with Wordpress * Experience working with front-end page builders * Experience scoping and managing development projects * Experience with architecting/building tech stacks with integration tools such as Zapier * An intermediate level of expertise with Photoshop and/or Illustrator * Experience building and optimizing landing pages * A working knowledge of the aspects of funnel marketing (paid ads, email marketing, etc) #Location - US-only

items.title: Program Manager of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging
items.content:
Program Manager of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging at Articulate

Remote

ANYWHERE IN US

PEOPLE

FULL-TIME

The Program Manager will manage and execute diversity, inclusion, and belonging initiatives at Articulate. Reporting to the VP of People, the person in this role will champion and build upon our efforts to create and implement programs that promote a culture of diversity, inclusion, and belonging and grow our diverse employee population.

In addition to executing diversity, inclusion, and belonging goals and objectives, the Program Manager will review and monitor data to measure inclusion; design initiatives aimed at improving diversity and inclusion; partner with and support Employee Resource Groups; and develop learning opportunities in the form of brown bags, training, written materials, and more.

Your responsibilities:

  • Act as a subject matter expert to internal and external partners on diversity and inclusion trends, best practices, programs, and initiatives
  • Develop, implement, and facilitate training programs that foster a culture of equality and equity in the form of e-learning and facilitated learning sessions
  • Schedule and facilitate the “I’m Not Racist Am I?” course with new hires
  • Consult with key stakeholders on diversity, inclusion, and belonging
  • Administer our annual inclusion engagement survey, then analyze results and make recommendations on areas of improvement
  • Design and execute initiatives aimed at improving diversity, inclusion, and belonging
  • Manage the diversity, inclusion, and belonging committee
  • Partner with, grow, and support our Employee Resource Groups
  • Work closely with the People team to build underrepresented talent pipelines through online sourcing, events, partnerships and sponsorships, and sourcing campaigns
  • Execute programs that foster growth, development, and retention of diverse employees

Qualifications and skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required
  • 3+ years’ experience doing diversity and inclusion work with effective results
  • Ability to work effectively with multicultural/racial/ethnic/diverse populations
  • Knowledge of best practices in the areas of diversity, inclusion, and belonging
  • Ability to facilitate training around diversity, inclusion, and belonging concepts and practices
  • Ability to gain trust across a wide variety of audiences
  • Excellent program and project management skills, with the ability to think and execute programmatically
  • Ability to analyze data and translate it into actionable insights
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Extremely high EQ

About Articulate

Articulate is a highly successful, fully remote software company that’s changing the way the world learns. Our award-winning e-learning tools are used by 78,000+ organizations across the globe to create engaging online and mobile courses. Our customers include 93 of the Fortune 100 and 19 of the top 20 U.S. universities. And our online community of 605,000+ members is the largest, fastest-growing community in the industry.

We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We’re all free to exercise our crafts the best way we know how to reach our goals as individuals and teams. Each and every one of us is focused on producing results that directly impact the company’s success. And we all strive to do what’s right by people, both internally and externally, instead of taking the shortest route to the highest profits.

We honor people’s humanity in all of our disparate experiences and social locations, accepting each person as an individual with a story worth listening to and honoring. We believe that honoring everyone’s humanity means being committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an equal opportunity employer and invite applicants to voluntarily disclose their race and gender on our application form to help us create a diverse company. This voluntarily disclosed information will not be shared with any hiring manager and will be kept in confidence by the Articulate human resources department and executives who are not hiring for this position.

Apply for job

items.title: Fanatical Labs: Marketplace Enablement Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=9, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Marketplace Enablement Manager

Description

Fanatical Labs operates two software marketplaces, SugarOutfitters (sugaroutfitters.com) and SuiteCRM Store (store.suitecrm.com). On our marketplaces we sell CRM software add-ons and integrations for SugarCRM and SuiteCRM. This software ranges from simple one-feature tools to complex two-way software integrations.

We are looking for a friendly, helpful person to assist customers, sellers, and affiliates on our marketplaces. Customers are SugarCRM or SuiteCRM users that need additional functionality. Sellers create, sell, and support the software add-ons and integrations on our stores. Affiliates leverage these add-ons and integrations for their potential or current CRM clients.

We are currently looking for someone based in the U.S. that has small business experience in a support and/or partner engagement role that leans towards the software app/integrations space. 

The right person for this role will be comfortable with a wide range of tasks such as copywriting, basic marketing campaigns, providing first tier support, and relationship management.

A Typical Day

  • Process any live chat conversations; typically connecting to right partner or billing help
  • Run through new emails, connecting folks with the right partner whenever possible
  • Identify any refund requests or other billing issues and address
  • Identify any new add-on reviews for possible promotion
  • Process new add-ons in various onboarding stages
  • Create email, blog, social media announcements for new add-ons
  • Explore new opportunities or initiatives for ongoing add-on promotions 

Immediate Responsibilities Include

  • Help customers by connecting them to the right resources or people
  • Help customers with billing issues
  • Help sellers with onboarding new products and providing ongoing support
  • Help affiliates by provisioning demo keys and recommending solutions
  • Ongoing documentation of internal processes for this role
  • Improve existing content and create new content for blogs, emails, and social media

Requirements

  • By nature, a friendly, helpful human being
  • Refined writing skills
  • Great communicator
  • Embraces a friendly tone in written communication
  • Being able to read and understand technical documentation
  • Understands the basics of how to use web-based applications
  • Genuinely cares about the success of others
  • 2-3 weeks of business travel each year
  • This is a full time position


Desired Background

  • Customer support experience
  • Partner Enablement experience
  • Copywriting experience


Benefits



Work wherever

We all work remote. Want to go work on the beach? It’s up to you.

40 hour work week

We all have our own lives. That’s why we work after all. We respect your time away and want you to be able to walk away from your work.

Vacations and paid holidays

Go on vacation. Take time away. As a guideline we offer 3 weeks of paid leave. Need a few more days? Not a problem. It’s just a number we pulled out of a hat. We will work with you to make sure there is functional coverage while you are away.

Competitive salary

We monitor industry salaries and make sure we’re paying in the top 25%, based on skills and experience, for every position. Salaries are standardized on the Minneapolis/St. Paul market.

Health, Dental and Vision insurance

We offer a multitude of options for Health, Dental, and HSA accounts for you and your family or domestic partner. We pitch in $325 a month to whichever plan you pick.

Paid parental leave

Family is very important to us. Whenever you welcome a new baby we encourage you to take up to 12 weeks leave as the primary caregiver and up to 6 weeks as a secondary caregiver at 100% salary. You can choose to take an additional 8 weeks of unpaid leave.

Retirement Planning

100% match 401k Retirement plan. We will match your contributions dollar-for-dollar up to 4% of your salary.

Hardware and software

Whatever hardware or software you need to do your job will always be covered by us.

Office stipend

We will work with you to cover any reasonable cost associated with a personal office outside of your home.

Remote Work Package

Internet is a requirement for work. To help with that cost we roll an additional $50 a month into your salary.

Charitable matching

We will match up to $500 a year to any 501c3 organization that you donate to. We love a good cause that excites you.

Fitness allowance

We will pay up to $50 a month for whatever it is that you do to stay in shape.

A little about us


A small group of driven, self-motivated, honest, fun-loving people who want to help businesses, both non-profit or for-profit, be more successful.

Fanatical Labs is a remote only company. We believe people are at their best when they can operate freely.

We have been profitably creating and selling software integrations since we originally formed in 2011 with no outside investment.

These are some of the values that we hold near and dear to us:

Freedom

We believe we are at our best when we can each operate freely.

Improvement

We value an ongoing pursuit of improvement; personally and professionally.

Always Do Good

“ADG” as we call it. We go the extra mile even if there is no expected return for doing so.

Relentless

We value determination. We never shy away from a challenge and relentlessly persevere towards overcoming roadblocks.

Positive Environment

We choose to be positive in all of our interactions.

Transparent

We strive to be as transparent as possible with employees, customers, and partners.



What it's like to work here



We are extremely small. Because of that you will have quite a bit of freedom and leeway to do things the way you best see fit. Sound both exciting and overwhelming?

That’s normal. That is why we value a relentless pursuit of improvement and knowledge. Especially since software is an ever changing world.

While we work mostly independently, we are always ready to jump in and help one another get over any seemingly impossible hurdles.


What the Future Holds


As we are a very small company, there are multiple avenues of career growth. We see paths for a director of partner enablement or even a more marketing-centric role. We acknowledge that there may even be other paths that are unknown at this time. In many ways, it really will be up to you and your strengths.


A little about you


You are a highly driven person. One others may consider an “over achiever”. You are inquisitive; always wanting to learn more. You are reliable, personable, and mostly cheerful; having a positive impact on others is important to you.

If this sounds like you then this company might be the right place for you.

items.title: Head of Engineering
items.content:
We're looking to hire a HEAD OF ENGINEERING to expand our team.


We look for people who are not afraid of unknowns and enjoy working with others to problem solve and break new ground.  You should have a deep interest and track record in the blockchain space, with a genuine interest in improving the financial services ecosystem.  You should be creative but also able to reason about technical problems, argue thoughtfully and contribute in a team setting.


Responsibilities



  • Help propose solutions for some of the foundational problems in the banking and financial services space.

  • Lead and growing the Engineering team and be a pivotal member of the product delivery team.

  • Work with our CTO to define technical and product roadmaps and ensure timely delivery of high-quality, secure software.

  • Be responsible for driving technical innovation, processes and best practices required to deliver the platform at scale.

  • Be a hands-on manager, responsible for inspiring, managing and growing a world class engineering team, building a culture of trust and collaboration between engineers and teams across multiple offices and time zones.


As Head of Engineering you will be responsible for ensuring proper planning and delivery of complex projects, setting clear goals for your team, delivering timely feedback and rewards, and helping recruit great engineers.


Requirements



  • 10+ years hands-on technical expertise, with a willingness to adapt and learn.

  • Experience of working in Banking, Fintech and/or Blockchain startup preferred.

  • Dynamically minded, comfortable working in an entrepreneurial environment.

  • A strong understanding of the Fintech space, in particular around core banking platform, the technology they use and their database (on cloud) management

  • Very familiar with API integration and is able to architect a very modular bank, which enables replacement of core systems through 'simple' plug and play

  • Built and shipped software products or protocols with at least two production launches to speak of.

  • Experience of managing engineering teams including building and leading productive, high functioning, and distributed teams.

  • Active participation in a team’s career development, having managed engineer's performance with proper mentorship and coaching.

  • Detailed understanding of software methodologies and processes including Agile and Kanban.

  • Ability to work with product teams in defining tasks and creating roadmaps.

  • Ability to foster and to create positive engineering cultures.

  • Ability to communicate with technical and business stakeholders.


NICE TO HAVES



  • Previous experience in blockchain or distributed systems.

  • Experience of working with Ethereum.

  • Engagement in Open Source communities.

  • Experience of scaling teams rapidly.

  • Understands the full tech eco system required to run a bank, including regulatory requirements around security, regulatory reporting, zero failure.

  • Some RFI/RFP related experience and comfort with legal aspects of establishing tech supplier relationships.

  • Experience of delivering protocols rather than products.

  • Experience of working in an innovative, disruptive businesses.


This is a part time role with a view to a full time position and equity benefits.
FEMALE CANDIDATES ESPECIALLY WELCOMED

They are responsible for ensuring all communication is properly filtered between clients and developers. Organization, efficiency, attention to detail, skillful boundary setting, and multi-tasking are key skills. Knowledge of Basecamp, Teamwork, Slack, Microsoft Office, Google Apps; General working knowledge of Magento, Shopify, WordPress, BigCommerce Ideal Candidate Qualities:Incredibly detail oriented & organizedExtremely web-savvyFriendly and calm under fireAbility to skillfully set clear boundaries and manage expectations, ensuring projects stay within scope, while not alienating clientsCan understand and untangle technical jargon and learn new technology quicklyProfessional, but accessible and fun in communicationsAbility to thrive and self-manage effectively while working remotelyExpert communicator and presenter in meetings, on the phone; has superb written and proofing skillsStrong problem solving skills and willingness to do what it takes to see projects through to their successful completionAbility to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast paced, deadline and detail driven environmentWillingness to stick to and improve upon existing processesTeam-orientedCommitted to excellence WHY COMMAND C?We are committed to finding the best talent, regardless of location; you can work remotelyWe have a clear vision, purpose and valuesWe are the best in ecommerce development and it is a joy to be a part of a winning teamWe are dedicated to quality of life and enjoying the work we do and the people we work withWe love our clients (they rock!) BENEFITSCompensation: Commensurate with experience.Part-time, contract to hire position: Between 3-6 months contract to ensure it's the right fit before leading to full-time (or part-time if desired) employment. Generous PTO package, health insurance benefits and/or stipend, and more. We are a distributed company, the position is remote. That said, our ideal candidate is based on the east coast. items.title: Store Manager Luxury London Flagship Store
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Our Story


 


Founded in 2016 by Allan Baudoin and Bo van Langeveld, Baudoin & Lange designs, manufactures and sells high-end shoes for men and women.  


 


Allan Baudoin, a computer scientist and Apple alumni turned self-trained bespoke shoe maker, designed and handcrafted the first Sagan in 2014 as his own atelier shoes - hundreds of prototypes and two years of development later, the Sagan was born - instantly conquering the connoisseurs regulars of "the Row" with their supreme comfort, fit for a modern lifestyle.


 


When he and Bo van Langeveld, an ex-racing driver turned financier who was tired of suffering in his obligatory formal office shoes, met - they together developed the idea of a modern shoe brand that would combine the best of both worlds: comfort and style.


 


Our first staple product, the Sagan, is a supremely comfortable and versatile category defining loafer, featured in major publications and sold in over a hundred countries.  


 


We have been experiencing rapid online and offline growth, particularly in the US and Asian markets, where our stockists and partners range from high-end tailoring shops to the most renowned luxury department stores.


 


To date, Baudoin & Lange benefited from compelling triple-digit organic growth; our customers are incredibly engaged with our brand and are our advocates, word-of-mouth has contributed significantly to discovery and we are one of the youngest companies to have firm partnerships with global luxury department stores (Harrods, Selfridges, Barney’s, Beams Japan etc) have been very successful.  Our social media engagement rates are high, and bloggers and influencers love our shoes!


 


The Opportunity


 


We are looking for retail ambassadors who can communicate passionately about the Baudoin and Lange brand and provide visitors of our first central physical UK location with an amazing try-on experience. This position will be based in our Burlington Arcade pop up, near Piccadilly station. Your primary work location will be on the sales floor of London’s Historical Landmark, this area is a major tourist destination and a vibrant, multicultural gathering place in Central London.


 


This is an opportunity for those who thrive in a fast-paced environment, see themselves as more than a Sales Associate/Retail ambassador but as a true personal ‘advisor’- someone who is seeking to grow their career in the luxury retail environment, has a strategic sales mindset, willingness to learn and a passion for forming meaningful relationships with a global clientele. As we value forward thinking individuals, we welcome someone who is eager to contribute their creativity and skill set to continue to the success and strong heritage of the brand.

In order to be successful in this role you must be someone who has experience working in a luxury or high end retail environment or has a strong history involving customer service, dealing with a diverse and elevated clientele. Someone who is motivated to continuously improve personal performance, works well in a team setting, possesses elevated interpersonal skills and the curiosity to discover and enhance the customer in-store experience.


 


This is an extraordinary opportunity to protect, enhance and strengthen our retail sales activity across current and future retail locations, and to take true ownership of our new store front.  In return, we offer a chance to work in a creative and fast-paced environment, directly with the founders, through which you’ll get exposure and insight into the luxury industry with a fresh perspective.


 


About You


 


As our Store Manager, you will be an ambassador of the Brand, ensuring that every Client is treated according to the Baudoin and Lange promise. You will strive to discover your Clients and their every need, and to guide them across the Brand.


 


Requirements


 



  • Promote and drive the company culture

  • Ensure store operations are functioning properly, request for maintenance if needed.

  • Execute and delegate operational tasks and productivity

  • Communicate with Retail Ambassadors specific business communications and new products

  • Ensure proper visual merchandising standards on the retail floor and windows

  • Ensure all current product is exposed on retail floor

  • Ensure customer satisfaction and resolve point-of-sale discrepancies

  • Monitor stock levels and ensure Retail Ambassadors are filling shelves

  • Assist in sales and cashiering

  • Manage day to day operations of the store

  • Work closely with Head of Sales to optimize in-store offering and stock management to optimize sales


 


What kind of person are we looking for? 



  • Prior retail experience desired, ideally in fashion or footwear

  • Positive attitude and enthusiasm

  • Engaging relationship building with customers with the goal of every customer leaving with a smile

  • Connection to Baudoin and Lange’s philosophy and products

  • Pride of ownership with store appearance, cleanliness and organization

  • Willingness to go above and beyond

  • Once trained, use the POS system accurately to process sales

  • Actively contribute towards meeting and exceeding the team's sales goals

  • Have a ‘can-do’ attitude, flexibility, creativity and very hands-on

  • Have excellent communication skills and established experience in presenting to senior leadership

  • Proper presentation and tone-of-voice that corresponds with our brand image


 


What We Can Do For You



  • Competitive compensation package

  • Team of positive, enthusiastic, and passionate people

  • Duration: Fixed term 3 month contract with option to convert to full-time and opportunity to grow within the company

  • Free pair of shoes!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=16, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=16}
items.content:
Description Job Requisition: Project Manager- Remote

Job Description:

The Defense group at Leidos has an immediate opportunity for a technically focused Project Manager in Charlottsville, VA. This candidate should be proficient in Cloud programs and migrations to join a team responsible for transforming the application footprint of the Air Force from legacy data centers to commercial cloud environments in AWS and Azure. This is a remote/telework opportunity.

JOB SUMMARY

Leidos has supported the GCSS-AF team for more than a decade, and the contract is at the forefront of leading the charge in to the CCE (Common Computing Environment), utilizing multiple migration partners and multiple commercial clouds. The position will be responsible for managing multiple cloud-related efforts, including outreach and cloud education, the implementation of various engineering projects, and other duties as assigned. The position will be responsible for collaborating closely with Leidos and subcontractor teams on the contract, as well as with customers across the US Air Force, to successfully complete their duties.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide project management for application cloud-related migration and engineering projects.
  • Ensure effective communication occurs between Stakeholders
  • Attend Scrum of Scums and track blockers to resolution.
  • Manage project risks and dependencies.
  • Provide project oversight for subcontracted efforts (cost, schedule, technical).
  • Coordinate project scope change requests and cost variance reports.
  • Participate in project kickoffs and technical discussions


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • Requires a BA degree and 8 12 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 6 10 years of prior relevant experience.
  • Experience with Agile project management processes and tools (JIRA, Confluence)
  • Cost account management/financial management experience
  • Demonstrated ability to coordinate across remote team members, management, and customers
  • Demonstrated ability to guide peers, leaders, and decision makers on addressing complex issues
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Must be able to obtain DoD Secret security clearance (SSBI preferred)


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • PMI PMP certified
  • Agile Certifications
  • SharePoint experience

External Referral Bonus: Eligible

Potential for Telework: Yes

Clearance Level Required: None

Travel: Yes, 10% of the time

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40

Shift: Day

Requisition Category: Professional

Job Family: Proj and Prog Management



1000


Defense

Leidos is a Fortune 500 information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit .

Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here .

Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to .

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

- provided by Dice

items.content:
Director of Development (100% Remote)

Tremendous opportunity for a Director or Manager of Development/Engineering to join a growing technology company.

You will provide technical leadership and management, manage and drive the development of the next generation platform (from the planning stage through production), prototype new ideas and make individual code contributions when necessary, collaborate within and across cross-functional teams, continue to develop and improve delivery processes, mentor and help engineers grow and develop in their careers and professional skills, deliver projects against technical roadmap, and create a culture that encourages open communication, accountability, creativity, and innovation.

The focus of this job is technical leadership and management, however, you must be able to participate in architecture discussions and some prototyping but not hard core coding.

This is a direct hire position where you can work 100% remote from your home and live anywhere. Awesome opportunity to make an impact at a growing technology company.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

  • 2+ years as a Senior Manager or Director of Development/Engineering
  • Experience with Python and Django web applications
  • 7+ years experience shipping high-quality, scalable, customer-centric web applications
  • 2+ years experience developing and supporting SaaS/Web applications in the cloud for a software/technology company
  • Strong experience with AWS or Google Cloud
  • Experience with building messaging, event-driven architectures
  • Strong understanding of domain driven design
  • Microservices patterns and architectures
  • Experience working for a startup or small company
  • Ability to thrive in a fast paced environment
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • No heavy contract backgrounds or job hoppers

PREFERRED SKILLS:

  • Mobile applications
  • RDS, DynamoDB, ElastiCache, Lambda, Step Functions, API Gateway CloudFormation, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, S3

Associate General Counsel at UnitedHealth Group

Remote

Telecommute

Division:OptumRx Workers Comp

Region: North America
Country: United States
City: Tampa
State: Florida

Other Cities: Columbus Salt Lake City Philadelphia Memphis
Employee Status:Regular
Schedule:Full-time
Job Level:Director
Shift:Day Job
Travel:Yes, 25 % of the Time

Position Description

Bring us your experience, your head for strategy, your strength with relationships and your eye for opportunity. In return we offer an unmatched place to grow and develop your career among a richly diverse group of businesses driven by the power and stability of a leading health care organization. Come help us heal and strengthen the health care system as you do your life’s best work.(sm)

OptumRx is an innovative pharmacy benefit management organization managing the prescription drug benefits of commercial, Medicare and other governmental health plans, as well as those of employers and unions. Services offered by the company include pharmacy network contracting, rebate contracting and administration, mail order pharmacy facilities, specialty drugs and retail drug claims processing. OptumRx is part of Optum, a leading information and technology-enabled health services business dedicated to making the health system work better for everyone.

We’re looking for a skilled professional to join us in this highly visible role. You would be responsible for the interacting and providing legal guidance to the senior leadership of the Optum Workers’ Compensation & Auto No Fault division and performing legal tasks including the production of customer contracts, negotiating, documenting changes. The person in this position will also advise and consult with internal stake holders and external customers on issues relating to the pharmacy benefit management and ancillary services within workers compensation, medicare set aside and workers compensation managed care lines of business. . Function as part of a high performing, collegial team on high profile matters.

As a member of the legal team, close collaboration with colleagues is expected, as well as a willingness to adapt to the changing legal support requirements of our growing business.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Represent the company through the life cycle of workers’ compensation pharmacy benefit management services client relationships – proposals, contract drafting and negotiations, contract interpretation, amendments, client disputes and terminations
  • Advise workers’ compensation business leaders on client and contract related matters, including potential liability and exposure, and resolving disputes outside of litigation
  • Collaborate with other enterprise counsel on various matters relating to clients and the business generally
  • Operate in a strategic and pro-active manner to assist our internal business clients in managing their relationships with clients, and managing the legal and regulatory risk related to the provision of prescription drug benefits to client services
  • Support various internal clients with managing their relationships with clients and responding to client inquiries such as complaints, audit and WC-PBM regulatory matters.
  • Support various internal clients with assessing legal and regulatory risk related to our workers’ compensation programs and services.
  • Support worker’s compensation general counsel with responding to various legal and regulatory matters such as regulatory inquiries, disputes, and diligence.
  • Support the internal workers’ compensation governmental affairs team with assessing applicability of various regulatory and legislative initiatives, including licenses and MAC rules, to workers’ compensation pharmacy benefit management and other lines of business such as Medicare set-aside and third party billing.
  • Support the internal compliance team with analysis of regulatory initiatives and compliant implementations.
  • This is a mid-level attorney position within our organization

Required Qualifications:

  • Juris Doctorate degree
  • 5+ years of experience advising companies in negotiation and drafting of complex professional services agreements in the healthcare industry or other highly regulated industries
  • Experience building and maintaining rapport with superiors, peers, subordinates, and external company contacts, with demonstrated ability to lead and contribute to team effort

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working with the pharmacy and pharmacy benefits management industries
  • Understanding of the managed health care industry
Apply for job
