tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Head of Growth at Magic

Remote | High-paying

Location: Remote

Comp range: $120K – $150K

Benefits: 

  • Employee equity: 0.2% to 0.5%
  • Buy whatever hardware setup you need to be effective
  • Work from home / remotely whenever you need or want
  • Unlimited vacation
  • Comprehensive health, dental, vision 401k
Our mission: 

We want to provide excellent virtual assistance to as many people as possible. Our goal is to make people’s lives better by enabling them to offload tasks to high-quality personal assistants, so they can spend more time doing what they want and accomplish more.

Why this role exists: 

Reports to the CEO. We are looking for a senior leader with product and operational experience, with a clear track record of driving business growth, who will lead a team responsible for understanding and monitoring our customer needs and driving the strategies for their growth.

What’s in it for me?:

The possibility of a personal assistant for everyone is massive. At this point, Google, Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, all of them – are working on this. We are currently the #1 startup in this field—because we’ve put the time in and figured out the hard things, this is a chance to take the 5 years of work we’ve put in, and the product we’ve built, to the larger market.

—

Required Experience:
  • 12+ years of experience, at least 5 of which is at pre-IPO startups
  • Experience with consumer products, messaging and/or on-demand services especially preferred
Objective Outcomes: 
  • You will develop frameworks and decision-making tools; Ability to provide business insights based on these tools
  • You will own the growth plan for hitting business goals
  • You will own the product strategies to track and report our top goals and metrics to drive top of funnel growth
  • You will own in quarter planning and have rigorous input into company-level goal setting
  • You will hire and manage a team of specialists
  • You will drive process and structure of collaboration with other teams including finance, product, operations, and marketing
Core Competencies + Skills:
  • Deep partnership and influence skills across product and operation teams
  • The ability to build analytics and monitoring tools including dashboards, reports, and alerts
  • Deep experience across major customer acquisition channels, including affiliate marketing, display and search ads, SEO, social, and content marketing
  • Familiarity with new ad formats, like stories, sponsored content, and AR
  • Experience with organic and “0 to 1” growth strategies
Personal Attributes:
  • Manage uncertainty and ambiguity well. You can make decisive calls without enough information
  • Driven to achieve business goals
  • Passionate about startups and Magic’s mission
  • Humble and willing to learn and teach

How to Apply: **Please apply directly through this link:

https://recruit-66c441c05fde.breezy.hr/p/559d82fc60d6-magic-head-of-growth.

Be advised we do not view any applications unless they go through our portal.**

Apply for job

items.content:
Legal Executive Assistant at Equivity

Remote | Part-time
  • Legal
  • Remote job

Job description

Equivity is looking for a part-time virtual legal executive assistant who has 3+ years of experience working as an administrative assistant or legal secretary in a law firm and is comfortable remotely managing the administrative needs of a law office. If you enjoy supporting attorneys, pride yourself on your organizational abilities, pay meticulous attention to detail, have excellent communications skills, and thrive in a work-from-home environment, we want to hear from you!

Equivity works closely with our clients to provide them with virtual assistants who are experienced in their field and have successfully worked in a remote or virtual environment. Our law firm clients range from solo practitioners to multi-partner firms, and run across all specialty areas of law including litigation, family law, bankruptcy, real estate, and much more. It is our goal to provide our law firm clients with experienced executive assistants who are familiar with the ins and outs of the day-to-day in a law office environment.

More about our company:

Equivity provides virtual assistance to clients across the United States, with specialties in administrative, marketing, and paralegal support services. Our virtual assistants work with a high degree of autonomy and are responsible for developing relationships with our clients. Because we provide extremely attentive service to our clients, you must be available to respond to client communications and be available to complete tasks throughout the business day, and certainly within one hour by email, phone, and text. All of this work is done remotely, meaning that you can work from home.

The selected candidate would be hired as a part-time employee of Equivity, not an independent contractor. We are looking for somebody who has at least 20 hours per week of availability, and the starting pay is $17.00 per hour. We are a growing business and are looking for a virtual legal assistant who is excited to partner with us and is interested in a long-term role with our company.

Qualities we are looking for:

  • Organization
  • Dedication
  • Initiative
  • Reliability
  • Attention to detail
  • Resourcefulness
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Responsiveness
  • Technologically savvy
  • Ability to work independently with limited oversight

Requirements

Position requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 3+ years of experience as a legal administrative assistant or legal secretary
  • Proficiency in using a practice management system, preferably Clio or My Case
  • Expert with Microsoft Office, including Word, Outlook, Excel and Power Point
  • Proficient with Google suite of programs
  • Proficient with formatting documents in Adobe
  • Availability to make and respond to calls in a professional setting between 9 AM and 6 PM Eastern Time
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Your own laptop and smart phone with broadband access to Internet

items.content:
Agile Coach / Scrum Master (m/f/d)

Company: FREE NOW DE
Location: Hamburg, DE
Level: Senior
Language: English
Product/Project Management
Skills:
  • Agile Coach
  • Scrum Master

    • Intro

    About FREE NOW:

    FREE NOW was founded as mytaxi in June 2009 and was the world’s first taxi app that established a direct connection between a passenger and a taxi driver. In July 2019, mytaxi rebranded to FREE NOW as part of a global mobility brand family and set itself up as a multiservice mobility provider. With 14 million passengers and more than 100,000 drivers, FREE NOW is one of the leading ride-hailing providers in Europe. Since February 2019, the service is part of the FREE NOW group, the ride-hailing joint venture of BMW and Daimler. FREE NOW today works with more than 700 employees in 26 offices and is available in over 100 European cities. Eckart Diepenhorst is leading the operational business as CEO Europe of FREE NOW. More information is available at: www.free-now.com

    We are looking to recruit a highly qualified and motivated Agile Coach / Scrum Master (m/f/d) for our headquarter in Hamburg.

    These are your responsibilities:

    • Responsibility for two of our development teams
    • Acting as a coach and optimizing the processes within your teams
    • Ideal application and continuous improvement of agile methods within different areas
    • Close cooperation with other Scrum Masters as well as team members from different departments (e.g. product, marketing, business intelligence)
    • Supporting your team with their self-organization in order to eliminate impediments
    • Active development and maintenance of our culture of trust

    Main requirements

    • University degree or apprenticeship with IT background
    • Several years of experience as Scrum Master (m/f/d) or Agile Coach (m/f/d)
    • Enthusiasm for the development in an adventurous company living the start-up spirit
    • Self-initiative, courage and pragmatism in order to identify and overcome impediments
    • Hands-on mentality
    • Being a strong and experienced communicator with the ability to be empathic
    • Enjoying your work while bringing in a sense of humour and optimism
    • Good English skills
    • Experience in an international company or team away from your home country is a plus

    Perks

    • The chance to bring in your own ideas
    • A strong team spirit
    • Excellent monetary benefits (a pension plan, a monthly mobility allowance for free taxi rides, subsidised public transport ticket)
    • Have your birthday off!
    • ...and all the usual start-up goodies like fruit, unlimited soft drinks, after-work beers, gym for free, a chill-out room with a massage chair, a foosball table and many more

    Oh, and the opportunity to work with the best team in the world (we know, everybody says so, but at FREE NOW it’s true)!

items.content:
Description Job Requisition: Project Manager- Remote

Job Description:

The Defense group at Leidos has an immediate opportunity for a technically focused Project Manager in Reston, VA. This candidate should be proficient in Cloud programs and migrations to join a team responsible for transforming the application footprint of the Air Force from legacy data centers to commercial cloud environments in AWS and Azure. This is a remote opportunity

JOB SUMMARY

Leidos has supported the GCSS-AF team for more than a decade, and the contract is at the forefront of leading the charge in to the CCE (Common Computing Environment), utilizing multiple migration partners and multiple commercial clouds. The position will be responsible for managing multiple cloud-related efforts, including outreach and cloud education, the implementation of various engineering projects, and other duties as assigned. The position will be responsible for collaborating closely with Leidos and subcontractor teams on the contract, as well as with customers across the US Air Force, to successfully complete their duties.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide project management for application cloud-related migration and engineering projects.
  • Ensure effective communication occurs between Stakeholders
  • Attend Scrum of Scums and track blockers to resolution.
  • Manage project risks and dependencies.
  • Provide project oversight for subcontracted efforts (cost, schedule, technical).
  • Coordinate project scope change requests and cost variance reports.
  • Participate in project kickoffs and technical discussions


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • Requires a BA degree and 8 12 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 6 10 years of prior relevant experience.
  • Experience with Agile project management processes and tools (JIRA, Confluence)
  • Cost account management/financial management experience
  • Demonstrated ability to coordinate across remote team members, management, and customers
  • Demonstrated ability to guide peers, leaders, and decision makers on addressing complex issues
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Must have active DoD Secret security clearance (SSBI preferred)


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • PMI PMP certified
  • Agile Certifications
  • SharePoint experience

External Referral Bonus: Eligible

Potential for Telework: Yes

Clearance Level Required: Secret

Travel: Yes, 10% of the time

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40

Shift: Day

Requisition Category: Professional

Job Family: Proj and Prog Management



1000


Defense

Leidos is a Fortune 500 information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit .

Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here .

Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to .

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. items.title: Mayven: Technical Project Manager / Lead
items.content:
Technical Project Manager / Lead

We are looking for a technical project manager to join our growing team of designers, developers, and qa engineers.

We are fully distributed team, with team members located across 10 different countries and 3 different continents.

We are looking for someone who is comfortable taking the reins on complex technical implementations.  For us, what that means is you will be the trusted contact for our clients, the person they can reach out to and feel confident in receiving a timely and accurate answer to whatever issues, concerns or questions they have.  On the internal side, you will be in charge of checking in with the team assigned to your projects, allocating resources and tasks, and making sure that the developers or designers are getting everything  they need to be successful on the project.  Watching the budget on the project, and maintaining overall project profitability is another key component of your success.

On the technical side, you do not need to be a developer, but prior experience certainly helps as most of the projects you work on with us will have some technical component to it.

The ideal candidate will start as a contractor with us, a minimum of 20 hrs/week.  The role would eventually evolve into a full time role, assuming it made sense for both sides.

If you are interested, please follow the instructions below:
  1. Send an email to team@mayvendev.com
  2. Subject line: {first name} {last name} - Interested in "Technical Project Manager / Lead"
In the body of the email, please include: 
  1. Your full name 
  2. A quick 3-4 sentence pitch on why this is the perfect opportunity for you 
  3. Your current location 
  4. Your hours of availability 
  5. Your current job, or what your most recent job was 
  6. A link to your LinkedIn profile

items.title: CTO / Head of Data
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Are you passionate about big data & property investment?


If so, we're looking to hire a talented CTO/Head of Data to join our growing team.


Who We Are:


We’re Yuvoh. A London-based Proptech Start-up, established in 2017.


We help people looking to make smart property investments and turn them into profitable long term and short-term holiday rentals.


This means we help people find their ideal property investment, give them the right data and tools which allow them to make smart choices based on the metrics they care about and then get the right financing to manage the property and maximise cash flow. We can even help with furnishing the property at the end if required.


Essentially, using our smart data analytics platform and expert market knowledge, we make the end-to-end property investment process fast, simple and stress-free.


In the last 6 months we have started to commercialise our data services and have started to sell services into lenders.


What We’re Offering:


An exciting opportunity for a talented CTO/Head of Data join our busy team.


You’ll create and implement the technology strategy and 12-month roadmap, which underpins our smart data analytics platform (data as a service). This will include understanding Yuvoh’s existing technologies, as well as new technologies that can support and transform our clients ( property investors and lenders) to make smarter decisions using big data and analytics. You will be responsible for the security and integrity of our data services, and be responsible for ensuring we can add value to our customers. You’ll also manage our small tech team (in-house and remote workers).


This job is for you if you have:



  • A strong technology background, and enthusiasm to roll up your sleeves to make progress on the strategy

  • Experience of leading complex big data as a service projects, working in an agile way

  • Strong knowledge of data science, and front and back end development

  • Experience in a start-up / small business environment

  • Great leadership skills to manage, motivate and develop a tech team of 5+ people which comprises of data scientists and engineers. Experience managing a remote team / third parties is highly desirable

  • Commercial acumen to build practical solutions that deliver a great customer experience, working in a lean, cost-conscious way

  • Gravitas and the ability to present and pitch the product to stakeholders in a compelling way


Prior CTO experience is not essential, but ambition and drive to become a CTO in an exciting, fast-growing start-up is a must.


We may also consider people who require a visa, looking to relocate to London.


What you’ll get:



  • A competitive base salary. Plus, if you prove yourself to be a talented, loyal and committed member of the team, this will be recognised and rewarded through discretionary stock options and bonuses.[1][2] 

  • Interesting, challenging work and autonomy, so you feel excited to come into work each day

  • Work-life balance. Team members can work from home when needed

  • A fun working environment. We are part of a great co-working community with regular social events, food pop-ups and social drinks events and best of all, it's a dog-friendly office so there are plenty of pooches around!

  • A workspace that is convenient and productive, with super-fast internet, fully stocked coffee bar, private phone booths and more. Based in trendy Shoreditch, we are right in the heart of central London, surrounded by restaurants, bars, artisan boutiques, high street favourites, and street art. And Liverpool Street Station is just a short walk away 

  • The best tools for the job, to ensure you are set up for success


If you’re interested, please send us your CV and covering letter

    At ctrl QS we address the challenges faced by global brands when operating their digital activities worldwide. Offering a specialized range of services, we achieve operational excellence internationally to go hand in hand with advancing technology. Our track record of achievements is based on the contribution of every team member and has resulted in close and trusting relationships with our clients who see us as part of their team.

Located in the heart of Berlin, we steer international digital activities for some of the world’s top global brands like NIVEA, Montblanc, IWC Schaffhausen, GROHE and la prairie. We are unique in our positioning focusing on what we do best.

    A job with us combines working in a fast-paced professional environment and being part of a young-spirited, agile, collaborative, and multicultural team of about 80 team members from over 30 nations. Our working language is English.
    We are continuously learning and growing, offering careers in a wide variety of directions with the possibility to develop and take on new responsibilities quickly. Our account teams consist of Account Managers and Directors, Project and Content Managers, Rollout Managers, International Support Specialists, Technical Experts as well as Trainers. Our success is based on sustainable and healthy growth and we put our team, values and client satisfaction first.

    What you’ll do

    • Managing rollout projects. You manage international rollout projects for global brands in an agile way. From campaign rollouts to tool & system rollouts to rolling out new ways of working. You are responsible for all strategic, operational and team management matters of the project, ensuring to meet project objectives.
    • Applying expertise. You will apply our ctrl QS company expertise and proven approaches to the projects you manage. You build and expand the expertise through your experiences and skills. You quickly develop a sound technical expertise on our client’s system infrastructure.
    • Planning and budgeting. You will manage project budgets and take over responsibility for timely budget and team planning. You evaluate short and medium-term team needs and always ensure regular and accurate reporting and invoicing.
    • Building relationships. You work closely with our clients and their technical and creative partners. You uphold, strengthen and build trusting and long-term partnerships.
    • Optimizing. You critically review project developments and proactively suggest and implement optimization initiatives (e.g. to processes, team set-up, budgeting, client relationship management etc.).
    • Rolling up your sleeves. You dive into action with a hands-on approach, pragmatically supporting with operational and configurational tasks when and where necessary. You have robust analytical skills and deliver on detail as well as strategy.

    What you can offer

    • Result orientation. You have a proven track record of successful project management in agile environments. You take full accountability and ownership of your role. You deliver excellent results with an action-oriented but quality-focused approach.
    • Digital savviness. You understand the challenges large corporations face with digital transformation, have a profound understanding of the digital landscape and state-of-the-art digital marketing technologies. You love to dig into the details and complexity of our clients’ worlds and to collaborate hands-on with the teams.
    • Communication. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills: you interact confidently in an international and intercultural, dynamic surrounding and are experienced in presenting and communicating professionally to client teams. You love to build connections to people and communities across the globe. Fluent English skills both orally and written, German skills advantageous.
    • Experience. You have gained relevant experience in digital project management and agile ways of working. Ideally, you have already worked with multilingual Content Management Systems, international website infrastructures and website localization. Experience in working in corporate environments advantageous.
    • Resilience. You don’t mind if things become hectic and stay cool if things change unexpectedly. You strive in a fast-paced and dynamic working environment. Even under pressure you can provide consistent quality and reliable results.
    • Inspiring a can-do attitude. You love to get involved and proactively approach opportunities and business challenges with a positive and open mind. You inspire others to follow you.

    What we offer

    • Opportunity to shape. You can actively shape our organization and continue the ctrl QS success story. Reap the fruits of your own initiatives and see the impact of what you do.
    • Exposure and top clients. We enjoy long term and profound client relationships. You will work closely with leading global brands, helping them to steer digital transformation in their organization.
    • Learning and development. We face new challenges every day and we encourage you to take them on. You’ll never stop learning when working with us. We’ll plan your development steps together.
    • Work-life balance. We strongly believe that a healthy work-life balance not only makes us happier but also leads to better results. We offer opportunities to work from home, temporary remote work and sabbatical opportunities.
    • Culture and Team. We always strive to ensure that our intentions and everyday actions are guided by our values: Trust, Dynamism, Quality, Collaboration, Impact and Professionalism. An open, committed, supportive, multicultural, fun and powerful team is looking forward to welcoming you soon!
    • Working environment. Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Berlin. We offer fresh fruit every day, weekly breakfasts and yoga classes, team and company events, and more.
    Apply for this position

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Project Coordinator at Township

Remote
Township is… 

Township is looking to add an experienced, US-based Project Coordinator to our remote team! This will be our first hire for this type of role. 

Township is a fully remote, US-based digital product agency. We have a few strongly held convictions:

We take care of each other

We believe strongly that companies should take care of their employees, and that employees should take care of each other. We provide weekly mentorship to help guide you down a career framework you’ll help us craft, a transparent and competitive compensation package, and generous benefits.

Do great work, and then do something else

We ask a lot of our team, but we also know that your job is only part of your life. We’ll keep you busy during ‘working hours’ but leave you plenty of time to pursue the things that are important to you outside of your job. We are committed to a 40 hour work week.

Great products are crafted by integrated teams

We believe that great products are created through the close collaboration of design and engineering. Our engineering team plays a big part in our design process, and our design team collaborates closely with the engineering team at all stages of the development process. 

We are looking for a Project Coordinator to join our nimble team of collaborative, driven engineers and designers at Township to help us create beautiful digital products and marketing materials.

Township’s Project Coordinator:
  • Makes it possible for the quality of work from the entire team to be elevated by removing overhead from our projects and loosening lynchpins.
  • Supports the functional lead of each project.
  • Serves as an internal resource to the team for moving projects forward on time and with strategic prioritization.
  • Writes thoughtful, thorough issues for both engineering and design projects.
  • Performs ongoing QA and communicates findings to team with efficiency and appropriate urgency.
  • Manages competing timelines across all projects and informs team of priorities and priority changes on a regular basis.
  • Provides team with a well-planned roadmap each week based on commitments and issues at hand.
  • Assists sales team with time estimation for proposals.
  • Is proactive in communicating to the sales team about when the team is available to take on new projects.
  • Assists functional leads and project managers with facilitating positive client interaction.
  • Has familiarity with technical jargon and basic application architecture ideas, though engineering experience is not required.
  • Advocates for time spent on internal products.
  • Is passionate about personal growth as well as helping improve the quality of work across the team.
  • Cultivates an environment of healthy communication, support, and collaboration.

If you check most or all of these boxes we would love to consider you for this position. Most qualified applicants will have 1 to 3 years of professional digital project coordination experience and have worked successfully on a remote team before.

Salary and Benefits

The starting salary for this position will be between $58,000 and $71,000 annually.

As for benefits, we offer many!

  • The cost of your health insurance is 100% covered by Township. You may also add your family to your plan, and we’ll cover 50% of their cost too.
  • The cost of vision and dental insurance is 100% covered by Township for both you and your family.
  • We are proud to offer twelve weeks of paid parental leave any time you add a new member to your family.
  • We will give you a company card that is loaded with $300 every month to cover work-related expenses, such as a coworking space membership, home internet, coffee, and so on.
  • We go on team-wide retreats about every nine months and we can’t wait for you to come along. We’ll explore a new city together and bond IRL.
  • Every year we’ll give you $2,000 to spend attending industry-relevent conferences or classes.
  • Our team works on a flexible schedule with very few meetings. You can get your work done each day at the time that works best for you.
  • We enjoy each other’s company but realized we don’t get nearly enough of it. We’ll give you a Buddy Budget with $1,000 to spend every year traveling with your coworkers.
How to Apply:
Please introduce yourself to us at careers@township.agency and Megan will follow up with you as soon as possible. In your email, please include:
  • Your resumé
  • Current employer
  • Confirm that the salary range we’ve provided meets your requirements.
  • Tell us why you’re interested in being a project coordinator.
  • Give us an example of a time you’ve supported your team/coworkers that you’re especially proud of.

Township is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity of background, age, story, and complimentary skill sets are what make teams successful. We are committed to making hiring decisions with that in mind and we provide everyone with equal access to professional development. 

Please note that we are unable to offer work visa sponsorship at this time.

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

items.title: VP Project Delivery
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=8, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
**MISSION AND TEAM**
We're re-building work and re-telling its story.


We’re building technology that ensures businesses can deliver software and data projects faster and to a higher standard than ever before. Our platform allows us to accurately scope the resource requirements for any technical project and assign an on-demand Elastic Team to deliver it.


Our Elastic Teams are a collection of engineers and data scientists selected from the top 1% of freelancers around the globe and managed through the Distributed platform.


You'll be teaming up with a group of scientists, engineers, product managers, and salespeople from the UK’s leading tech companies including Facebook, Uber and Babylon Health, who are challenging every assumption about how businesses deliver digital work.


We have recently secured £3m in seed funding from a top tier venture capital firm and are preparing for exceptional growth in 2020.


Want to know more? read: https://distributed.co/about-distributed


 


**VP PROJECT DELIVERY**
This is a leadership role where you will be driving the engine room of Distributed, ensuring that our Project Managers and Elastic Team deliver projects above and beyond our customers expectations.


 


**RESPONSIBILITIES**
• Ensuring every delivery through the Distributed platform is on time and accurately scoped by managing a team of project managers who work hand in hand with our global elastic team.
• Successfully scaling the Project Management team by sourcing, attracting and retaining top tier talent.
• Develop the Project Management team’s proficiency through effective coaching and leadership.
• Working closely with Customer Success to efficiently solve any customer problems.
• Working closely with Technical Heads to devise technical solutions to ensure the success of a delivery.
• Create and improve internal processes for scalability, repeatability and ensure that processes are being followed.


 


**WHO ARE YOU?**
You are here to own project delivery on behalf of Distributed by leading a team of top tier project managers and working in collaboration with our elastic team and internal functions.


You:
• are quick to understand and suggest solutions to highly technical problems.
• understand the vast variety of problems that technical projects face.
• can successfully build and lead a growing team of top tier project managers.
• enjoy working as part of a team and in a collaborative organisation.
• communicate clearly, concisely and often to internal and external stakeholders.
• have high EQ to help successfully advise on managing customers.


 


**PREFERRED EXPERIENCE**
• Extensive enterprise project management experience.
• Extensive product experience.
• Have successfully worked with remote teams.


 


**WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING AT DISTRIBUTED**
We are a high performing team of around 20 people based near Shoreditch. We celebrate our diverse group of talented employees and we pride ourselves on our transparent, collaborative, friendly and respectful culture.


We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, stock options, pension plans and private healthcare. We host regular company socials, weekly catered lunches and the office is full of snacks, coffee and beer on tap.


We value learning and will help you with your personal development in every way we can. The team regularly exchange books, podcasts, recommended readings and we actively support further education. Our mission is to help you succeed and flourish within the company and your career.

items.title: iPresence: Digital Project Manager
items.content:
Digital Project Manager

Digital Project Manager
100% Remote/WFH
12 Month Contract



Here at iPresence our growth is dependent on hiring amazing people! Wherever in the world they work, everyone is rewarded for their contribution. Are you ready to develop your career in an exciting hyper growth company? 



iPresence was founded in Vancouver, BC to provide clients with a reliable partner to their online marketing and web development needs. We provide a wide variety of web services and predominantly specialise in high traffic websites. Just one of our websites receives 120 million views each month, making it one of Alexa’s Top 350 destinations in Canada.



Our vast in-house experience and expertise enables us to provide our clients with access to valuable resources to tap into their target audiences. We oversee millions of impressions per month through our network of websites building on our customized long term approach to customer success.


We also actively develop highly successful and profitable ventures of our own.


Responsibilities


  • Managing the day-to-day operational aspects of a complex strategic online product
  • Managing key stakeholder & sponsor expectations
  • Facilitating the definition of project scope, goals and deliverables
  • Planning of the project to produce a project plan and schedule
  • Monitoring and tracking project progress and deliverables using appropriate tools
  • Driving cross-functional project teams to achieve project objectives
  • Helping to ensure the project is run on time and to budge 
  • Please note - we are not looking for a hardware/infrastructure PM

Requirements


  • 5 Years experience (Min 2 years working with Remote Teams)
  • Experience of Agile development, Jira management, user stories creation
  • Experience carrying out projects independently or in a small team, participating in all phases
  • The ability to identify, assess and manage risks, ensuring product success
  • Experience of working on high traffic websites/ecommerce
  • Experience implementing stakeholder engagement/communications plan
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, the ability to build good relationships with the project teams and client is essential
  • Attention to detail
  • Fluent in English 

Benefits

100% Remote

items.content:
Digital Project Manager at Modern Tribe

Remote | Freelance | International
The Opportunity

We’re looking for a talented and experienced digital project manager in North America. We’re a WordPress agency so hopefully you have run some projects with the platform.

If you are drawn to order like a moth to a flame, then drop us a line. If you like maintaining lists and seeing team members make progress because you set them up to succeed, then you are perfect for this gig.

If you are skilled in agile, waterfall and whatever-suits-the-project techniques, then we should talk.

To be transparent, this is NOT a Digital Producer role. We have Strategists that you will be working with as well as UX team members. This gig is about organization and management more than it is about creative input.

Inclusion Statement

Modern Tribe is committed to a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion. We foster an environment of collaboration, open engagement, fairness and respect regardless of differences in age, race, disability, national origin, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status. As a hybrid workspace ranging from distributed contractors to traditional employees, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of our global team.

We come from all walks of life. We are small business owners. We are tattoo aficionados and 80’s movie buffs and ex-pats. We are homeschool teachers. We are single parents. We are musicians, college drop-outs, and entrepreneurs. We are travelers, feminists, runners, volunteers, and makers. We are a Modern Tribe.

Everyday we strive to fulfill our motto: live well and do good work. We hope you will consider joining us.

Responsibilities

Your primary responsibility is to shepherd the project to success. We pride ourselves on our projects arriving on time, on scope, on budget with a happy team and customer. You will create confidence through organization and oversee communication. To do this, you will need to:

  • Manage scope, timeline and budget execution
  • Manage expectations for everyone on a project including the team, the account managers, and the customer
  • Run scrums and other status meetings
  • Review team hours
  • Write SOWs
  • Review budget
  • Set up and maintain tickets in the management system
  • Manage collection of assets and information from the customer
  • Perform meeting prep, prepare agendas, and handle all follow up
  • Produce weekly and monthly summary reports
Personal Competencies
  • Strong communication and/or experience working as part of a remote team
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong organizational skills, with a methodical approach to all tasks
  • Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
  • Ability to work independently with minimal oversight
  • Fluent English speaker
Required Knowledge & Experience
  • At least 5 years of experience working as a PM, ideally on a distributed web design / dev team
  • Experience with agile and waterfall management styles
  • Experience producing large CMS powered websites
  • A whiz when it comes to online collaboration tools. You feel at home when we talk about Slack, Google Hangout, Google Docs, Dropbox or any number of online PM tools.
  • Experience managing projects with budgets of at least $100k ($250k preferred)
Additional Experience (Bonus Points)
  • Experience with WordPress
  • Technical experience as a frontend or backend developer
  • Experience with enterprise level web development projects
  • Design experience
Location

Work from anywhere in North, Central or South America. If your timezone is outside of US business hours but you work at least 4+ hours of overlap each day, let’s chat. You must be fluent in English. You just need a computer and a strong wifi signal to support daily video chats with the Tribe.

Compensation

This is a freelance, contract gig (20 hours per week at a rate of $50-$60 USD).

Perks

We believe in learning from each other and fostering personal growth. You can expect to learn a lot while working with us and we have a benefits package for full time employees.

(Also, if you work enough with us, we’ll bring you on the team trip.

Who We Are

Modern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world’s largest companies, government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a smattering across the globe).

Who You Are

We love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large projects. To be on our team, you must be:

  • HAPPY – Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.
  • HELPFUL – Always looking for ways that you can help others.
  • CURIOUS – It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.
  • ACCOUNTABLE – Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of success.
  • A Freelancer – This means that if you live within the USA, you will also maintain your own personal client list and that Modern Tribe will only comprise a portion of your total income. Regardless of where you live, you need to be already freelancing.
Apply for job

items.title: NHBC Inspection Manager (Scotland – Central Belt) - NHBC - Central Belt
items.content:
This is a fantastic opportunity to join the Inspection Management team. Our Inspection teams play a critical role in our success carrying out over one million inspections each year, working with builders and developers to provide the hundreds of thousands of high quality homes that the country needs.

This role is home based and due to the nature of the role, a full UK driving licence is essential.

The Job

You will be required to manage an efficient and effective inspection service. This will involve the deployment, management and support of Building Inspectors together with the promotion of the objectives of the Inspection Service - to provide excellent risk management, advance good customer relations and assist in developing NHBC’s business.

  • Managing a team of Building Inspectors
  • Monitor performance of inspectors, identifying outcomes and taking appropriate action
  • Carrying out performance and development reviews, agreeing objectives, identifying training and development needs, identifying links to personal and team development plans
  • Take responsibility as the primary contact for key NHBC Registered Builders which will involve effective customer relationship management.
  • Contributing to and support of the Operations Business Plan
  • Prepare and monitor the team Budget and deliver service within agreed limits
  • Assessing sites for NHBC “Pride in the Job” quality campaign

Essential Skills, Experience and Qualifications

  • Qualified to a minimum of HNC, HND, NVQ6 level in a construction related discipline
  • Management experience within the construction / house building industry
  • Experience of working in a change environment
  • In depth knowledge of NHBC Technical Standards and Building Regulations
  • Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
  • Proactive, motivated and driven, with the ability to achieve results through the efforts of others
  • Excellent communicator with appropriate interpersonal skills, planning and organisational skills

Desirable Skills: Degree in a construction related discipline, Management qualifications, Full corporate membership of a relevant professional institution such as RICS, CABE, CIOB, ICE, IStructE or similar


The Benefits

- £46,000 - £54,000 (depending on experience and including remote worker allowance)

  • Up to 10% performance related bonus
  • Company car
  • 26 days pa annual leave entitlement with option to buy an additional week’s annual leave
  • Pension scheme (up to 10.5% of salary employer contribution)
  • Life assurance of 4 x salary
  • Subsidised private medical insurance
  • Cycle purchase scheme
  • High street discounts and preferential gym rates
  • Employee assistance programme

Relocation assistance may be available for the right candidate

Why NHBC?

Our purpose is to work with the house building industry to raise the standards of new homes and provide protection for homeowners. Homes are at the heart of all our lives and our colleagues are proud to be making a difference to improving the quality standards of new-build homes in the UK. Being an independent, non-profit distributing company with no shareholders means we can focus solely on our mission.

Always happy to talk flexible working

We encourage employees to work flexibly in different ways including home working, field working and both formal and informal flexible working arrangements. We don’t promise we can offer you what you want, but we are always willing and happy to talk flexible working options. This can be discussed further during the interview process.

Diversity and Inclusion

NHBC is committed to equal opportunities for all. We are a signatory to the Armed Forces Covenant and the Women in Finance Charter. Our inclusive culture helps us to maintain competitive advantage as we aim to attract people from diverse backgrounds to complement our team. Underlying our overall commitment to equality is the fundamental belief in the right of all employees and customers to be treated with dignity and respect and to be guaranteed freedom from discrimination.

Our Values

Excellent – Proud and professional in all that we do
Connected – Collaborating, sharing and achieving success as a team
Human – Challenging, supporting and respecting each other
Progressive – Inspired by possibilities, learning and adapting together

Central Belt
Permanent
£46,000 - £54,000 a year

items.title: Modern Tribe: Digital Project Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Digital Project Manager


The Opportunity

We’re looking for a talented and experienced digital project manager in North America. We’re a WordPress agency so hopefully you have run some projects with the platform.

If you are drawn to order like a moth to a flame, then drop us a line. If you like maintaining lists and seeing team members make progress because you set them up to succeed, then you are perfect for this gig.

If you are skilled in agile, waterfall and whatever-suits-the-project techniques, then we should talk.

To be transparent, this is NOT a Digital Producer role. We have Strategists that you will be working with as well as UX team members. This gig is about organization and management more than it is about creative input.


Inclusion Statement

Modern Tribe is committed to a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion. We foster an environment of collaboration, open engagement, fairness and respect regardless of differences in age, race, disability, national origin, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status. As a hybrid workspace ranging from distributed contractors to traditional employees, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of our global team.

We come from all walks of life. We are small business owners. We are tattoo aficionados and 80’s movie buffs and ex-pats. We are homeschool teachers. We are single parents. We are musicians, college drop-outs, and entrepreneurs. We are travelers, feminists, runners, volunteers, and makers. We are a Modern Tribe.

Everyday we strive to fulfill our motto: live well and do good work. We hope you will consider joining us.


Responsibilities

Your primary responsibility is to shepherd the project to success. We pride ourselves on our projects arriving on time, on scope, on budget with a happy team and customer. You will create confidence through organization and oversee communication. To do this, you will need to:

  • Manage scope, timeline and budget execution
  • Manage expectations for everyone on a project including the team, the account managers, and the customer
  • Run scrums and other status meetings
  • Review team hours
  • Write SOWs
  • Review budget
  • Set up and maintain tickets in the management system
  • Manage collection of assets and information from the customer
  • Perform meeting prep, prepare agendas, and handle all follow up
  • Produce weekly and monthly summary reports

Personal Competencies

  • Strong communication and/or experience working as part of a remote team
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong organizational skills, with a methodical approach to all tasks
  • Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
  • Ability to work independently with minimal oversight
  • Fluent English speaker

Required Knowledge & Experience

  • At least 5 years of experience working as a PM, ideally on a distributed web design / dev team
  • Experience with agile and waterfall management styles
  • Experience producing large CMS powered websites
  • A whiz when it comes to online collaboration tools. You feel at home when we talk about Slack, Google Hangout, Google Docs, Dropbox or any number of online PM tools.
  • Experience managing projects with budgets of at least $100k ($250k preferred)

Additional Experience (Bonus Points)

  • Experience with WordPress
  • Technical experience as a frontend or backend developer
  • Experience with enterprise level web development projects
  • Design experience

Location

Work from anywhere in North, Central or South America. If your timezone is outside of US business hours but you work at least 4+ hours of overlap each day, let’s chat. You must be fluent in English. You just need a computer and a strong wifi signal to support daily video chats with the Tribe.


Compensation

This is a freelance, contract gig (20 hours per week at a rate of $50-$60 USD).


Perks

We believe in learning from each other and fostering personal growth. You can expect to learn a lot while working with us and we have a benefits package for full time employees.

(Also, if you work enough with us, we’ll bring you on the team trip.


Who We Are

Modern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world’s largest companies, government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a smattering across the globe).


Who You Are

We love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large projects. To be on our team, you must be:

  • HAPPY - Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.
  • HELPFUL - Always looking for ways that you can help others.
  • CURIOUS - It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.
  • ACCOUNTABLE - Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of success.
  • A Freelancer - This means that if you live within the USA, you will also maintain your own personal client list and that Modern Tribe will only comprise a portion of your total income. Regardless of where you live, you need to be already freelancing.

items.title: Director, Ecosystem – Partnership Management
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=5, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Director, Ecosystem – Partnership Management at Manifold

Remote | International

San Francisco, CA

Discover

The Opportunity

Can work Remote

Sales and Business Development

Management

Full-time – Permanent

At Manifold, we are building a marketplace of cloud-based developer tools and infrastructure services. We are looking for a strong sales / business development / account management professional to help us add more services to the marketplace, grow partnership revenue and help our partners succeed.

We currently have 40+ provider services in our marketplace but we’re just getting started. We believe there are thousands of potential partners out there including “tier one” services like Stripe, Twilio, MongoDB, and Fastly all the way down to nascent one-developer services. Your job is to pioneer successful tactics to pursue, secure and manage these partners.

Although we have been doing this for a while, this is a new, dedicated role and a greenfield opportunity: you will define, create, manage and execute the Partnership Management function.

Your compensation will include both a base salary and variable, target-based component.

What you’ll do

Responsibilities:

  • Add new Service Provider partners to the Manifold Marketplace
  • Assist Exec Team with new Platform Distribution partner opportunities for our Marketplace-as-a-Service
  • Manage the partner pipeline and business development process
  • Manage existing partner accounts with the goal of growing marketplace revenue for each partner
  • Work with Manifold’s Growth team on partner-targeted marketing content and programs
  • Act as the primary advocate for our partners’ interests within Manifold

What you’ll need

Qualifications:

  • Strong knowledge of the developer tools/cloud infrastructure space and competitive landscape.
  • A strong network of contacts in the developer tools/cloud infrastructure space.
  • Motivated by a quota-carrying sales role.
  • Pioneer. This is a new role for us. You’re comfortable refining the role and related programs as we go.
  • Strong presentation & pitch skills.
  • Strong relationship skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience working remotely/async in a global, distributed team.

We’re looking for

Core Skills:

Account Management Business Development Partner Management PartnershipsSales Sales Management

A little bit about us

Manifold

We’re a venture-backed company that is distributed around North America. Our home base is Halifax, Nova Scotia. We have a shared passion for making developers’ lives easier. Our backgrounds reflect that, having worked at npm, Red Hat, Heroku, LinkedIn, Canonical, and more.

We offer:

  • flexible working hours
  • 15 days of vacation your first year that you will be encouraged to use
  • statutory/federal holidays, plus the whole company takes the last week of the year off
  • yearly professional development allowance of $2,000 towards education, training, conferences, or any education tool that helps your career
  • excellent health, vision, and dental insurance for you and your family that starts on your first day of work
  • health and wellness allowance
  • home office allowance for remote workers
  • up to 16 weeks fully paid maternity or paternity leave after one year at Manifold, with additional 8 weeks of unpaid leave if necessary
  • use of a laptop, large monitor, and equipment for everyone, remote or at our office

If you’re in the United States, we also offer 401(k) for pre-tax retirement savings, although contributions are unmatched at this early stage in the company’s growth.

We care about our code of conduct and ask all of our employees to abide by it.

Apply for job

items.title: Middle Office Operations Manager
items.content:
Middle office operations manager


VentureFounders gives its members exclusive access to investments in some of the UK's highest growth, B2B and B2B2C technology companies. Our portfolio includes some of the UK's leading tech success stories.


nFiniti Limited is a SAAS platform that enables clients to rapidly deploy and manage complex regulated payment flows, undertake KYC and provide custodial services. These services appeal to a wide range of customers in the regulated space (P2P, PE/VC, wealth management, project financing, P2P, crowdfunding, secondary trading, insurance), the unregulated market (escrow, market places, sharing economy) as well as the humanitarian sector and charities. 


Reporting to the CEO, the successful candidate will be responsible for matters relating to aspects of the businesses of VentureFounders and nFiniti.


The successful individual will interact with a variety of core areas within the company and for the right individual there is the opportunity to gain a diverse range of financial, regulatory and legal experience and knowledge.


Role, duties and responsibilities


Investment Support



  • Facilitate funding of deals (co-ordinating signing of documents, fee calculations, invoices, updating investor records, collecting share certificates, preparing EIS data, collecting and distributing EIS certificates)


Accounts Support



  • Review and query purchase invoices

  • Resolve issues relating to expenses claims

  • Prepare weekly/monthly sale invoices and manage cash collections

  • Manage VentureFounders’ client bank accounts


Compliance/Client Money and Asset Reconciliation



  • Assist with regulatory filings (FCA, ICO, HMRC, Companies House, etc.)

  • Perform client money/asset reconciliations and investigate discrepancies

  • Implementing the processes and procedures to ensure compliance with client money and asset regulations.

  • Produce management information for FCA filing requirements (i.e. GABRIEL/CMAR filing requirements)

  • Assist with the preparation of management accounts and year end budgets

  • Manage VentureFounders’/nFiniti’s anti-money laundering processes

  • Manage certain aspects of nFiniti’s custodial business.


HR Support



  • Maintain employee records

  • Manage and co-ordinate employee 1-2-1s and appraisals

  • Co-ordinate training plans for employees

  • Draft, review and issue agreements with recruitment agencies.

  • Liaise with senior management to keep up to date with progress on recruitment and to ensure you are contributing to the recruitment process. This may include writing job descriptions, preparing interview questions and benchmarking salaries.

  • Manage the on-boarding and induction of new employees.

  • Draft, review and issue consultancy agreements for contractors or service companies.

  • Actively participate in strategic HR initiatives and departmental activities/projects as directed by senior management.


Miscellaneous



  • Co-ordinate the renewal of insurance policies (PI, contents insurance, etc.)

  • Liaise with suppliers (including managing remote secretary)

  • Maintain company registers


Person Specification



  • Self-starter, team-player able to work in a small team

  • Attention to detail

  • Quick-learner, problem solver and adaptable;

  • Hardworking and dependable

  • Experience in financial services industry

  • Knowledge of the FCA’s client asset and money rules are helpful but not essential

  • Proven technical ability

  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate at all levels

  • Middle/Back office financial services experience preferred

items.content:
Director, IT Operations and Infrastructure at Elastic.co

Remote

Location: Distributed, US

Elastic is a search company with a simple goal: to solve the world’s data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the creators of the Elastic Stack, we help thousands of organizations including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, Verizon, and many more use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what’s possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We have a distributed team of Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting), and our diverse open source community spans over 100 countries. Learn more at elastic.co

To support our continued growth we’re looking for a Director to lead our global IT Operations and Infrastructure team. This is a distributed role which can be located anywhere in the USA.

What You Will Be Doing:

This Director will craft the strategy, planning, design, delivery and operational management of all aspects of IT Operations and Infrastructure. Reporting to the Global VP of IT, you will build upon your leadership, knowledge and experience to deliver high-quality execution, customer-focused delivery, and operational excellence necessary to sustain this dynamic, growing business.

Specifically, you will:

  • Create strategic direction and oversight for the design, development, operation and support of processes and systems that fulfill the needs of the business in alignment with our distributed by design model
  • Implement policies, processes, procedures, automation and controls to consistently deliver high-quality service in a cost-effective manner
  • Build and develop a global, flexible, proactive, high-impact team
  • Plan and prioritize initiatives and drive the evaluation, deployment, and management of forward-looking infrastructure solutions to deliver automated, scalable, and reliable outcomes
  • Design and implement necessary security, SOC, SOX and IT policies and controls
  • Define and direct global help desk processes, systems, operations, and delivery using metrics, actionable trending, and critical metrics
  • Develop and maintain budgets that align with plans and service levels, improving value over cost ratio

What You Bring Along:

  • You have 10+ years of IT Ops and Infrastructure experience with 5+ years running global, cloud-first Ops/Infrastructure. On-premise managers need not apply.
  • You have both implemented and maintained a cloud-first application and infrastructure environment ideally at a larger scale organization than Elastic is today (~1600 employees).

In addition, you have/are:

  • Confirmed operational experience effectively evaluating, crafting, implementing and running 24×7 services (e.g. audio/web/video-conferencing, VOIP, network, server, helpdesk, laptop management) and associated vendors for a global IT infrastructure
  • Strong knowledge of architecture, design, implementation, and operations using cloud first solutions (e.g. OKTA, GitHub, Zoom, GSuite, Slack, JAMF)
  • Strong passion for user experience and delivering beyond the status quo
  • Experience developing talent and leading global and remote teams
  • Critical and structured thinking as well as executive-level influence to formulate and obtain broad support for proposed IT strategies and plans
  • Knowledge of security frameworks, technical designs and operational controls is desired
  • Experience with ITIL services and infrastructure processes and integrating them into an effective global operation
  • Highly collaborative and accountable

Additional Information:

We provide:

  • Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary.
  • Equity
  • Global minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave (moms & dads).
  • Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off.
  • An environment in which you can balance satisfying work with a great life.
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.
  • Distributed-first company with Elasticians in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages.
Apply for job

items.title: Project Coordinator
items.content:
Project Coordinator at Aadmi Consulting

Remote | International

(REMOTE)

  • 47 Winter St, Boston, MA 02108, USA
  • Full-time

Company Description

Aadmi Consulting is a full lifecycle human resources consulting firm. Our clients expect quality support with their global expansion and retraction strategies, and draw from Aadmi and its partners, every aspect of global operations. We offer a fast paced, challenging, and rewarding work environment and we strive to be the best at what we do, one engagement at a time.

Job Description

The Project Coordinator assists in organizing projects, product owners, and engagements with our global partners. The core responsibilities include:

Project Coordination

  • Attend opportunity sizing discussions with the sales team and partners.
  • Engage in client proposal development, taking ownership of partner quotations.
  • Establish project plans in Aadmi’s project software, engaging relevant team members.

Project Implementation

  • Engage with clients for project onboarding meetings.
  • Oversee the implementation of work done by partners, ensuring that activities production schedules and client expectations are met.
  • Report project progress to clients, partners, and internal stakeholders.

Partnership Monitoring and Reporting

  • Maintain partners, partner opportunities, and partner sales in CRM.
  • Work in conjunction with Sales/Partners to move leads through sales progression from initial discussion to closure and implementation.
  • Report on internal key metrics such as to activity metrics, revenue share, lead generation, etc.
  • Work with internal groups and partners to troubleshoot issues arising through the implementation or integration processes.

In addition, the Project Coordinator supports both the consulting and software teams, as needed.

This is a remote position and we are accepting applications from anywhere in the world. Fluent and proficient English, verbal and in writing, is required. Strong communication and tech savviness is a must.

Qualifications

Education / Experience

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Exposure to working with people from different countries and backgrounds
  • Domain knowledge (Global Human Resources, Benefits, Payroll, etc.) is an asset

Professional Skills Required

  • Competency in project management
  • Well-organized and able to handle multiple tasks and changing priorities
  • Strong communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills
  • Excellent writing and synthesis skills
  • Knowledge of another language is an asset (oral, written)

Personal skills

  • Excellent in building relationship and representation
  • Adaptable and flexible
  • Strong autonomy, with a team working focus
  • Stress resistant

This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:

  • Dependable — more reliable than spontaneous
  • People-oriented — enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects
  • Adaptable/flexible — enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction
  • Detail-oriented — would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture
  • Achievement-oriented — enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail
  • Autonomous/Independent — enjoys working with little direction
  • Innovative — prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativity
Apply for job

items.title: Director of Wireless Systems and Networks - Remote
items.content:
1.) Client has an extensive screening process for all candidates to verify core competencies with the required disciplines that have been documented in this job description.

2.) Applicants must be US Citizens.

3.) Please be sure that all your experience is documented on your resume that clearly demonstrates your qualifications to this position.

4.) Client will only consider candidates with a stable job history with few changes over one s career.

~ Position Overview ~

The location for this position is flexible Remote work, located anywhere from NYC to Washington, DC

Relocation Paid: Negotiable

Salary: $140,000.00 - $185,000.00 - US Dollars - Yearly

Employment Type: Full Time / Direct Hire

Degree Required: University - Bachelor's Degree/3-4 Year Degree - Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Physics, Computer Science

US citizens only! Must have or be able to obtain a TS clearance or higher!

The location for this position is flexible to anywhere on the East Coast till Washington, DC .

Why is This a Great Opportunity?

  • This individual can be located anywhere from NYC to DC and work at home. Of key importance is the person have a strong technical background in wireless communications and also have experience bidding on and winning contracts with DARPA, CERDEC, AFRL or similar agencies.

Client is more than a research lab; they are an innovation hub. They have an entrepreneurial spirit molding technology of the future. They are involved in cybersecurity, data analytics, advanced networking, wireless and mobility, display technologies, optical and quantum, power grid and IoT security, and electronic warfare. The industries they work in include smart cities and smart phones, intelligent battlefields and autonomous systems, telecommunications, energy, finance, government, life sciences and defense. They have 225 scientists, engineers and analysts on staff, 260+ issued, licensed and pending patents. They have more than 125 PhD's on staff, 40+ collaborations with universities, research organizations and vendors. Additionally they have 100+ on-going customer-funded research and technology programs.

Job Description:

  • Develop a unified technical and business strategy for the Wireless Systems and Networks department,
  • Expand both the business and customer base of the department,
  • Ensure successful execution of projects and transition of technologies to downstream customers,
  • Line management, including recruiting, hiring and professional staff development, and
  • Collaborate with other managers within the company to ensure the overall success of the organization
  • ** Must be able to obtain a TS clearance or higher.

Qualifications:

  • Requires BA/BS with 12 to15 years, with at least six plus years as a manager.
  • Incumbent will have a specialized knowledge in one or more fields of disciplines and general knowledge in a number of others.

Preferred:

  • Ph.D. in Engineering or Applied Physics or M.S. in Engineering with required experience.
  • Experience in Wireless Systems research, in areas such as RF Signal Processing, digital communications, wireless networking, including network control and optimization.

- provided by Dice

items.title: ViPR Storage Resource Manager (100% Remote)
items.content:
ViPR Storage Resource Manager
Duration: 12 months to start with extension possibility
Engagement: Can sit 100% remote but may be asked to travel 2-4 times a year.
In this role you will be responsible for ViPR software technical support and more importantly, report creation in the tool. Position will require extensive knowledge of ViPR SRM tool as well as using various pivot tables and data bases. Customer interaction and great interpersonal skills are a MUST.
Daily responsibilities will include:
  • Troubleshooting and coordination of tasks to resolve technical issues. This would include working with internal and Dell EMC support teams.
  • Weekly and Monthly reorting on ticketing activities and other areas of importance impacting the software performance
  • Preparing for and alerting teams of potential upgrades taking place.
  • Being a thought leader of ViPR and proactively addressing future needs
  • Most importantly, building various reporting tools within the ViPR for accurate visibility and forecasting to make future data center decisions.
About TEKsystems:
We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call -3411 or email .com for other accommodation options.
