items.content:
Director of UI/UX

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Cybersecurity, Enterprise Software, Security Software
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: ThreatConnect, Inc. | Arlington, VA

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time
Office Location: Arlington, VA. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

user-experience
user-interface
reactjs
javascript
api

Job description

Director of UI/UX

Company Description

Designed by analysts but built for the entire team (security operations, threat intelligence, incident response and security leadership), ThreatConnect’s intelligence-driven security operations platform is the only solution available today with intelligence, automation, analytics, and workflows in a single platform. Centralize your intelligence, establish process consistency, scale operations, and measure your effectiveness in one place. To learn more about our threat intelligence platform (TIP) or security orchestration, automation, and response (SOAR) solutions, visit ThreatConnect.com.

Job Description 

ThreatConnect, Inc. is looking for a passionate UI/UX leader who is skilled at driving the creative process and design teams from concept through execution. This role directs and oversees the implementation of policies and procedures for the User Interface and User Experience Team. Must demonstrate the ability to work closely with Project Management, Quality Assurance, Customer Success and Engineering Teams to develop and execute overall platform UI/UX strategies. Must have the ability to clearly define and implement steps required to improve the development process. Must be capable of resolving escalated issues arising from business operations and requiring coordination with other departments. . 

Required Qualifications:

  • 10+ years experience developing UX ideally on large scale enterprise level web based applications
  • Work closely with project managers, subject matter experts and software engineers to be an integral part of solving complex system level challenges
  • Collaborate across teams to understand how our customers use our software
  • Lead and manage a team of global software engineers to successfully deliver high quality products
  • Excellent people management skills to collaborate with colleagues and cross-functional teams

Desired Qualifications:

  • Proven experience delivering concepts, personas, user journeys, storyboards, user flows, wireframes, prototypes
  • In-depth understanding of UI/UX methodologies and best practices
  • Comprehensive UI leading design practices for Responsive Web Design, reusable UI patterns, and intuitive navigation
  • Ability to work effectively as part of both small teams and larger formal groups
  • Ability to prioritize and adapt rapidly to changing business conditions
  • Ability to assess risk and use industry best practices for releasing quality software to customers
  • Working knowledge of J2EE and API driven technology stack
  • Working knowledge of Frontend Javascript frameworks such as Angular, React, or VueJs
  • Working knowledge of Agile/Scrum

BENEFITS

Work-Life Balance:

  • 10 Paid Federal Holidays
  • Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO) for vacation/sick, time
  • Your birthday off
  • Employee recognition program with quarterly awards
  • Employee referral program
  • Military leave options available
  • Education reimbursement program for job-related college courses and professional training
  • Company-provided refreshments at our headquarters
  • Quarterly events with your geographic team
  • Annual company party

Medical:

  • MEDICAL PREMIUM FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES ARE 100% COVERED
  • Prescription drug coverage
  • Dental coverage
  • Vision coverage
  • Company-paid short term and long term disability
  • Company-paid insurance and AD&D coverage

Financial:

  • 401K retirement savings plan with company matching program up to 6%
  • Health Savings Account
  • Flexible Spending Accounts (medical, dependent care, transit and parking)
  • Cell phone stipend
Apply now

About ThreatConnect, Inc.

Does analyzing cyber threats excite you? Do you build your own software programs just because it’s fun? Are you searching for a challenging work environment and the excitement of a startup? Do you want to work alongside the best and brightest in the security industry? Look no further. We offer our employees the ability to go above and beyond the day-to-day drudgery and manage our flagship product, ThreatConnect®. We offer a comprehensive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, benefits, PTO and the potential for equity.

We are focused on keeping companies and people safe. Our company was founded on the belief that there was a better way to approach cybersecurity. Our ThreatConnect threat intelligence platform was built for anyone to use, and all of our users from our free accounts to paid versions benefit from our collaborative and powerful platform.

ARE YOU READY TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE?

We are always searching for highly skilled and dedicated engineering, sales, and marketing staff to join our growing team. We are hiring for our Cyber Squared consulting services, our ThreatConnect product development and engineering, our ThreatConnect Intelligence Research Team (TCIRT) and many other positions. The TCIRT is the research arm of ThreatConnect and is responsible for tracking existing and emerging threats on a daily basis, often sharing highly contextualized and dynamic threat intelligence to our global customers across public and private ThreatConnect communities.

We want motivated, passionate, and excited team members to join us and continue to develop, advance and discover a better way of doing things. If you are self-motivated, a problem-solver, and able to work efficiently from home and within a team environment, then we want you.

Benefits

  • 100% Medical/Dental/Vision Coverage
  • Paid Time Off
  • 401k Match (Up to 6%)
  • Work-Life Balance
  • Office Snacks & Drinks
  • Remote Friendly
  • Annual Company Parties and Quarterly Events with Team
  • Educational or Professional Development Reimbursement
  • Employee Recognition Programs
  • Military Leave Option

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
SDLC, B2B SaaS Software, B2B data integrations, Client Facing, System Configuration, Technical Consulting Experience, ETL File Process, Web Services, API, web & mobile product development

If you are a seeking a REMOTE Director of Product Management with experience, please read on! Due to our continued growth, we have an amazing opportunity for an experienced Director of Product Management! All our team works REMOTE; in this role you'll be serving as an active contributor though integration and data conversion of multiple SaaS products for the healthcare market.

What You Will Be Doing

- Serve as a leader that is accountable for the performance of the product
- Manage the entire body of work for on time delivery that is within budget
- Create and execute strategies for the functional and operational objectives
- Complete understanding of report generation and workflow management systems
- Complete development of the overall product strategy, managing all aspect of product development which includes budgeting, forecasting, and ROI and KPI tracking
- Manage product team
- Use of Lean and Scrum principles to guide strategy and process frameworks
- Collaborate with Sales and Development teams to ensure proper alignment of product and client needs
- Perform extensive research - interacting with current and prospective customers on a regular basis - for product development and iterations
- Identity market opportunities, building and prioritizing business cases, and seeing all product initiatives to completion

What You Need for this Position

More Than 7 Years of experience and the following:

- Enterprise B2B SaaS software product management
- Previous experience in a manger/leadership position
- Managing SaaS products in an Agile/Scrum environment
- Systems Development Life Cycles
- Market research and product development
- Previous experience in large & early-stage companies
- Established track record for attracting, recruiting and mentoring high quality talent
- Complete understanding of the challenges, demands, and priorities of a small company, successful operating in these environments during periods of significant growth
- Python experience

What's In It for You

- Ability to work REMOTE
- Vacation/PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- 401kSo, if you are a Director of Product Management with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

items.title: Construction Project Manager, Remote option
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Our Exciting Work Environment

Remote work opporutnity with up to 50% travel. The Opportunity

The Construction Project Manager has top level accountability for all construction projects (generally between 5-8 at a time), with travel to our site locations across the US and Canada of up to 50% Ultimately responsible for the timeliness, completeness, quality, and cost of the project from the pre-design phase through completion. Responsible for establishing a positive and effective relationship with key contacts at our units and to ensure at all times, the delivery of quality of workmanship and excellence in customer service. Responsible for maintaining relationships with architects and construction managers on assigned projects.

In this role, you will manage and ensure the Construction Project Managers and administrative staff on the project are completely fullfilling all aspects of their responsibilities. Coordinate with and advise the Construction Project Managers on the establishment and maintenance of the Master Progress Schedule, incorporating dates and times for decisions, availability of design information, procurement of materials and contracts, lead times for fabrication and field installations. Provide guidance to the Construction Project Managers in the administration of the project documents, ensuring the accuracy and completeness of all documents. Ensure that all projects under the positions direction are administered in compliance with all relevant laws and regulations including those related to insurance, safety, labor relations, EEOC and taxes. Provide senior management with regular reports summarizing progress on the project, financial status and perceived level of satisfaction. Coordinate with senior management on the assignment of staff to specific project teams, taking into consideration staff capabilities, locations, staff training, developments, unit/architect preferences, timing and other considerations as appropriate.

Education, Experience, & Skills:
  • A 4 year degree in Engineering or Architecture is required, MBA a plus.
  • The ideal candidate must have at least 6-8 years hands on experience in the commercial construction management field, with a minimum of 4 years experience in commercial project management.
  • Experience with construction of restaurants or casinos is a plus.
  • Demonstrated commitment to exceeding expectations in the delivery of safe, quality, cost efficient and timely service.
  • Demonstrated problem solving skills, ability to face challenging situations, view from a variety of different angles; assess strength of options, select and implement the best solutions. Ability to think on your feet, making effective decisions on a timely basis, sometimes with limited information.
  • Outstanding written, verbal, public speaking, and presentation skills.
  • Working knowledge of contract and municipal law.
  • Competency in project management and/or scheduling software such as MS Project, Suretrack, and Primavera is a plus. Must have experience using MS Office.


Who We Are

Take your career beyond the ordinary-to the extraordinary.

At Delaware North, you-ll love where you work, who you work with, and how your day unfolds. Whether it-s in sporting venues, casinos, airports, national parks, iconic hotels, or premier restaurants, there-s no telling where your career can ultimately take you. We empower you to do great work in a company with 100 years of success, stability and growth. If you have drive and enjoy the thrill of making things happen - share our vision, grow with us.

Delaware North is one of the largest privately held hospitality companies in the world. Founded in 1915 and owned by the Jacobs family for more than 100 years, Delaware North has global operations at high-profile places such as sports and entertainment venues, national and state parks, destination resorts and restaurants, airports, and regional casinos. Our 55,000 employee associates are dedicated to creating special experiences one guest at a time in serving more than a half-billion guests annually. Delaware North operates in the sports, travel hospitality, restaurant and catering, parks, resorts, gaming, and specialty retail industries and has annual revenue of about $3 billion. Learn more about Delaware North, a global leader in hospitality, at .

All applicants will be subject to a pre-employment background check and may be subject to a pre-employment drug test depending upon the position and/or client requirements.

Delaware North Companies, Incorporated and its subsidiaries consider applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. Delaware North is an equal opportunity employer.
